loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 59-year-old married lady. She runs a green grocery in Jomvu, Mombasa. She has been in this business for the last six years. This is Jackline’s second time borrowing to finance her business, which is doing well. With this loan, she plans to add to her stock of vegetables and fruits for her business. The anticipated profits that will be generated from the loan will be plowed back into the gradual expansion of the business and the repayment of the loan. Her dream is to become a successful businessperson.

loans.use: add more stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Enriqueta Carolina

texts.es:
Enriqueta carolina tiene 51 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 22 y 19 años de edad en Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.

LA VRC MONTE DE LOS OLIVOS, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina conformada por 14 socios y socias. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, naranja y cacao.

Enriqueta se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, naranja y cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es tener un camión  grande para transportar el maíz para venderlo.
En los tiempos libres le gusta  compartir momentos con la comunidad hacer reuniones para beneficio de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Enriqueta Carolina is 51 years old and living in a common law relationship.  She has two children.  She lives with her husband and children who are 22 and 19 years old in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Monte de los Olivos” communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from this office.  It has 14 members, men and women.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn, orange and cocoa bean farming.

Enriqueta is a corn, orange and cocoa bean farmer.  Her purchases and her sales take place in Chillanes Canton.  She’s asking for the loan to buy seeds and farming supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to maintain her crops in good condition.

The loan will be very helpful because she’ll be able to improve her quality of life.  The challenges she faces are frequent: competition and pests.  Her dream is to buy a large truck to transport her corn to market.  In her free time she likes to share moments with her community and to have meetings for the benefit of the community.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is aged 53 and carries out farming in Murang'a Central Kenya. He has been in active farming for 20 years and currently employs two farmhands and produces milk and tea which he sells to the local market. He also runs a retail shop in the local market for additional income. He is married with 3 adult children.

James has made a loan request of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy pigs for a venture into pig farming business. He says his pig business will grow due to high costs of beef and the low number of farmers in the business. His focus is to run a sustainable farming business.

He laments of high costs of feeds but glad Juhudi Kilimo is offering much needed help.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.ru: Комилджон способный молодой человек. Он женат, отец четверых детей. Дети маленькие. Содержать семью в достатке нелегко. Он трудолюбивый. Комилджон занимается евроремонтом квартир и частных домов. Это очень востребованный вид услуг. Он хочет получить 350 долларов США для приобретения орудия труда- перфоратора. Он надеется, то добрые люди отзовутся и протянут руку помощи. Он благодарен тем, кто предоставит ему займ для приобретения перфоратора. Спасибо.
texts.en: Komiljon is a capable young man. He is married and is a father of four children. His children are small. It is difficult to provide for the family in abundance. He is hardworking. Komiljon does remodeling of apartments and private homes. His services are in high demand. He wants to take out a loan in the amount of $350 USD to buy punching tools. He hopes that kind people will respond and lend a helping hand. He is thanking those who will provide him with the loan to buy the tools. Thank you.

loans.use: to purchase punching tools.

loans.name: Gadoi

texts.ru: Гадои житель города Куляб. Ему 51 год. Он женат. У него четверо детей. По профессии она врач. В этой области она 17 лет. В основном он лечит больных народной медициной, разными травами. Также он занимается развозкой пассажиров по городу. Кредит берет для ремонта своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Gadoi lives in Kulob. He is 51 years old, married and has four children. He is a trained physician and has been working as a doctor for the last 17 years. Gadoi uses alternative medicine approaches, such as various herbs and supplements. To supplement the family's income he also works as a taxi driver. Gadoi is taking out this loan to repair his taxi cab.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. She belongs to the third gender.

Rosita is providing pedicab or trisikad services. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools for the repair of the pedicab. Rosita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Rosita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools for the repair of pedicab

loans.name: Lou

texts.en:
Lou is a 43-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 4 children between the ages of 7 and 15, all of whom go to school. 

Lou has run a food store for 10 years. He has 1 employee. Lou heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officers’ promotion in the market. He is taking a loan of SDG 3000 to purchase more items like milk, soda, eggs, soap, Nomi (a brand of detergent), and many others. Aside from this business, Lou has no other source of income. 

In 5 years' time, Lou hopes to open another shop and build a house. His major challenges include his low income and home upkeep.

Lou says that he appreciates Finance Sudan’s efforts in South Sudan for uplifting them financially.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Ningale

texts.en:
Ningale is  65-year-old and married .She has been selling fish for her business for the last one year. 

This is her first loan since she was introduced to KADET recently. She plans to use the loan to purchase more fish for sale. The anticipated profits will be used to buy more stocks of fish and repay her loan. 

His hopes are to realize more profits from the sales and thus be able to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more fish.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is a widow and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and other equipment for fishing.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to buy an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipment for fishing.

loans.name: Junie

texts.en:
Junie is 48 years old. He has 4 children and his main activity is bamboo chair making and renting premises. He has had these businesses for some years and they are doing well. Junie has many customers who seek him out because of his good service and attention. He is a a very responsible man and is dedicated to his business. He is requesting the loan to pay for bamboo, hammers, saws, hacksaws, etc so that he can keep his business going and make the income necessary to keep raising his family.
His dream is to be able to give his children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase materials to more bamboo chairs to sell etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth B. is a lady who cooks and sells a favourite dish of Ghanaian society.  This dish, kenkey (dokono), is not often prepared in homes. She is currently engaged in this on a very small scale but wishes to expand due to the high demand. She is therefore seeking a loan of $725.00 from Kiva to enable her do this. She is very hardworking and can pay back the loan.

loans.use: working capital to expand her food sales

loans.name: Toyibah

texts.en: T. is 24 years old and is married with one child, aged 3. She sells ice blended in front of her house. She usually earns a profit of $1.5 per day whereas her husband, Sukron, is a fisherman whose  income is unfixed, earning only $2 - $3 per day.  She very much needs to have loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Viadi

texts.en: Vidadi T. (his employee is pictured) owns a cellphone store in the town of Khachmaz which is located on the North East coast of Azerbaijan. Vidadi is looking for funding in order to increase the quantity and variety of his inventory.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of his store

loans.name: Ten

texts.en: Mrs. Ten S. is 24 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She works selling a variety of fruits, giving her $4/day income.  Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and can earn $2/day.  This loan will be used to purchase more fruits for her business.  She hopes she can continue to expand her business so that she can support her children.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit for her business

loans.name: Oscar Alejandro

texts.es:
Oscar is 26 years old; he is single and he comes from San Nicolas de los Garza, Nuevo Leon. His desire to succeed propelled him into starting his own business six years ago. He started out by selling sandals that were sent by a friend from the United States. Soon after that, he added clothing retail to his venture and that move made his business grow further. Fortunately, sales increased steadily and he was able to open up a store while maintaining outlets at local street markets.

Oscar wishes to keep his business growing and now he requests a loan in the amount of US$1200.00. It will be used to purchase furniture and fixtures that will improve his store's appearance and to purchase the structure necessary to continue attending street markets. He commits to repaying this loan within 6 months. Oscar sincerely appreciates the trust and support received.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Oscar tiene 26 años de edad, está soltero y es originario de San Nicolás de los Garza en Nuevo León, los deseos que tiene de salir adelante lo motivaron a emprender su propio negocio hace seis años, comenzó vendiendo sandalias que un familiar le enviaba desde Estados Unidos y poco después incorporó la venta de ropa, con lo que hizo crecer su negocio, afortunadamente sus ventas se incrementaban constantemente y logró abrir una boutique, además continuar instalándose en los mercados rodantes.

Oscar desea continuar creciendo con su negocio y ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mobiliario para poder darle un mejor aspecto a su local, así como adquirir una estructura para el puesto que tiene en el mercado, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Oscar agradece sinceramente la confianza y apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: Compra de mobiliario

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en: Ochilov Shuhrat runs his own business selling DVDs. He is not married and lives with his parents. He has been engaged in this business for over 6 years. During this time, he has been able to attract many clients with his professional service. All clients are satistifed with their interactions with him, as he always is polite and ready to meet all their needs. They said that he completes his orders and meets his commitments more quickly than others in the same business. Thus, his business gets larger every month. He plans to spend his next loan on increasing the volume of his disks on sale. He does not want to lose his clients and for this purpose, wants to increase the assortment of disks he has to sell.

loans.use: To expand his volume of DVDs for sale

loans.name: Ulalia

texts.en: Ulalia is 40 years old and from Tulaele. She has four children. She is one of the best-known tailors in her village and the surrounding villages. Ulalia specializes in sewing puletasi (the traditional Samoan garment worn by women), t-shirts and any other kind of style. She also makes beautiful and unique elei (traditional Samoan fabrics) prints for individuals and groups or organizations, like church youth. Her husband also earns extra income for their family from his work.  Ulalia is looking forward to this loan so she can expand her sewing business and improve her home.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Riya

texts.en:
Mrs. Riya Y., age 51, and her husband, Hem Phun, have been married since 1979. They have five children, one son and four daughters. Three of their children are working, and the other two are studying in a local school. Riya and her family live along National Road Number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been selling fruit since 1980. She buys the fruit from farms to resell at a market in the village. Her husband has been a house constructor since 1985.

Riya is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the second time, in the amount of $1,000. She will use this money to repair her house.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Chern

texts.en: Mrs. Chern K., 56, is a mother of seven children and works selling a variety of fruits at Neak Loeung market, Preyveng, Cambodia. She typically makes about $5 each day in revenue. Her husband works as a carpenter and can make around $5 a day when he is asked to build a wooden house or make wooden furniture. Moreover, one of her children is currently employed by a garment factory; another one works selling a variety of grocery products,  The rest are married and live outside the family home. Mrs. Chern Khorn is requesting the loan of $1200 to  buy the fruit stand she is currently renting.  In truth, the rental fee she pays at the end of each month makes it very difficult to save money.

loans.use: To buy a stand at the market.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
Luis Alfonso T. is the proprietor of a convenience store: the history of his business began a year ago when he saw published in the paper an announcement publicizing the opportunity to operate a convenience store and he decided to do it in order to have a better source of income.

He needs a modest loan of $475 USD which will be repaid in five months in order to expand his business through purchasing more merchandise. Alfonso will be very grateful for your help.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Luis Alfonso T. es comisionista de una tienda de conveniencia, la historia de su negocio comenzó hace un año cuando vio publicado en el periódico un anuncio donde se ofrecía la oportunidad de tener una tienda de conveniencia y decidió hacerlo para tener una mejor fuente de ingresos.

El requiere de un apoyo económico de US $475 que pagara en 5 meses para hacer crecer su negocio comprando mercancía. Alfonso agradecerá tu ayuda.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is a married man and the father of five children. He is fifty-seven years old. Two of his children are attending the university. Jimmy sells phone cards, polythene bags, washing soaps, etc.

Many people in his community use mobile phones, but they are not able to buy units (credit). Therefore, he wants to use his loan to buy credit transfer chips to enable him to sell credit in smaller and cheaper units to mobile phone users. He wants to use the profit from his increased business to support his children, who are currently in the university.

Jimmy is a member of the group called "Anointed." Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy phone cards and GSM units (credit) transfer chips.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is an experienced entrepreneur from Simferopol, Ukraine. She has a small business selling inexpensive women’s clothing; generally, she sells such clothing at a large outdoor market in Simferopol, but she sometimes sells the clothing in another nearby city. Tatyana has been self-employed for the past ten years. She is divorced and lives with her son, who is 20 years old. Her business provides a good income for her; to illustrate, in a typical month she sells about $2,400 worth of clothing and makes approximately $750 in profit.

Tatyana has requested a loan to help open a new location in which to sell her clothing. She would like to see her business grow and she hopes to increase her profits by opening the additional location. This is Tatyana’s second loan with Nadiya Ukraine. We are glad to have this opportunity to support her business endeavors and look forward to seeing her business prosper in the future.

loans.use: To open a new location in which to sell her clothing

loans.name: Safura

texts.en: Safura is 35 years old and is the mother of four children. All her children are in school. She cooks rice and vegetables and sells in the local market to busy  traders.  She treks to northern Ghana to buy the rice and supplies to others in the cooking business. She also cooks some to make additional income. Due to high transport costs, Safura wants to buy more bags of rice, cartons of frozen fish and vegetables to avoid price hikes and increase inventory for a better income. She is a member of the group called Exodus. Members agree to guarantee one another for the re-payment of loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, frozen fish and vegetables

loans.name: Lizzeth Margarita

texts.es:
Lizeth is 30 years old and married with 2 children, a 12 year old daughter and a 7 year old son. She and her husband want to give their children a good education and ensure them a bright future.

Lizeth works selling clothing and cometics; she also works as a domestic employee three days a week. She has 11 years of experience in sales. When she started the business she sold only cosmetics. She plans to one day open a store. With this loan she will expand her inventory by buying gold plated jewelry, as a way to begin to put together her store little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Lizeth tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, una niña de 12 años y un varón de 7 años, a los que como todo padre desea darles estudios y asegurarles un futuro mejor.

Lizeth se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos y tres días a la semana labora como empleada doméstica. Tiene 11 años de experiencia en las ventas e inició vendiendo solamente cosméticos. Sus planes son llegar a poner una tienda, con el crédito otorgado expandirá su oferta, comprará oro laminado para empezar la comercialización de éste y así empezar a formar su tienda poco a poquito.

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry, such as gold plated items.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena, age 44, is a widow and mother of eight children. Through her business, she has been able to support two children to complete high school. Helena enjoys selling goods, the trade through which she obtains her daily source of income. She is a petty merchant who trades in vegetables and fruits in the local market. Helena has good customer service, and because of that many customers buy from her stand. However, she buys her supplies on credit at relatively high prices for lack of adequate working capital. With this loan, she wants to purchase bulk supplies of vegetables and fruits to serve her customers. She belongs to the community group called Adekyensroma Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee loans for one another as social collateral.

loans.use: To purchase bulk supplies of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Betty Petrona

texts.en:
Betty and her husband live in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. They have one 18-year-old son, whom they support financially, and they are taking out this loan together to pay for repairs on the taxi they own. The couple earns income by renting the taxi to the driver at a fixed daily rate, and Betty's husband also works as a salesman, for which he receives a set monthly wage. They have five years of experience renting the taxi and working for the company. Since they are experienced in both areas, competition does not present a major problem.

Betty and her husband are taking out this loan to repair the taxi's motor, which will cost $400. They are refinancing a previous loan of $3,010 in order to take out their current loan. They have $1,336.86 left to repay on the previous loan, and have always made their payments on time and in full.

loans.use: Taxi repairs

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Modesta from Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children between the ages of 12 and 28; she has also taken in two dependent orphans. Modesta has been running a nursery school since 2008, where she takes care of young boys and girls and prepares them for elementary school. Modesta's business is doing well. She works at the business for six hours per day, five days a week and is assisted by three employees. Modesta currently earns about 500 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 425 USD in order to buy school equipment such as books, desks, and chalk. In the future, she plans to establish a poultry business in addition. Modesta thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy books and other supplies for her nursery school

loans.name: Arsala Shouqat Masih Group

texts.en:
Arsala baji is the wife of S. M. and lives in a city named Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeats. She has been living in this city for the past 15 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.

Arsala baji’s husband works in a school as a guard but he has a part time job also. He drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Arsala baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Ashran baji and Sharifan baji each want a loan to buy leather to re-sell. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy chickens to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Leang C., 31, and her husband, Vuthy Sem, 39, who live in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1993 and have four daughters. One of their daughters is a garment factory worker, two daughters attend school and the fourth is still too young to attend. Beside their children, her father also lives with them.
Leang is a housewife. Her husband (not pictured) has been driving a motorbike taxi in Phnom Penh for about ten years. Prior to that, he was a “cyclo,” or bicycle taxi, driver. Motorbike taxis are by far the most common form of transportation in Phnom Penh. Leang’s husband leaves their house at 4:00 A.M. and returns around 6:00 P.M. In a typical day he makes about 20,000 Riel (US $5.00). Leang is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a cow for raising.

loans.use: To purchase cow for raising.

loans.name: Seib

texts.en: Mrs. Seib S. who is a villager in Chek village in Kandal province is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer because her field is infertile. She plans to use the rest of the loan to hire a laborer to work on the rice field. Mrs. Seib S. is a 44-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a pork seller in the local market while the other helps her on the plantation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to amend her field

loans.name: Juma's Group

texts.en: N. Juma is a member of Kyosiga group in Kayunga, Uganda.  He is a married man with 8 children, 6 of whom are in school, while he caters for 5 young orphans that stay with his mother in the village. He is a butcher selling all sorts of meat including beef and goat, as well as a farmer growing maize, beans, cassava, and coffee.  At the same time, he has a motorcycle ‘boda boda’ taxi business. He has over 20 years of experience in all his businesses and he has been so successful because of the loans that help to push him further and the help of his wife who works with him. He needs his portion of the group loan to help with running all his businesses.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for a butcher shop and seeds for farming.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
ROSARIO, pertenece al Banco comunal “Vecinas Unidas”, ubicada en Jr. Guillermo Sisley  N° 372 – Distrito D. Callería, tiene 32 años D. edad, con 02 hijos tiene una tienda D. lubricante y repuesto, su esposo trabaja con elL..

El primer préstamo que recibió fue S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles con los cuales, compró una vitrina mediana, golosinas, galletas, chocolates, caramelos, waffer, gaseosas, queques, para vender en su casa. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, compró repuestos D. moto y motokar, llantas, aros, etc.; lubricantes en general, trabaja en conjunto con su esposo e hijos.

ElL. esta contenta por pertenecer y ser socia D. Manuel Ramos, gracias a Dios existe y saca D. apuros a mujeres que desea trabajar, gracias muchas gracias.
texts.en:
Rosario is a member of the community bank “Vecinas Unidas” (United Neighbors) located at Jr. Guillermo Sisley, Number 372 in the Callería district. She is 32 years old with two children. She has a motor oil and parts store. Her husband works with her.

The first loan she received was 300 Nuevos Soles (about $90 USD), which with she bought a medium glass showcase, candies, cookies, chocolates, caramels, wafers, sodas, and cake to sell from her home.

With this loan of 1,700 soles ($550 USD), she will buy motorcycle and motorcar parts, tires, etc… and general motor oils. She works together with her husband and sons.

She is happy to be a part of and a partner of ManueL. Ramos. She thanks God that it exists and gets women who want to work out of trouble. Thanks. Thanks very much.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy motorcycle and motorcar parts, tires, wheels, etc… and general motor oils

loans.name: Alfredo Abraham

texts.es:
Maria Concepcion Loza Medina esposa del señor Abraham M. aparece en la foto ya que el señor se encontraba trabajando.
La tienda se llama “Miscelanea America” ya tiene 3 años operando.Abaraham M. es supervisor de una maquiladora, el es una persona muy emprendedora que con el transcurso del tiempo fue juntando dinero para ponerle este negocio a su esposa para obrtener mas ingresos.
El señor desea comprar mas mercancia para su tienda, ya que entre mas suirtida el cliente tiene articulos que busca y asi satisfacer sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Maria Concepcion Loza Medina, the wife of Abraham M., appears in the photo because her husband was working. The store is called "Miscelanea America" and has been in operation for 3 years. Abraham M. is a supervisor in a factory and is a very enterprising person who saved money over time in order to start this business for his wife, to bring in more income. He would like to buy more merchandise for the store, because if the store offers more varied products, the customers will find what they were looking for and thus be satisfied.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise for general store

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret A. sells crates of eggs. She has been in the trade for over five years. She needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more crates of eggs to sell. Margaret is 28 years old and married with two children. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Mirbala

texts.en:
Mirbala M. is a 47-year-old farmer who keeps and breeds calves in the small village of Agsu city. Mirbala is married and has three children. He started his business when he was 20 years old, and since that time he has gained valuable experience.

Mirbala purchases calves in the livestock bazaar. Over the course of several months he fattens them up and then sells them for meat to the local restaurants. Mirbala would like to expand his business and increase his number of calves. He has applied for a 2000 USD loan to purchase four more calves.

loans.use: Purchase four calves

loans.name: Oshinowo

texts.en: Oshinowo sells tailoring supplies and she also weaves material. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase a weaving machine and tailoring supplies to sell. She is 37 years old and married with a child. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials and a weaving machine

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Anibal tiene 50 años, está casado con  Lucia de 42 años de edad .De la unión de ambos han nacido 4 hijos, todos ya son mayores de edad, solamente 2 siguen viviendo con el matrimonio mientras que los demás ya han formado su propio hogar.
Anibal es un sacrificado hombre que junto con su esposa se dedica a la a la elaboración y venta de tortas de miel, actividad que realizan desde hace 30 años atrás. 
Anibal comenta que junto con su esposa se levantan muy temprano para la elaboración  de sus tortas y una vez terminado salen a vender por diversos lugares de la ciudad de Itá ya que cuentan con varios clientes, y  éstos a su vez  venden en sus puestos de ventas que están ubicados al costado de la ruta internacional. Todos los días realizan el mismo trabajo que ya es una costumbre para ellos por que lo vienen realizando desde hace mucho tiempo atrás y se sienten muy orgullosos   porque a su vez también dan trabajo a muchas personas que venden dicho producto. 
En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de mayor cantidad de tortas de miel, como ser: miel de caña, azúcar, bicarbonato, leña, etc.
texts.en:
Anibal is 50, and he is married to Lucia who is 42. They have four grown children. Only two are living with them; the others have formed their own homes. Anibal is a man who has made sacrifices. Together with his wife, he makes and sells honey cakes. He has been doing this for thirty years. Anibal and his wife get up very early to make their cakes. Once they are done, they leave to sell in different places in the city of Itá. They now can count on various customers who then sell the cakes from their stands, which are located along the international route. Every day they do the same work, and they are accustomed to it because they have been doing it for so long. They feel very proud, because, at the same time, they are providing work for many people who sell their product. He is asking for a loan to buy basic supplies such as molasses, sugar, baking soda, wood, etc. to make a large quantity of honey cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy  sugar, honey, baking soda, wood, etc.

loans.name: Tunzala

texts.en:
Tunzala was born in 1974. She is married. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Fuzuli region and is now settled in Khirdalan town.

This kind woman sells fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for eight years. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy fruits and vegetables to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
51-year-old Elizabeth P. is a mother of three. She has been assisting her husband in their farming business since 1994. They started with a one-hectare rice field. And they are planning to buy another hectare for the expansion of their business. This is their long-term plan. But presently, the couple is trying to sustain their business. Thus, Elizabeth is applying for a loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) amounting to Php 10,000.00.

She is pleased with her membership in CEVI because aside from the loan she enjoys, she also gets to mingle with other people during their group meetings. She is able to share her feelings and faith with them in their devotional time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farming necessities

loans.name: Miller

texts.en: Miller A. is from the town of Northern Poblacion, Calamba, Mis. Occ. He is 50 years old, married, and has adult children. Miller owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Miller joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from PMPC. Miller is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be his 4th from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama G., who received primary education, has been selling smoked fish at Nyayeye near Elmina since 2001  A widow with three children, she is responsible for paying school fees and other bills. Ama's loan will be used to buy more fish for resale, and she hopes to use the new profits from her business to save money and educate her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz tiene 23 años, es una joven muy alegre, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es salir adelante en la vida. El negocio de Liz es la venta de películas, canciones, documentales, dibujos animados, etc, en formato DVD, ella aprovecha las ferias dominicales de la ciudad de Juliaca para vender sus artículos, ya que sabe que existe una gran demanda por los DVDs y es un negocio muy rentable.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede decidir cuando trabaja y cuando no, ya que también tiene que dedicarle tiempo a sus estudios. Lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que llevar sus DVDs hasta las distintas ferias, pero sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo. Para un futuro cercano desea tener una tienda de videos, con la cual obtenga mejores ingresos económicos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y está dispuesta a pagarlo puntualmente, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde participa activamente. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más DVDs, para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Maritta

texts.en:
Maritta Y., a 37-year-old woman from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental, is married and has six school-age children. To make a living, Maritta runs a food stall selling a variety of viands in her community. Maritta has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Maritta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maritta is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients for her food business. This will be Maritta's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Esperanza Asegurada 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Emilio is a 50-year-old borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. He is the coordinator of a borrowing group called Esperanza Asegurada (Hope Assured), and his story is representative of the other borrowers in the group. 

Emilio lives in Batey Vasca, which is about 30 minutes by truck outside of San Pedro de Macorís. A batey is a community of sugarcane field workers in the rural areas of the Dominican Republic. Bateyes are very remote, hard to access, and most people live in deep poverty. They often lack potable water, medicine, and any kind of reliable electricity.

Despite these difficulties, Emilio runs a successful colmado in his community. Colmados are small local shops that carry anything from bread to batteries; Emilio’s colmado is small, and he focuses on selling food. With this loan, Emilio will purchase rice, beans, and bread, among other types of food from the Dominican cuisine. 

Emilio lives in a small home in his batey with his wife and four children. His home is made from cement blocks, and was built by the local sugar company. He has lived here for 25 years. Emilio stays in business to support his family, and he hopes that with the money from his colmado he can send his children to school so they can "become professionals in any field they enjoy". This is Emilio’s sixth loan with Esperanza, and he hopes that it will not be his last.

loans.use: Rice, beans, and bread to sell to his community

loans.name: Fotibu

texts.en:
Fotibu is married to Naah and blessed with five children. He lives in Ntasen, Bamenda, Cameroon. He is a very hardworking man. He has faced numerous difficulties especially thieves who robbed him, land cases in court, death of her brother and sister and also his accident he had on a motor bike last year. N. joined GHAPE since 2005 and now he is requesting for his fourth loan from GHAPE.
 He plans to invest this loan in the purchase of feed, zinc, plank and nails. He intends to contribute from his saving the sum of 100000 FRS towards the realization of this business project. The profit which he will have from the loan will be used to educate his children improve on her living style and pay hospital bills.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of feed, zinc, nails, plank, and renovation of pig fence

loans.name: Peter Ndung

texts.en:
Peter Ndung N. has a hardware store called Petan Bricon Hardware & Electric. He has been in the business for five years and has three employees. He is located in an area with many upcoming construction projects.  

He plans to use the loan proceeds of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to renovate and expand his premises. Longer term, his goal for the business is to expand to offer other services, such as plumbing. He is ambitious and hardworking and in addition to his hardware business, Peter has a butchery and several rental houses. He is married and has two daughters, ages 5 and 11, and he wants them to get the best education possible.

loans.use: Renovation of his premises

loans.name: Mrs. Thary Peth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of sixteen people, is located I. Troeung TroE. village I. Kandal province and each member will use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Thary P. is the village bank president.

Mrs. Thary P. is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. On this plantation she faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil. I. order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizers to support the rice field.

Mrs. Thary P. is 30 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school and the youngest one is just 2 years old. Her husband, Mr. Phun Thea, is a blacksmith.

Mrs. SarI. Ut who is a group guarantor is also presented I. the picture with the village bank members.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizers to support her rice field

loans.name: Mathilde

texts.fr: G. Mathilde est née le 16 Mars 1967 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mathilde est mariée à HOUNZANDJI Bernadin, un soudeur. Le couple a trois enfants en charge, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Mathilde vit avec ses enfants et son mari à Sèmè-Podji depuis une dizaine d'année. Mathilde n'a pas été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Mathilde vend de façon ambulante des bouteilles de tous genres. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Mathilde s'approvisionne. Mathilde a déjà sept ans d'expérience dans ce domaine. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Afin d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et d'agrandir son activité, Mathilde sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Mathilde G. was born on 16 March, 1967, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Mathilde is married to Bernadin Hounzandji, a welder. The couple have three children in their care, of whom two are their own. Some of the children are in school. Mathilde has lived with her children and husband in Sèmè-Podji for ten years. Mathilde did not go to school. To meet her needs, Mathilde sells bottles of all kinds door-to-door. It is at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, that Mathilde gets her supplies. Mathilde has already gained seven years of experience in this area. She is a longtime client of ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) who has repaid her loans properly. In order to increase her working capital and enlarge her business, Mathilde is seeking a fifth loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bottles

loans.name: Mariana De Lourdes

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo se encuentra en la ciudad de Azogues,  a unos 30 minutos de la ciudad de Cuenca, Azogues tiene 32.000 habitantes y es la capital de la provincia de Cañar, ubicada en el sur de al misma. A 50 km de Azogues se encuentran las ruinas de Ingapirca, uno de los sitios más visitados del Ecuador. Azogues y Cañar son famosos por su artesanía, especialmente por la manufacturación de los sombreros de paja toquilla y sus productos cerámicos.

La Sra. Mariana C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo, se encuentra en su tercer ciclo de crédito con la fundación. 
Tiene un gran carisma, se lleva con todas sus compañeras del banco comunal, vive por vía a Uchupucun en la ciudad de Azogues, tiene 40 años se encuentra soltera y vive en casa de su mamá apoyándose mutuamente en las cosas buenas y malas que le vida les da ya que nos comenta con mucha pena que su papá ha fallecido hace 2 meses.

Mariana trabaja en un local de venta de revistas, billetes de lotería, etc.
Se encuentra en este negocio 20 años y nos comenta que hay días buenos y malos, siendo su horario de trabajo desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m.,de Lunes a Sábados y los Domingos laboran hasta el medio día, siendo el local en donde laboran arrendado,  los créditos anteriores los ha invertido para la implementación de su negocio y con el nuevo préstamo lo va a invertir en el crecimiento de su negocio, su sueño es de poder llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The community bank Mujeres de Trabajo (Working Women) is located in the city of Azogues, some 30 minutes from the city of Cuenca. Azogues has 32,000 inhabitants and is the capital of the province of Cañar, located in the south. The ruins of Ingapirca, one of the most visited attractions of Equador, lie just 50 km from Azogues. Azogues and Cañar are famous for their artesanal work, especially for the manufacture of straw hats, shawls and ceramic products. Mariana C. is a member of Mujeres de Trabajo and is now in her third loan cycle. She has great charisma and gets along with all of her colleagues at the community bank. She lives on the route to Uchupucun in Azogues. She is 40 years old, single and lives in her mother's house. They support each other in the good times and bad that life presents them with, such as the death of Mariana's father, which she tells us with much sadness happened just two months ago. Mariana works in a store selling magazines, lottery tickets, etc. She has worked in this business for 20 years and and tells us that there are good days and bad days. Her work schedule goes from 7am to 6pm, Mondays to Saturdays, and until midday on Sundays. As the store where she works is rented, she has invested her previous loans in getting the business up and running, and her new loan will be invested in growing the business. Her dream is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of lottery tickets and scratchies

loans.name: Myriam Rosa

texts.es:
En el barrio Altos de Betania de Sabanagrande Atlántico, caracterizado por tener viviendas levantadas  con el gran esfuerzo de sus habitantes mediante  el sistema de autoconstrucción, habita Myriam con su esposo, ella es una mujer de naturaleza comerciante, que inició su primer negocio en el año 1998, cuando su esposo quedó sin trabajo intempestivamente y debió ingeniárselas para cumplir con los compromisos familiares especialmente los relacionados con la educación de sus hijos y los gastos generales del hogar. Esta situación la llevo a descubrir su potencial empresarial y es así como por primera vez se dedica a comercializar productos de belleza adquiridos a través de una amiga, pues ella no podía hacerlo directamente porque no tenía dinero para iniciar y carecía de una historia crediticia por ser desconocida en el comercio. Gradualmente reunió un capital,  producto de su esfuerzo,  perseverancia y disciplina, que le sirvió para afiliarse a una empresa y poder exhibir productos mediante guías especializadas, construyendo así su propia clientela, que la impulsó a incursionar en la venta de otras mercancías  solicitadas  que no encontraban en la revista para la cual trabajaba. 

Con el  incremento de sus ingresos empezó a comprar por volúmenes pero su mercancía no estaba protegida, pues no tenia donde guardarlas y se le dificultaba el control de sus inventarios;esta forma de trabajar la mantenía mucho tiempo fuera de su hogar, razones por las que se esforzó para comprar vitrinas que protegieran sus productos y los exhibieran  en un sitio fijo, para ello pensó en abrirle un espacio a este propósito en su vivienda, una Miscelánea que todos en su barrio y en los alrededores ahora conocen. Ella ha superado muchas dificultades la mas difícil ocurrió cuando su negocio se mostró más próspero y tenia autosuficiencia sin necesidad de endeudarse, su pequeña nieta enfermó y parte de su capital lo dirigió a lograr la recuperación de su salud. Fue entonces cuando recurrió a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, por primera vez, para buscar apoyo. Su nueva financiación le ayudarà para comprar productos de belleza e higiene,adornos, ropa interior,detalles para el hogar y mercanciasa que aun vende a través de catálogos como vestidos para damas y caballeros.

Su máximo sueño es separar el negocio de su vida familiar para equilibrar efectivamente su vida laboral, personal y de hogar, planea organizar un local independiente de su casa y gradualmente comprar nuevos exhibidores de mercancía para ello Myriam trabajarà duplicando sus esfuerzos con el acompañamiento de su esposo.
texts.en:
Myriam lives with her husband in the Altos de Betania de Sabanagrande Atlántico neighborhood. The neighborhood is characterized by houses that were raised with great effort by its inhabitants. Myriam is a natural businesswoman. She started her first business in 1998 when her husband was suddenly left without work. She needed to figure out how to meet the family commitments, especially those related to her children’s education and the general household expenses. This situation led her to discover her business potential. That is how she came, for the first time, to sell beauty products that she got from a friend. She could not do it directly because she did not have money to start, and she lacked a credit history because she was not known in the business. Gradually, through her effort, perseverance, and discipline, she got together the capital to affiliate herself with a business. She was able to display her products through special guides and build her own customer base. This drove her to start selling other requested merchandise that could not be found in her business’ magazine. With the increase in earnings, she started to buy in bulk. But, her merchandise was not protected, and she did not have a place to store it. It was difficult to control her inventory. This work kept her away from home a lot. That is why she put forth much effort to buy display cases to protect her products and display them in a fixed place. She thought of opening a place in her home. It is a small general store, and everyone in the neighborhood and surrounding area knows it. She has overcome many difficulties. The most difficult happened when the business was more prosperous, and she was self-sufficient without the need of going into debt. Her little granddaughter became ill, and part of her capital went towards her granddaughter’s recuperation. That was when she turned to the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, for the first time, to look for help. Her new loan will help her to buy beauty products, hygiene products, decorations, underwear, items for the home, and merchandise like clothing for women and men that she still sells through catalogs. Her biggest dream is to separate the business from her family life in order to effectively balance her work life and her personal home life. She plans to organize a place independent from her house and gradually buy new showcases for her merchandise. To do this, Myriam, with her husband, will work by doubling her efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products, hygiene products, decorations, underwear, items for the home, and merchandise like clothing for women and men

loans.name: Mrs. Kun Ou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
These are members of a group loan in Keo Chamroeun village in the Takeo province led by Mrs. Kun O.. This village bank consists of eight people and they will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Kun O. is a widow with four children who are all silk weavers. Since this business is going well, Mrs. Kun O. wants to expand, so she is requesting a loan to buy more silk to weave for her customers. She hopes to increase her income with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave for her customers

loans.name: Lizet

texts.es:
Lizet tiene 27 años, vive con sus padres y sus hermanos en una casa arrendada.
Desde hace 6 años tiene una tienda de comestibles que instaló en su misma vivienda. La ventaja para su negocio es que se ubica en una calle bastante transitada y vende variedad de productos como leche evaporada, conservas, frutas, verduras, abarrotes, etc.
Sus padres la apoyan en la atención de su negocio, ya que es una fuente de ingresos para toda la familia. Durante estos años de trabajo Lizet se ha dado cuenta de que trabajar organizadamente y pendiente de las necesidades de sus clientes, la mantienen en la preferencia sus consumidores, esto le garantiza que sus ventas sean exitosas.
Sin embargo, su mayor reto es enfrentar la proliferación de nuevas tiendas en su localidad, pero esto no la desanima, ya que seguirá con la idea de marcar la diferencia.
Su deseo a futuro es convertir su tienda en un minimarket.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito en MFP, además considera que tener varios años de experiencia en la administración exitosa de su negocio la favorecerá para responder puntualmente en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Lizet, 27, lives with her parents and her siblings in a rented house. For six years she has had a food store, which she set up in their house. The advantage the business has is that it is located on a well traveled street. She sells a variety of products like evaporated milk, canned goods, fruit, vegetables, and groceries, etc. Her parents help her take care of the store because it is a source of income for the whole family. During these years of work Lizet has realized that working in an organized way and being attentive to her customers’ needs makes her a favorite with her consumers. This guarantees that her sales are successful. Nevertheless, her biggest challenge is to face the proliferation of new stores in her area. But, this does not discourage her because she will continue with the plan of stressing the difference. Her wish for the future is to convert her store into a mini-market. This is the first time she has had a loan with MFP. She feels that having several years of experience successfully running her business will help her make her payments on time. The money she is now requesting is to buy more merchandise to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Adjo

texts.en:
Adjo P. sells onions and ginger in the Grand Marché de Lomé in Togo. She is married and has three children.

Mrs. P. began her business in this popular market in 2004. She is now asking for her first loan from WAGES, which she will use to resupply her stock. With this loan, she will keep her display full and her customers satisfied.

loans.use: To purchase more onions and ginger to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa A. is working very hard to become the best mother to her only child. A fish-seller since 2000, she retails an average of 10-15 kilos everyday.  Because it is a very good business, Rosa seeks to improve her revenue and is therefore requesting a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy more fish to resell.

loans.use: To buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette B. is from the village of San Isidro Talakag Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Jeanette is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jeanette makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Jeanette has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jeanette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeanette has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Jeanette is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jeanette from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen S., age 62, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, known as the most populated city in the country.

S. is a farmer, growing morning glories; she sells her farming produce for a gross income of about USD 15 per day. Her husband also grows morning glories, earning an income of USD 4 per day.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a stand at the market to sell her farm produce. She would like to use any additional profit to purchase more farmland.

This is S.’s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a stand at the market to sell her produce

loans.name: Kenia Cristina

texts.es: Kenia Cristina G. M. de 23 años de edad, reside en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive únicamente junto a su esposo. Kenia posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de perecederos y de primera necesidad para los hogares. Cuenta con la ventaja de que la tienda esta ubicada en su casa de habitación, y así mismo que es una de las tiendas más conocidas en el lugar, por lo cual cuenta con muchos clientes fijos los cuales consumen a diario de sus productos. Kenia solicita un préstamo, ya que cuenta con el enorme deseo de poder surtir más su negocio, con el fin de poder contar con todos los productos que sus clientes buscan, de esta manera ella podrá satisfacer de la mejor manera a las personas y así mismo ganar clientes nuevos, los cuales consuman a diario de las ventas de su tienda.
texts.en:
Kenia Cristina G. M. is 23 years old and lives in Santa Tecla, located in the La Libertad department. She lives just with her husband. Kenia has a store where she sells food products and basic necessities for the home. She has the advantage of having her store located in her home. In addition, it is one of the most well-known stores in the area, and so has a lot of regular customers who consume her products daily. Kenia requests a loan, since she really wants to be able to increase the inventory in her store. With the loan she will be able to obtain all types of products that her customers are looking for, and in this way she will be able to satisfy her customers to a greater degree and also attract new customers who will buy daily from her store.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy food products

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea R. is a strong 49-year-old woman with the determination and faith to get out from the ties of poverty. She is the mother of three children. As a mother with big dreams, in 2006, she joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), a micro-finance institution and KIVA partner in the Philippines. Since then, Andrea started selling rice and direct selling Avon products and this really helped to meet their needs. 

Now on her sixth loan, she proposes to use the loan amount of 28,000 pesos to purchase more inventory for her business. Specifically, the loan funds will be used to pay for 16 sacks of rice and to purchase Avon products. She hopes that, with the help of ASHI as a KIVA field partner, she can reach her ambition to step out from poverty, expand her business and pay for her three children's needs in school until they complete college degrees.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice and Avon products

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet Y. is from the village of Colupan Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Juliet is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,750 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juliet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Juliet from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed

loans.name: In

texts.en: Mrs. In P. is 55 years old, married and the mother of eight children. Four of her children are married and live away from home, while other four still live at home  and help the family by earning income at various jobs. Mrs. P. and her husband work as farmers, growing green beans and potatoes. After harvest, she sells her crop and plans a new one. Mrs. P. is applying for a loan to expand her farming business by planting a new crop.

loans.use: To expand her business by planting a new crop.

loans.name: William Juma

texts.en:
William has been extracting stones for eight years now.  He is 28 years old, married to Alice Akinyi, and they have one child.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He is planning to buy new tools for his trade as the ones he has are worn out.  

William hopes to grow his business and extract more stones in future.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his stone extraction trade

loans.name: Mrs. Lem Minh Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Koun Chreae village, Kandal province, there are eight people who make up a village bank loan. All of them selected Mrs. Lem M., who was born in 1974, as their village bank president. Each member will use their portion of the loan for various ways that can improve their businesses in the current year.

Mrs. Lem M. is a farmer who owns one point five-hectares of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family, while her husband, Mr. V. Ney, is a fish seller in the local market. Since her husband’s business is going well she wants to expand it. So to improve this business, Mrs. Lem M. is applying for a loan to buy more fish to resell. 

She is the mother of five children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, three are studying in the local public school, and the other is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase farming supplies for growing basic grains

loans.name: Gulzamon

texts.en: Gulzamon K. is 50 years old. She is married and has eight children. Gulzamon has been running her own business of selling different kinds of home products for the past 15 years. She sells detergents, hair color, perfume, socks and many other items in her store. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Gulzamon is respectful and patient with all of her customers, which attracts people and brings them back to her vending facility to buy things again. Gulzamon is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of 6000 Somoni to increase the inventory she has for sale. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Gulzamon reach all of her aspirations. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing goods for selling to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice N.  is currently in the business of selling green vegetables, onions and tomatoes. She is requesting a loan to stock dried fish and more tomatoes to sell.  

Joice is 36 years old and married to an electrical technician. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: Stock dried fish and more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Isabel Antonio

texts.pt:
Isabel Antonio Sindique, nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha tem 31 anos de idade, solteira mãe de um bebe de apenas 1 ano de idade. Fez o ensino médio e depois o curso de professorado. Vive na casa propria com o seu filho e sustenta seus três sobrinhos que vivem com ela em sua casa.

Isabel apos concluir o curso de professorado opta em construir sua própria casa, seu pai que possuia uma grande porção de terra, faz a repartição para os filhos sendo ela uma das beneficiarias, fixa sua residência no mesmo quintal. E professsora ha mais de 8 anos trabalha das 12:15 as 17:40 auferindo mensalmente 5.900.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da obra, consegue poupar muito pouco deste valor porque possui uma empregada que aufere 1.000.00mt por mês que ajuda nos trabalhos de casa. 

Já teve empréstimos no BIM pagou com muito sucesso. Este é o primeiro na Hluvuku e Kiva no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, tijoleiras e outros) para dar continuidade com a obra da sua casa que iniciara com o empréstimo que obteve no BIM. 

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo para mobiliar a sua casa dando mais conforto a sua familia.
texts.en:
Isabel Antonio was born in the Namaacha District. She is 31 years old, single and the mother of a one year old baby. She finished high school and went on to conclude her teacher's training. She lives in her own home with her son and supports three nephews/nieces who live with her. After finishing her teacher's training she decided to build her house. Her father had a big lot of land and divided it between his children. She was one of the beneficiaries and built her home on that lot. She has been a teacher for more than 8 years. She works from 12:15pm to 5:40pm and makes 5,900 meticais per month which is spent with household expenses and construction. She only manages to save a little because she has a domestic helper who makes 1,000 meticais per month to help her around the house. She has had a loan with BIM (another bank) and was successful paying it back. This is her first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. It is for 15,000 meticais and she intends to buy construction materials (cement, sand, tiles and others) to continue the house construction she started with the loan from BIM. She is confident she will pay the loan ahead of schedule and request a new loan to furnish her house offering better living conditions to her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, tiles and others)

loans.name: Elsa's Group

texts.en:
Elsa L. is from the village of Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old and the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Shasta Daisy.


Elsa is single and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a clothing business,while not the only means of generating revenue the source of income is from providing new clothing. Elsa sew clothes and she sell it to local community members. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia A. is from the village of Pinamulaan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 55 years old. Alicia is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling food and daily use products in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for more than ten years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Alicia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be Alicia's fifth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Maria Maribel

texts.en:
Maria is thirty-one years old. She lives in her own home with her husband in the town of San Isidro. San Isidro is located in a rural region forty minutes to the north of Chiclayo in a district called Morrope. The community in the area primarily consists of agricultural workers, artisans and individuals who raise animals.

Maria produces artisan goods in her home and also raises animals in her backyard. She uses these two activities to assist in stabilizing her income.  Her animals include chickens, ducks and sheep.

This will be Maria’s first loan with our institution, however she has worked with financial institutions in the past. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase additional animals and feed. She hopes to be able to take advantage of bulk prices and the high demand that will exist during the holiday season.

She is well respected in her community and very hard working. She dreams of expanding her business in order to be able to better support her family and make improvements to her home.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals and feed.

loans.name: Concepcion Magdalena

texts.es:
Doña Concepción, tiene 50 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután, vive con su madre y también tiene un hijo pero ya no vive con doña concepción, el negocio lo poseía primeramente su madre y el cual aprendió a administrarlo muy bien.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería ya que quiere tener a disposición D. los clientes variedad D. prendas D. vestir, en colores  y modas diferentes para que puedan estar satisfechos y contar con su preferencia, este préstamo le ayudara a retener la clientela y a mejorar los ingresos D. su hogar pues espera aumentar las ventas al realizar esta inversión. 
El sueño D. doña Concepción es tener un negocio granD., sin mayores dificultades para atender la demanda y también quiere proveer a su familia los ingresos para solventar las necesidades mas urgentes.
texts.en:
Doña Concepción is 50 years old and lives with her mother in the Department of Usulután. She also has a son, but he does not live with her. Her business is primarily owned by her mother, but she has learned to manage it very well.

Concepción is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to offer to her customers. She hopes to proviD. them with a variety of clothing in different colors and styles in order to satisfy their preferences. This loan will help her retain customers and improve her household income. She expects to increase her sales as a result of this investment.

Doña Concepción dreams of having a large business without the major challenge of keeping up with demand. She also wants to proviD. her family with the income to meet the most urgent necessities.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of clothing to sell

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Asia Abdalah is in her late twenties and is married with two children. Asia runs a food stall which she has been operating since 2004. Asia sells different types of bananas, mainly those used for cooking. The stall is open daily between 7:00 am and 3:00 pm and earns Asia a low monthly profit. 

This will be Asia's fourth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Asia's previous loans were used to increase her business, and  to provide her with extra capital to quickly restock when running out of goods. These loans were all successfully repaid. With her fourth loan, Asia aims to increase her business and again provide liquidity so that she can stock up quickly when needed. 

Asia will share this loan with her loan group, Unity, which totals 18 members. the members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Asia can be seen in the front row, first on the right and holding a baby.

loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: Bella Raquel

texts.es: Bella Raquel M. C. de 31 años de edad, reside en Santa Tecla, en el departamento de San Salvador, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de: 13 y 2 años de edad. Bella posee una tortillería, en la cual se encarga de elaborar y vender tortillas, las cuales son muy vendidas, así mismo comercializa pupusas, el plato típico más conocido y vendido de este país. Ella es una madre de familia muy responsable, quien trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Bella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar maíz en grandes cantidades, queso frijoles, chicharrón,  así mismo comprar cilindros de gas propano, de manera que pueda contar con mucha materia prima para la elaboración y cocción de las tortillas y pupusas.
texts.en:
Bella Raquel M. C. is 31 years old and resides in Santa Tecla, Department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband and two children, ages 13 and 2. Bella has a tortilla shop where she in charge of making and selling tortillas, which are in high demand. She also prepares “pupusas” a well-known traditional dish that is sold throughout the country. Bella is a responsible mother who works extremely hard so that her children can get ahead.
