She is requesting a loan in order to buy corn in large quantities, cheese, beans, pork, and cylinders of propane gas. This will allow her to have plenty of supplies for preparing and cooking tortillas and pupusas.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients in bulk & propane gas

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es:
Ricardo es un padre de familia de tres hermosos hijos, siendo un pequeño comerciante el cual tiene una pulpería que junto a su esposa trabajan para lograr dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Al iniciar este negocio lo hizo con ahorros de su liquidación. Vendiendo una variedad de productos. Luego necesita más capital ya que la demanda es mucha y comienza con financiamientos en Afodenic en donde su negocio  da un giro en sus niveles de ventas.
También ha logrado el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que con el crédito anterior termino el muro, ahora hará un anexo en la parte de la sala, ya que su pulpería le ha quitado mucho espacio en su pequeña casa. Contento porque atreves de estos préstamos está logrando el objetivo de una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Ricardo is the father of three beautiful children.  He is a small salesman who has a small grocery store.  He works in the store together with his wife so that they can provide a better service to their customers.

Ricardo set up this business with savings from his severance pay.  He sells a variety of products.  He needs more capital since demand is high and he is taking an Afodenic loan because they help his business improve in terms of sales levels.

Ricardo has also managed to improve his home.  He used his last loan to finish building a wall.  He will now add an extension to his living room since his grocery store has taken up a lot of space in his small home.  He is happy because through these loans he is achieving his goal of creating a better home.

loans.use: To buy building materials build an extension on his living room

loans.name: Naranchimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Naranchimeg is 46 years old divorcee, lives with her mother and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They all live together in Naranchimeg’s small family house, which situated along the main road close to all amenities. A few years ago she decided two open a small shop using her house's good location and spare room. She started selling a second hand clothes which she buys from wholesalers. The business is doing very well because the area where she lives is occupied with low income people most of whom can not afford to buy a new clothes. The second hand clothes mostly comes from developed countries in a big bundles and it's in good demand between low income people. Her eldest daughter has separate business and sells clothes on the local outdoor market and the youngest one studies in Art College. Mrs.Naranchimeg looks after her mother as well. Her dream is to give a proper education for her younger daughter by expanding her business. At the moment she is requesting a loan to expand her business and to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying more inventory and bundle of clothes for sale

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La Sera Angela, de 41 años de edad, comparte estos momentos de su vida con su esposo Jose Dominto Fernandez, quien le ayuda en las actividades Ganaderas y en los cultivos de la Finca que tienen ubicada en la Comarca Esperancita # 1; Doña Angela proviene de una familia humilde, es una exelente persona, trabajadora, dedicada, y sobre todo muy responsable,  obtiene sus ingresos  de la comercialización de ganado y de cultivos de raices y tuberculos, 

Solicita su 1er crédito con el apoyo de Kiva, para compra de ternero de desarrollo, lo cual piensa incrementar su hato ganadero asi de esta manera obtener mayor ingresos y por ende mayor estabilidad económica.  

Su mayor sueño es aumentar su inventario y brindar mayor condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Angela is 41 years old and lives with her husband Jose Dominto Fernandez who helps her in her business raising livestock and growing crops on the farm that they own in Esperancita #1 region.  Angela is from a humble family.  She is an excellent person, hard-working, dedicated and very responsible.  She  makes her income selling livestock, root vegetables and tubers.

Angela is requesting her first Kiva loan to buy calves to raise.  She plans, in this way, to increase her herd so that she can obtain more profits and, thereby, more financial stability.  Angela's biggest dream is to increase her inventory and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy calves to raise

loans.name: Merceditas

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 64 años, su actividad es la venta de cerdos. Hace más de 12 años que tiene este negocio, inicio con ciertos ahorros que inicio este arduo trabajo pues siempre le ha gustado ser una mujer muy independiente. La mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan buena calidad ya que siempre ha disfrutado de obtener este medio de vida. Este crédito es para la compra de cerdos ya que son necesarios para mantener a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 64 years old.  She sells pigs and has been in the business for more than 12 years.  She started out in this business with some savings that she had since she has always enjoyed being a very independent woman.  Most of her customers request good-quality products from her.  She has always enjoyed being in this trade.

Mercedes will use this loan to buy pigs since they are necessary if she wants to keep serving her customers.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Orifjon

texts.en: S. Orifjon is a married father with 4 children. Orifjon has been a farmer for the last 17 years. Farming is a passion to him. He practices both dairy farming and mixed-crop farming. He says he has chosen farming as a career because the produce he produces on his farm has a ready market. His challenge at the moment is that he is not fully utilizing all his land because he used up all his proceeds from the last harvest to pay his children's school fees so was not able to buy the seeds and fertilizers needed to plant his whole farm. Orifjon is requesting a loan of 7,000 Somoni to be able to purchase the resources needed to plough the whole farm for the next planting season. He will purchase assorted fertilizer stock and seeds. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Estrella De Belen Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL "ESTRELLA D. BELEN"

Juana tiene 43 años convive con su pareja con quien tiene 3 hijos, su vida laboral comenzó con una tienda en casa ahora ella se dedica a ofrecer servicio D. transporte público junto con su esposo que hace la labor D. chofer, mientras que ella tiene el trabajo D. cobradora, ella sueña con tener una flota D. buses y así formar una empresa para administrarla, dandole en un futuro mejores estudios superiores a sus hijos y a la vez una vida mas cómoda, Juana es parte D. la ALCANCIA COMUNAL "ESTRELLA D. BELEN" formada por 9 personas que trabajan en diferentes rubros, pero con la misma perseverancia y dedicacion para mantener a sus familias, no solo con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo, sino tambien con su esfuerzo D. dar buenos valores a sus hijos, ellas afirman "que todo sacrificio al final tiene un recompensa".
texts.en:
Star of Bethlehem Communal Bank

Juana is 43 years old and in a common law relationship with her partner. They have three children. She started out working by managing a store in her home, but now she provides public transportation services along with her husband, who works as a driver. Juana is responsible for collecting fares. Her dream is to own a fleet of buses and form a business that she can manage. This will give her children a better future because she can pay for their college education and proviD. them a more comfortable life.

Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “Estrella D. Belen” (Star of Bethlehem), which consists of nine members who work in different fields. With perseverance and dedication, they have been able to support their families. Not only do they possess a strong work ethic, they also pass on good values to their children. They claim, “We will be rewarded in the end for all of our sacrifices.”

loans.use: Pay for vehicle maintenance & repairs

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” COMUZONE III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fortunata; la socia tiene 53 años D. edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio compra y venta D. ropa para niños y adultos la socia trabaja ya un buen tiempo en este negocio el cual trabaja con sus hijos ,son ellos quienes viajan  hasta la ciudad D. Lima para comprar mercadería y así poder la socia venderlo a sus amistades, D. vez en cuando la socia también viaja pero la mayoría D. tiempo lo hacen sus hijos, la socia es una persona bien alegre y entusiasta.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra D. mas mercadería y D. esta manera poder tener más variedad que ofrecer  a sus amistades.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Comuzone III”, located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, in Cusco department.

She is Fortunata, 53, married and she has 3 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling children and adult clothing.  The member has had this business for a good period of  time and her children work with her.  They are the ones who travel to Lima to buy merchandise so she can sell the clothing to her friends.  Sometimes she also travels but mostly her children are the ones who do.  

Fortunata is a very cheerful and enthusiastic person. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise and thus have more variety to offer to her friends.

This member is very happy with the loan and promises to make all the payments in the established time period.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise so she will have a greater variety to offer to her friends.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam nació en la provincia de la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 26 años de edad. Actualmente, Miriam vive junto con sus dos hijos en la ciudad Imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú), ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su familia y tiene un negocio familiar que consiste en hacer mantenimiento de computadoras, el esposo de Miriam tiene un centro de atención de mantenimiento de computadoras junto con unos amigos en el centro Comercial El Carmen  en la ciudad del Cusco. 

Ya son 6 años que su esposo de Miriam se dedican este negocio y le va excelente gracias al esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo.

Miriam en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar repuestos como por ejemplo cabezales de impresoras, tintas y otras cosas más que se necesita.  

Miriam es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumac Purisisun” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Miriam was born in the province of the city of Cusco and is 26 years old. Presently she lives with her two children in the Imperial City of the Incas (Cusco, Peru). She is a responsible mother who helps her family get ahead. She has a family business providing computer maintenance. Her husband and a group of his friends have a computer maintenance center in the shopping mall ‘El Carmen’ in the city of Cusco. Miriam and her husband have been doing this work for six years now with great results thanks to the effort they put into it. 

Miriam is a responsible person and is a member of the Communal Bank ‘Sumac Purisisun’ of the Arariwa Association of the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, printer heads, ink and others that are needed.

loans.name: Mansura

texts.ru: Mansura M. 38 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye uchatsya v shkole. Mansura yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. Ona uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit kuric i utok dlya uvelicheniya i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Mansura M. is 38 years old.  She is married and has two children who go to school.  Mansura is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her loving family.  She has been poultry farming for five years.  Now she needs 2300 AZN to buy chickens and ducks to enlarge and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and ducks

loans.name: Suyapa Edith

texts.es:
la sra. Suyapa Edith R. tiene 40 años de edad, vive en la colonia La Fraternidad de la ciudad capital y se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, productos de belleza y adornos para el hogar, sus ventas las realiza en los diferentes mercados, mayoreos y casinos ubicados en el bulevard morazan.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia al por mayor. con las ganancias que obtenga desea terminar la contruccion de la parte frontal de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Suyapa Edith R. is 40 years old and lives in the La Fraternidad neighborhood in the capital city. She sells new clothing, beauty products and decorations for the home. She does her sales in different markets, wholesalers and casinos located in the Morazan Boulevard.

Mrs. Suyapa’s loan will be used to buy merchandize wholesale, with the profits, she hopes to finish building the front of her home.

loans.use: buy pants, socks, blouses, jeans, creams, deodorants, lotions, body oil, shampoos, hair conditioner, home decorations and catalogue products.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es socia del  Banco Comunal “Hermanas D. Choquetanca II”, ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia El Collao departamento D. Puno, tiene 45 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 9 hijos, 6 D. ellos son  independientes.
La señora se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganados vacunos, ovinos y porcinos, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace un  ciclo.  Su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.  También cuenta que se dedica a la chacra como papa y quinua.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, comprará ovejas y chanchos. En el negocio le ayuda su esposo y sus hijos.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y crecer como empresaria.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the “Hermanas D. Choquetanca II” communal bank, which is located in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 45 years old. She is married and has 9 children, 6 of whom are financially independent. 

Bertha buys and sells cattle, sheep, and pigs. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one loan cycle. Her first loan was for PEN 500.00, which she invested in her business. She also tells us that she grows potatoes and quinoa.

She will use this new loan for PEN 1,000.00 to buy sheep and pigs. Her husband and children help her with her business. Her dream is to improve the business and to grow as a businessperson.

What she likes about the communal bank is the good terms of the loan.

loans.use: to buy sheep and pigs.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel owns Green Dog Services, a business that specializes in pest control service.  Gabriel, who has over seven years of experience in the pest control industry, launched his business in early May, 2011 after months of planning and preparation.  The grand opening of his business is timely, as it marks the beginning of the summer season, the busiest time of the year for the pest control industry.

Born and raised in Mexico, Gabriel came to the United States 14 years ago.  Before working in pest control, he worked for several years as a salesman in the music industry.  This experience took him all over the state of Texas and Northern Mexico.  From his accumulated experience, Gabriel half-jokingly says that if there is one thing he has learned about Americans, it is that they love good customer service.   Knowing this, he sees excellent customer service as being as much a part of his business as the expertise he provides.  He says that it is crucial to build and maintain customer relationships, because satisfied customers are the cheapest form of advertising.  As he points out, someone can look up pest control companies in the phonebook, but they are most likely to work with a company recommended to them by a friend.

As a native Spanish speaker, Gabriel says that being bilingual is helping him find a niche for his business within the Hispanic community.  “There is a lot of competition in this industry, but Hispanics are looking for someone they can speak Spanish with, and I think that helps me.  I’m not the only one (who speaks Spanish), but I’m one of the only ones with his own company.”  Though he wants to continue building relationships within the Hispanic community, he also wants to connect his business with the greater community.  One way he is doing this is by going through neighborhoods, meeting people, and making them aware of the services he offers.

This loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana helps Gabriel pay the necessary fees for registering his business. He says that the government has strict requirements for pest control, and that navigating through the paperwork can be as expensive as it is time-consuming.  It is important that he be officially registered and certified so that he can offer all of his expertise.  For example, he has yet to receive approval to treat termites, leaving him unable to provide one of the key services his business offers.  

Aside from helping Gabriel receive all of the necessary certifications, this loan is helping him purchase business cards and launch a small marketing campaign.  He wants to advertise his business in local newspapers and magazines.  Gabriel has already undertaken a less expensive form of advertising by walking through neighborhoods and handing out business fliers.  Before receiving this loan, Gabriel financed his startup costs with his personal savings and credit card.

loans.use: to pay for state registration fees and a marketing campaign

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is 64 years old and married with nine children. Basilisa works hard to provide for her family. 

For the past five years, Basilisa has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from pig fattening, and from the sale of ready-to-wear clothes and bags. She is requesting a 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock, like milk and sugar, to sell in her general store. 

Before this loan, Basilisa has borrowed and paid back 16 loans from NWTF. Basilisa aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock, like milk and sugar, to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 55 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella trabaja en forma independiente llevando a diferentes lugares como Izcuchaca y Anta, ella lleva pantalones, chompas, blusas y chalinas, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar y  terminar de construir su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, yeso y arena.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS” ("Women Entrepreneurs").  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco, and department of Cusco.

The member is 55 years old and single, she has 5 children.  The member alternates her daily activities with the business of selling clothes.  She works independently, taking her wares to different places like Izcuchaca and Anta.  She sells pants, sweaters, blouses and scarves.  It is through this business that the member is able to move her children ahead in life. 

The member wants to improve and finish building her house. The member is requesting the loan to buy construction materials like cement, gypsum and sand.

The member is happy about the loan and agrees to comply with repayments.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, gypsum and sand.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Compone, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Antonia; la socia tiene 39 años; la socia es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos, el menor tiene 14 años de edad;  La socia se dedica a la atención y cuidado de sus terreno de cultivo, la socia desea sembrar esta época maíz y papa, la socia comenta que como ya es tiempo de sembrío de maíz y de papa, ella desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de semillas de maíz y semilla de papa para sembrar en sus terrenos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para la nueva siembra.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the “MUJERES EN ACCION” communal bank in the Compone district of the Cusco province.

She’s 39 years old, is in a live-in relationship, and has four children, with the youngest being 14 years old.  Antonia has and cares for her farmland wants to raise corn and potatoes, especially now that it’s corn and potato planting season.  She is asking for this loan to buy corn and potato seed for the new crop.

Antonia is very satisfies and grateful for the support she’s gotten through this means and she is committed to making her payments in accordance with the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy potato and corn seed.

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es:
La  señora  Fidela, tiene  cuarenta y dos años de edad, estudio hasta la primaria terminada  casi no sabe leer muy bien pero, le gustan mucho las matemáticas.
Tiene la cantidad de  tres hijos    una mujer   Lourdes  y dos varones Fidel y Carlos  quienes  apoyan en  cualquier decisión.
Ella se dedica a la venta  de carnes frías  desde  hace  doce años  atrás con su esposo Joel  con quien lleva, casada   veinte dos  años.
Sus clientes  están muy contentos por la calidad de su carne  y por la atención que les da  y por la comprensión ya que  cuando sus clientes no tienen  dinero la  señora Fidela, les da fiado.
Uno de sus sueños es  tener una carnicería más grande ya  desea, darle  lo mejor a sus, para que terminen una licenciatura.
 Le da las gracias a fundacion realidad por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante  y hacer  realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Fidela, 42, completed primary school. She doesn't know how to read very well, but she really likes math. She has 3 children - Lourdes, Fidel and Carlos, who she supports in all their decisions. 

For 12 years she has sold cold cuts along with her husband of 22 years, Joel. Her customers are very happy with the quality of her meat and the service that she provides, as well as the understanding that when her customers don't have money Fidela will sell to them on credit. 

One of her dreams is to have a larger butcher shop because she wants to give the best to her children so that they can receive a college degree. She thanks the Foundation Realidad for the support they have given her to get ahead and make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to sell cold cuts.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 53 years old. A mixed crop farmer, he is married to Margaret who is a business lady. They are blessed with three children aged 17, 15 and 10 years. He has been in his business for the past 20 years with the monthly income of KES 18,000 which he uses to support his family members. He is applying for his 2nd loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. 

 Francis will use the loan to buy farm manure and seedlings for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hope and dreams are to venture into dairy farming which he believes will help him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy farm manure and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel de Jesús, vive un barrio en donde tienen una iglesia muy hermosa, es soltero  y trabaja en el campo, sin embargo, ésta no es la unica actividad que practica, para obtener mas recursos se dedica a la realización de ropa y articulos de típicos de la region donde vive.

Él solito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de materias primas, como son, mantas, hilos, agujas, botones, desde hace 15 años que él aprendio a realizar productos artesanales como camisas, servilletas, manteles bordados.

Él se inspiro su  familia para apoyar a sus padres en la  economía que se da del diario, en ello también quiere tener su propio dinero.

Su más grande ilusión es que con este préstamo pueda ir teniendo sus propios ahorros para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús lives in a neighborhood with a very beautiful church, he is single and he works in the fields. However, to make extra income, he also makes clothing and traditional cloth items that are typical of his region.

He requested a loan to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as blankets, threads, needles, and buttons. He has been engaged in this activity for fifteen years and things are going well: he sells shirts, napkins and embroidered tablecloths.

His family encouraged him, so that he would be able to help his parents pay for everyday expenses; he also wants to have money of his own.
His biggest dream is to be able to save money for himself thanks to this loan, thus improving his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy blankets, threads, needles and buttons.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph  has been selling milk in Kitengela Market for the last four years and earns an income of KES.21,000. He is married to Norokirobi  and blessed with two school age children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff  person and this is his first loan with which he plans to purchase a deep freezer for storing milk. With the extra profits Joseph plans to buy another dairy cow for milk production.

In future Joseph hopes to grow his business and to establish a dairy farm.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer for storing milk

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a married woman with three children. The oldest child is six years old.

Annie is engaged in farming. She tills land in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Annie primarily grows rice crops on her land. She is able to buy her family’s basic needs through her income form the farm. Annie requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm supplies. Annie hopes to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.ru: Угулой с 1990 года занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Она замужем и любящая мать 5 детей. Она имеет 8 гектар землю и в основном там выращивает пшеницу, ячмень и лука. Она хочет улучшить свое жилищное условия, и она хотела бы получить займ для покупки дверь и окна, а также стройматериалов для своего дома. Она заранее благодарить всех вас за вашу доброту и поощрения.
texts.en: Since 1990, Uguloy has been involved in growing agricultural crops.  She is married and is a loving mother of five children.  She has eight hectares of land and primarily grows wheat, barley and onions there.  She wants to improve her living conditions and wants to obtain a loan to buy a door and windows and also construction materials for her house.  Uguloy thanks all of you in advance for your kindness and support.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Kifah

texts.en:
Kifah is a 39-year-old young woman.  She is married and has three sons and four daughters.  Her husband is a construction worker with decent salary. Kifah has her own business, which is an office that provides copy and printing equipment, as well as translation and document preparation services.  She wants to expand and improve her business by offering a new printing machine, fax, additional furniture, etc. but the amount of money she has isn't enough, so she needs to take a loan of  $1,000 from FATEN. 

When Kifah gets the loan, she will be able to purchase the necessary equipment she needs to achieve these improvements and expand her office.  This will will affect her work positively and let her do more high quality work and increase her income to live in better conditions.   Kifah is photographed in her office.

loans.use: improve her document preparation and copy services office

loans.name: Leonardo's Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Pimampiro está conformado por tres personas: una mujer y dos hombres, en este grupo el presidente es Leonardo ya que es una persona bien trabajadora, responsable y cumplida. Leonardo tiene 36 años, escasado y vive también con 4 hijos menores de edad.

Leonardo trabaja con sus primos y hermanos en la Agricultura, específicamente en la siembra y cocecha de tomate riñón para luego poder venderlo. Empezó a trabajar cuando tenia 10 años a trabajar con su padre en la agricultura en sus propiedades, luchando y sufriendo ya que la agricultura es bien dura de aprender y saberla llevar. Es su tercer año trabajando con Fodemi, el último crédito que solicitó es para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono, semillas y cajas para los tomates riñón, esta inversión ayudará a Leonardo a que su productividad aumente con productos de calidad logro que culminará cuando tenga muy buenos ingresos para poder mantener a su familia.

 Su sueño es educar a sus hijos con buenos valores y formarles como personas trabajadoras con el ejemplo de sus padres.

Los clientes son las tres personas que estan a la derecha de la fotografía.
texts.en:
This group from Pimampiro is composed of three people: one woman and two men.  The group President is Leonardo since he’s a very hardworking, responsible and committed person.  Leonardo is 36 years old, married and lives with his four minor children too.

Leonardo works with his cousins and siblings in farming, specifically growing tomatoes to sell.  He started to work in farming when he was 10 years old with his father on his land struggling and suffering because farming is hard to learn and to carry out well.

This is his third year working with Fodemi.  His latest loan request is to buy farming supplies like manure, seeds and boxes for the tomatoes.  This investment will help Leonardo increase productivity of quality products which will culminate in his earning good income to be able to support his family.

His dream is to educate his children with good values and through the good example set by their parents turn them into hardworking people.

The clients are the three people that appear on the right of the photograph.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds and boxes for tomato planting and harvesting.

loans.name: Terimbere/rhng Group

texts.fr:
Noel fait partie du groupe Terimbere/Rhng. Il a 24 ans et il est marié mais il n’a pas des enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6  ans de primaire.

Noel est cultivateur des tomates. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture des tomates. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est agrandir la récolte des tomates en utilisant des engrais chimiques.  Dans les prochaines années il prévoit d'etre le grand fournisseur des tomates dans sa région . Avec les profits, Noel prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Noel is a member of the Terimbere/Rhng group. He is 24 years old and married, but has no children. He received 6 years of primary school education. 

Noel is a tomato farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers to help grow his tomatoes. 

His strategy for growing his business is to enlarge his tomato crop by using chemical fertilizers. In the coming years he hopes to become a large tomato supplier for his region. With the profits, Noel plans to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers to grow tomatoes

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees for her children.
 
For the past six years, she has operated a business of selling stationery at a school compound to pupils and teachers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. The business is high during the first two months after opening of schools, then goes down in the later months as the school term is almost closing for holidays. 

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of marker pens, brown covers, polythene papers, manila sheets, staplers and staple pins. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of marker pens, brown covers, polythene papers, manila sheets, staplers and staple pins.

loans.name: Bezhan

texts.en:
Bezhan is a 54 years old farmer from the village Kakhareti, Southern part of the country. He is married and lives with his family: his wife Lali and their 23 year old son. The only source of the income for the family is agriculture. They have milking cows and produce cheese. They sell the products on local market. Along with the above mentioned activities, the family grows corn and various vegetables on their family owned plot of the land. Harvested products are sold locally for cheap price. 

Bezhan has requested credit for purchasing a minibus to transport the family's agricultural products to the capital city of the country. He will take and sell the products in Tbilisi for a higher price. Also, when he has the minibus, he will purchase additional products in the village for resale and, even taking into account the fuel cost, the profit of the family will increase. The family will use their increased profits to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus for transporting harvested products to market.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline lives in Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both in school. She also takes care of her sister and brother. 

Caroline has a poultry farming business. She has been in this business for over ten years, and works six days out of the week. Caroline sells her products at retail from home. 

She has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of chicken feed. The main business challenges for Caroline include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see it grow big, to own 2000 chickens and to start selling at wholesale. 

Caroline lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, age 43 years, is married to Charles and is blessed with two children- aged 16 and 18 years. She sells timber, which she has been doing for two years. The business earns her a monthly income of Kes. 34,000.

This is her first loan with KADET. She will use the funds to buy more timber to sell. Esther hopes to become a renowned timber supplier in the future.

loans.use: to buy timber to sell

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is married and has three children ranging from one to seven years of age. He is a patient man. His primary business activity has been providing transportation services. His business is located in a busy and densely populated urban area. He describes his business challenge as occasionally low purchasing power. He will use the requested loan of KES 20,000 to supplement his savings so he can buy another motorbike. Kennedy's hope and goal is to own at least seven motorbikes in the next five years to increase his transportation business.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Muoi's Group

texts.en:
Ms Muoi is  24 years old with 1 small child.  Being a farmer, she focuses on growing  rice, raising chickens. Besides, she is managing a small  hair cut shop. This shop  started 3 years ago . Joining in our credit program in 2003, she has used loans mostly for her raising. In this new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 8,066,000 Vietnam dong to buy food for chickens and  a part of to buy hair care products
 Ms Hoa is 26 years old with 2 children.  She is raising chickens for meat. She wants to have a loan of 3,270,000 Vietnam dong  to buy food for chickens
  Ms Huyen is 27 years old with  2 children .  Her business focuses on selling and buying scrap products. She wants to have a loan of 5,014,000 Vietnam dong to buy more products for sale
  Ms Hang is 41 years old with 2 children. She is selling and buying scrap products . She wants to have a loan of 8,066,000 Vietnam dong to  invest in  her business
 Ms Huong is 41 years old with 2 children . She is scrap product sale person. She  wants to have a loan of 8,066,000 Vietnam dong to buy more products for sale.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens and  a part of to buy hair care products

loans.name: Mabil

texts.es: Mabil es madre soltera de 03 niños, ella trabaja en su pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde vende comestibles de primera necesidad y atiende a sus clientes con envases y bolsas biododegradables, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años. Necesita el crédito para la compra de mayor mercadería para su tienda y poder ofertarlas. Su mayor anhelo es poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarles una educación de calidad, mejorar su negocio e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Mabil es madre soltera de 03 niños, ella trabaja en su pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde vende comestibles de primera necesidad, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años. Necesita el crédito para la compra de mayor mercadería para su tienda y poder ofertarlas. Su mayor anhelo es poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarles una educación de calidad, mejorar su negocio e incrementar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Para comprar mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen es de la ciudad de Concepción, tiene 7 hermanos, está estudiando la carrea de Fisioterapia y comenta que su meta es formarse como profesional y poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella es una persona que quiere salir adelante, es por ello que pone todo de sí para poder lograrlo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer.

loans.use: Pagar cuotas de universidad

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.en:
Maria Castellón began her business a year ago; she has a Snack store in which she sells hamburgers, hot dogs, quesadillas, and sodas. She has great season which has allowed her to stay in the market and get more clients, that is why she has planed to buy more ingredients and equipment for her commercial space, so she is soliciting a loan of $1,500.00 that she expects to pay in 1 year.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Cstellón inicio su negocio hace un año, ella inicio su tienda de Snack en la cual vende Hamburguesas , Hotdogs, quesadillas, sodas, tiene un buen sazón lo cual a hecho que se mantenga en el mercado y sigan acudiendo clientes, por lo cual ella tiene planeado comprar mas ingredientes y equipo para su local comercial, por lo que solicita un prestamo de $ 15000.00dllrs y pagarlos en un lapso de un año.

loans.use: Buy ingredients and equipment

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is a farmer in the Santa Lucia County, where he has lived for twenty years. He is 63 years old, but he still has the will to work and provide for his family. He has a 14 year-old that he wants to make sure finishes school. Manuel is hoping to receive the loan in order to improve the production of his lands. He will primarily buy fertilizer and fumigation equipment. He and his wife Benita hope to save for the future of their son.

<

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

Manuel is part of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Santa Lucia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. Their association works cooperatively to help in the commercialization of the product after it has grown. They will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The sector is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not count on formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical micro-entrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice Farming

loans.name: Elvia

texts.en:
Elvia is involved in the sale of general and paper products. Her business is well-located, being next to a school. She started her business at the suggestion of her sister who runs a school and loaned her $400. Elvia’s shop is located next to her sister's school; there, she sells paper products to the children. Elvia currently sells all types of bazaar goods and also works at the school's drink stand for extra income. Ms. Elvia seeks the loan to buy more merchandise due to the increasing amount of students over the years, which has provided higher sales. She is also in need of another glass cabinet to better display her products. Elvia is certain that by acquiring more merchandise and another cabinet, she can improve her business's presentation and therefore increase sales. Elvia is 42 years old and has 4 children, two of whom attend school. By improving her business, she hopes to offer her entire family a higher quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Elvia se dedica a la venta de articulos generales y papeleria que esta muy bien ubicado por estar a lado de una escuela. Ella empezo su negocio por motivacionde una hermana que le presto $400 y tiene una escuela y el bazar de Elvia esta junto a la escuela de su hermana donde vende los articulos de papeleria a los niños. Elvia actualmente venden toda clase de articulos de bazar y ademas atiende el bar de la escuela pues le gnera otros ingresos. La Sra. Elvia solicita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia pues la cantidad de alumnos ha aumentado con los años y ahora tiene mas ventas ademas necesita otra vitrina para exhibir mejor sus productos, Elvia esta convencida de que con la compra de mas mercaderia y de otro mueble ella podra mejorar la presentacion de su negocio y asi aumentar sus ventas. Elvia tiene 42 años y 4 hijos de los cuales dos estudian ella aspira que con el mejoramiento de su negocio podra darle una mejro calidad de vida para toda su familia

loans.use: Increase merchandise stocks

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.ru:
Abdusamad is 32 years old, he is married and has 1 child. Abdusamad began his business 5 years ago by offering computer services to the clients. Eventually, he expanded the business and added new services, such as connecting to mobile operators and increasing the balance on special cards that are used to add money to the account. Because of the technologies involved, this business requires capital investments. In addition, the business employs two people that receive salaries. With his first microcredit from MicroInvest, Abdusamad purchased a fax machine, a scanner, and cards to add money to the account. Currently, he is planning to purchase a new computer and is, therefore, asking for a new microcredit loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдусамаду 32 года, он женат и у него 1 ребенок. Абдусамад начинал свой бизнес 5 лет назад с предоставления компьютерных услуг населению. Постепенно расширяясь, он включил дополнительно дилерские услуги по подключению к сотовым операторам и пополнению баланса. Бизнес капиталоемкий и требует денежных вложений. Также у него работают 2 сотрудника, которым он платит заработную плату. Получив займ в Микроинвест, Абдусамад приобрел ксерокс и сканер «два в одном» и карточки пополнения счета. Сейчас он собирается приобрести новый компьютер и для этого просит новый займ.

loans.use: to purchase new computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more fabrics and goods for sale

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en:
Rafiq A. is a client of Microinvest who is engaged in the cattle breeding business. He has managed to acquire a lot of experience during his 15 years in this business and so is a specialist in this sphere. He lives in the Gafurov district in Khujand and he has a big stockyard near his house. He has 4 children and they all help in their father’s business.

Currently Rafiq has 4 big bulls and two calves. With this loan he wants to purchase fodder for the winter season. At present, the price for hay and other fodder is cheaper as it is still the season of gathering in the harvest.

loans.use: Purchase fodder for his animals

loans.name: Matauaina

texts.en: Matauaina M. is an old member of ours who joined SPBD three years ago. She has paid off her last loan and is now requesting this loan in order to buy more young taro plants to grow in her small farm. Matauaina is really excited and is still interested in staying in the program because she is now holding cash that she never did before. But with a good mind, she is saving up some of her income for "a rainy day", because she believes that not all days are good, and so it’s good to save now, so that when bad days come, she will be well prepared. She plans to extend her little farm and start looking for new markets.

loans.use: To buy a lawn mower and agricultural chemicals for her small farm

loans.name: Erisa B(Iii) Group

texts.en:
Juliet is 48 years old and married with three children. She helps support her family by running a poultry farm. Costa and Regina operate grocery stores. Sanyu breeds poultry and Florence sells charcoal. Juliet wants to use the extra profits generated by this loan to pay her grandchildren's school fees.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for their businesses

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Rose M.. She is widowed and has two children, aged 9 and 13. In 2007, Rose established a general store. She now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Many women are therefore considered not creditworthy by financial institutions in Tanzania, as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and therefore poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk for her store

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima N. is the group leader for four other women. Saima has lived in Chichawatni, Pakistan, all of her life. Her husband operates a car rental, and she wants to improve and expand the business.

The other members of Saima's group are Shahida B., Shahnaz B., Suriya B. and Akhter-un-nisa B., all of whom are hardworking entrepreneurs who plan an important role earning income for their families. They operate various businesses including rickshaws, fruit sales and a restaurant.

loans.use: Expand car rental service

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is a forty-seven year old mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She designs and manufactures African cloth. She buys plain cloth and then designs floral and other arrangements in dye. These arrangements are then transfered to the cloth and dried. She has been in this business for three years.

After her cloth is ready for sale, she travels to Tema, Ghana’s largest harbor town, to sell the cloth. She will use the proceeds of the cloth to buy more plain cloth and dyes.

Alberta is a member of the "God is Alive" lending group. The lending group use a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure payment.

loans.use: To buy plain cloth and dyes

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. is forty two years old. She is married with three children, who are currently in school. Margaret recognizes the fact that motherhood comes with the responsibility of hard work and she works with the motivation of supporting her children.

Margaret bakes all kinds of cakes, from birthday cakes to wedding cakes. She has been in business for the past ten years. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like vegetable oil, margarine and flour to expand her production. This will increase the income for her family. Margaret belongs to the community group called Shepherd Trust Group. In this group, members act as social collateral for each to guarantee access to loans. They also help each other to repay the loans through positive peer pressure.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like vegetable oil, margarine, flour etc.

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en: Rosina A. is a forty eight year divorced mother of five children who are currently in school. She is a trader and sells gari, yam, groundnuts and maize in her neighborhood. Gari is produced from milled cassava, dried and fried and it is one the local foods that is enjoyed by many Ghanaian with cooked beans and palm oil. Rosina uses part of her business profits to finance her children’s education. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of gari, tubers of yam, beans, groundnut and maize to increase her stock of goods for sale and she hopes to increase her income to pay her children’s school fees. Her greatest dream is to see all her children graduate from high school and university and that is her motivation to work. She is a member of the trust group called “Nyame Asem” (God’s work). In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and utilizes peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of gari, tubers of yam, beans, groundnut and maize.

loans.name: Babara's Group

texts.en:
Babara baji is the wife of Nazir A., and they live in the city of Chichawatni in Pakistan. She is the mother of two children: one daughter and one son. Her daughter is 4 years old, and her son is 1 years old. Her husband is a driver, and he has been in this profession for the last 5 years. Babara baji is a housewife, and she states that she truly enjoys house-related work and taking care of the children. She is applying for a loan for her husband so that he may buy his own auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

She is joined in her loan group by the following individuals: (1) Asia baji, who seeks a loan to buy animals to resell; (2) Razia baji and (3) Bushra baji, both of whom request loans to expand their scrap businesses; and (4) Najma baji, who is in need of a loan to expand her fruit business.

This is a group loan. As such, the loan proceeds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Further, the members mutually guarantee each other's loans; therefore, if one member does not repay her loan, the other members are responsible for the arrears.

loans.use: To improve and expand their respective businesses (e.g., by purchasing a rickshaw, animals, fruit, etc.)

loans.name: Silvia Juana

texts.es:
She started her business with an investment of 20 soles (US $ 6-7) in the sale of spices, nowadays she invests 150- 200 soles weekly (US $ 50-70), generating a profit of 90-100 soles a week (US $ 30-35) She considers that her husband was a hindrance in her life, who did not allow her to grow and was only a breadwinner; now she fights alone to raise her two younger children and hopes to buy their land in order to have a place to live.

Silvia is 33 years old, is a member of the communal bank “Señor del Cautivo II” of Huaraz. With this loan of 800 soles (US $ 275)that will be provided by the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, she will buy three sakcs of red chili pepper, yellow chili pepper and garlic to store and then go sell them. This loan will be repaid in six months.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

Inicio su negocio con 20 soles de inversión, en la venta de especerías, en la actualidad invierte de 150 a 200 soles semanales, generándole una ganancia de 90 a 100 soles a la semana. Considera que su esposo fue un estorbo en su vida, quien no le permitió crecer y solo era un mantenido, ahora lucha sola, por hacer crecer a sus dos hijos menores, espera comprar su terreno para tener un lugar donde vivir.

Silvia tiene 33 años, es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor del Cautivo II” de Huaraz. Con este préstamo de S/. 800 soles que le otorgará el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, ella comprará 3 sacos de ají panca, amarillo, rojo y ajos para almacenarlo y luego ir vendiéndolo. Este préstamo será pagado en 6 cuotas.

loans.use: Purchase of spices

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama M. is a single parent and has 2 children. She has never received schooling. Ama sells a variety of local dish like Banku (a product of maize and cassava dough), Wakye (acombination of rice and beans) and Fufu (a combination of cassava and plantain pounded together). These are the most popular meals in the country.

Her chop bar is located in Abrobiano in Elmina, where she has worked since 2007. Ama uses her income to pay utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase food stuffs and ingredients such as rice, beans, oil, cassava, fish, meat, maize and others. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to reinvest.

loans.use: Ama will use the loan to purchase food stuffs and ingredients such as rice, beans, oil, cassava, fish, meat, maize and others.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Ester K. from Dar es Salaam. She is married and has two children, ages 5 and 9. Ester has been running a poultry business since 2002. Raising kuku (kuku means chicken in Swahili) is popular in Tanzania for a number of reasons. Firstly, raising chickens requires little start-up capital. You can start with a few and either add to them as you go or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. Her business is doing well. She works at the business for eight hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by one employee. Esther currently earns about $200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $750 USD to buy more chicks and their feed. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Esther thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and feed

loans.name: Susan Karin

texts.es:
Susan es socia de Bancomunal El Pino. Sonia es conviviente y tiene 24 años, no tiene hijos por el momento.     
Susan tiene su negocio de venta de ropa hace 1 año, ella entrega  pedidos  de ropa que le hacen sus clientes, Susan vende mas en asentamientos Humanos. 
Susan necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa.    
Susan sueña con tener una tienda  de ropa propia.
texts.en:
Susan is a member of El Pino Communal Bank. Sonia, her roommate, is 24 years old. Susan doesn't have children at this time. She has had a clothing business for a year. She delivers orders of clothes to her clients and sells more in the Humanos neighborhood. Susan needs a loan for 400 soles that she will use to purchase clothing. Her dream is to have her own clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena A. is 67 years old and a widow with 2 children. She sells provisions, drinks, and pure water. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She requests a $275 loan to purchase more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en:
Yem Rem, age 19, is a rice farmer. He makes a living growing rice as well as raising poultry. He will sell his poultry for slaughter three or four months after breeding and he has been doing this business since 2007. The business is going well and he earns approximately $5 a day. Yem Rem has no children and he is married to Mrs. Leap Tom, 19, a housewife. The young couple work hard every day.

Rem hopes to expand and improve his business. Hence, he would like to apply for a loan to buy more poultry to raise and to use the remaining money to repair his existing poultry cage.

loans.use: To buy more poultry and to repair his existing poultry cage.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina has been a private entrepreneur for some years and she works in the central market. She sells paint, brushes, and other items of this type, in Cahul. Her main activity is to manage the business, to have more sales, however, she works alone. The business is located in Cahul town.

Galina is experienced in commerce and has been in business for about 10 years. This is her second loan borrowed from MicroInvest. With the first one she was very diligent and the payments were always made on time. The purpose of the loan is to increase the assortment of goods.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of her goods

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora María del Pilar Ruiz D. tiene 25 años, vive en el distrito de Paijan,  provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio Secretariado Ejecutivo, carrera que no ejerció debido a que los sueldos no cubrían sus expectativas, tiene 02 hijos que dependen económicamente  de ella.
María se dedica a la venta de regalos y adornos, se inicio vendiendo ropa interior y regalos, con el tiempo fue abandonando la venta de ropa y dedicándose solo a la venta de regalos y sandalias por campaña de verano negocio que le es muy rentable el mismo que lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio.
 Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Confianza”, lo invirtió en la compra de mercadería para aumentar su capital.
Con el crédito de 800 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de  sandalias para campaña de verano.
María sueña con tener un stand donde pueda vender mecería, bijouteri y ropa.
texts.en:
Maria del Pilar Ruiz Diaz is 25 years old and lives in the district of Paijan, province of Ascope, department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied to be an executive secretary but did not practice her career because the salary would not have covered her expenses as she has two children that economically depend on her. Maria dedicates herself to the sale of gifts and decorations. She started off selling undergarments and gifts and in time she stopped selling clothes and dedicated herself to selling only gifts and sandals during the summer. She carries out this business from her home and the business is very profitable. Maria invested the first loan that she received in the amount of 300 soles from the communal bank "Honestidad y Confianza" in purchasing merchandise in order to increase her capital. This loan which she is requesting in the amount of 800 soles and which she will repay in four months will be invested in purchasing sandals for the summer. Maria dreams of having a stand where she can sell her merchandise, costume jewelry and clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sandals to sell during the summer season.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
P., age 46, is a resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has five children. The two oldest work with her and the  three youngest attend school. She is married to Nat, age 40, who is a police officer who protects the community. 

P. has been selling clothes in front of the Takeo Temple since 1980. She is a responsible mother and a friendly seller and she has a lot of clients, including tourists and locals. Her shop is full of traditional and modern clothes. She wants to increase her income, so P. is taking a loan of $500 to buy more traditional clothes for her shop. The loan will help the family to attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more traditional clothes for her shop

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida M. is 26 years old. She is the married mother of one daughter who is currently in primary school. She lives with her daughter and husband in a rented apartment in Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She says that though her husband is employed it is necessary that she work as well, in order to make some income to support him financially. 
Vida sells crates of eggs. She procures the eggs at cost-effective prices from poultry farmers in nearby villages. Vida then supplies the eggs to retailers and food vendors in her community. She has been in business for four years. Vida wants a loan to procure eggs in bulk so as to maximize her profit margin. She aspires to give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure crates of eggs

loans.name: Tohirchon

texts.ru: Тохирчону 19 лет. Еще не женат и живет с родителями. Окончил школу и сразу стал заниматься бизнесом. Выбрал куплю продажу сухофруктами и уже приобрел определенный опыт в этой деятельности. Его оборотный капитал пока небольшой, поэтому он решил получить небольшой займ для его увеличения. Займ собирается погасить в течении 4 месяцев.
texts.en:
Tohirchon is 19 years old. He is not married yet and lives with his parents. He graduated from school and started his own business right away. He chose to buy and sell dry fruits and has already acquired and good experience in this field. His working capital is still small and this is why he decided to get a small loan to increase it. He plans to pay off the loan within 4 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks in her shop. Faith is 34 years old and married with 2 children. Faith is a LAPO client. Faith hopes for a loan of N120,000 to purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says  thank you to all Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
Cristóbal tiene 36 años, está casado con Nancy de de 31 años de edad. El matrimonio tiene dos hijos de 11 y 8 años, ambos van a la escuela. Cristóbal posee un terreno de 3 has. en el cual cultiva  todos tipo de hortalizas (lechugas, acelga, perejil, locote, tomate, entre otros); además el mismo se encarga de repartir sus productos a diferentes puntos del país.
Cristóbal es un sacrificado hombre que se dedica al cultivo y venta de hortalizas, mientras que su esposa se encarga de criar y educar a sus hijos. Cristóbal empieza con sus actividades desde muy temprano todos los días de lunes a lunes oficio que aprendió de sus padre desde muy pequeño, está muy orgulloso de su trabajo por que cuenta con el apoyo de su familia, además el negocio le genera muy buenos resultados.
En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos como: semillas, insecticidas, químicos, media sombra, etc. que son empleados en las cosechas.
texts.en:
Cristóbal is 36 years old and married to 31 year old Nancy. The couple has 2 children ages 11 and 8, both attend school. Cristóbal owns 3 hectares of land where he grows all kinds of crops (lettuce, chard, parsley, peppers, tomato and more); in addition he himself is in charge of distributing the products to different parts of the country. Cristóbal is a self-sacrificing man who grows and sells crops, while his wife is in charge of raising and educating their children. Cristóbal begins his work very early every day, 7 days a week. He learned this work from his father as a small boy. He is very proud of his work because he can count on the support of his family, in addition the business generates good income for him. He is seeking a loan to buy items such as: seeds, insecticides, chemicals, landscaping fabric, etc. which are used in growing the crops.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to raise crops

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
"T. Trương Thị is a 51 year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. is the group leader of a five member loan group offered by SEDA. Each member of the group receives an individual loan and is responsible for paying back the entire loan if someone is delinquent or defaults. The name of this group is Ô Cách 11.

T. is married and has three adult aged children. To make a living, T. owns and operates a business in the agricultural sector raising livestock. While not her only means of generating revenue, the main source comes from raising cattle for sale. T. has engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 1.500.000 VND a month.

T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services, to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. is requesting her first loan from SEDA of 5.152.000 VND to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. T. plans to use the revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Hoàng Thị L. is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. 2. Trương Thị T. is a 37 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business. 3. Trương Thị Trà is a 27 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business. 4. Nguyễn Thị M. is a 20 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam ---------------------------------------------- T. Trương Thị (20203050067) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 11 (11). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND. T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Hoàng Thị L. (20203050068) là 44 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Trương Thị T. (20203050069) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. 3. Trương Thị Trà (20203050070) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. 4. Nguyễn Thị M. (20203050071) là 20 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: Purchase livestock feed and supplies.

loans.name: Mrs. Koemly Yi Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people living in Kaoh Reah Leu Village in Kandal Province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes.

Mrs. Koemly Y. is the 47-year-old village bank president. Her husband, Mr. Chhum Dany, is a musician who is hired by people to play during weddings, parties, and so on. This couple has two children who are employed in a garment factory.

Mrs. Koemly Y. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows vegetables. In her growing, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to grow more vegetables on her field. In order to solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers and pesticide for her cultivation. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s conditions with this loan.

All the members are in the picture but two of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers and pesticide for her cultivation

loans.name: Marelyn

texts.en:
Marelyn C. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 41 years old. Marelyn is separated from her spouse. To make a living, Marelyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food in the local community. Marelyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In February 2009, Marelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Marelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.es:
María, es una mujer dedicada al comercio, casada desde hace 22 años, madre de tres hijos, su esposo Ramón Veliz dedicado a la pesca en alta mar, oficio que lo  viene realizando desde hace algunos años y que requiere de mucho riesgo.
Ella cuenta con una pequeña  tienda en su propia casa, tiene la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, sal, nos comentó que desde hace 5 Años empezó con algo pequeño, vendiendo bolos, caramelos, galletas, fue ahorrando hasta que  invirtió una cantidad de dinero para poder comprar otros productos.
