María en lo actuales momento se siente muy bien con su tienda pero aspira poder crecer con su negocio quiere comprar vitrinas, un congelador y mas víveres, pero le falta un gran detalle el dinero, por ello decide solicitar un préstamo de $ 1100 dólares a la fundación ESPOIR  y una vez que lo reciba poder invertir  todo ese dinero en lo antes mencionado.
texts.en:
María, is a woman dedicated to business. She has been married for 22 years and is the mother of three children. Her husband, Ramón Veliz, works fishing on the high seas, a profession that he has been practicing for many years and that requires of a lot of risk. She relies on a small store in her own house, where she sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, oil, and salt. She commented to us that she began 5 years ago in a somewhat small way, selling candies, caramels, and cookies. She was saving until she could invest enough money to be able to buy other products. At present María feels very good about her store, but she aspires to be able to grow her business. She wants to buy showcases, a freezer and more provisions, but lacks a great detail: the money. Because of this she decided to request a loan of $ 1100 dollars from the foundation ESPOIR and, once she receives it she will be able to invest all that money in the items mentioned previously.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy showcases, a freezer and more provisions for her store.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es: Valentina tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 17 años se dedica a la venta de la alfalfa que cultiva en sus tierras y de la leche que producen sus vacas. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano por la mañana para extraer la leche y limpiar su establo. Además, el guano que recoge le sirve como un fertilizante orgánico para sus tierras de cultivo. Adicionalmente, elabora quesos que ella misma vende, y con todas estas actividades logra sostener la economía familiar. Esta es la cuarta vez que Valentina tiene un crédito con MFP y tiene grandes deseos de continuar siendo parte de su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de sacos de abono y para el pago del transporte de sus cosechas desde sus chacras.

loans.use: Compra de abono y pago del transporte de sus productos

loans.name: Josephine Jerop

texts.en:
Josephine  is thirty five years old and married to Simon Kibor. They have four children, named Purity Chepkoror -twelve years, Valerine Chepchumba -nine years, Shoney Ruto -seven years and Daryl Kipkemboi - four and half years.

The client has been in the selling clothes business for one year. She was introduced to KADET through other existing clients and she has no loan from other MFI's.

Josephine gets clothes from an open air market and supplies to her customers in their houses and places of work. She intends to use the loan to increase her stock of sweaters, duvettes and ladies blouses as the profit margin is wide for these products.

With the extra profit, the client intends to develop the piece of land she had acquired two years ago. Josephine believes that she is hardworking and innovative. Her hopes and dreams are to expand the business so that she can be stable in the business and increase her income so as to improve the living standards of her family.

 ABOUT KADET LTD. 

Kadet Ltd is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya that was formed in 2000 to offer access to financial services to the rural communities through the microfinance model. Kadet is the only microfinance in Kenya with a strong rural presence and a genuine concern for the welfare of children and the communities we serve. As a member of the Association of Microfinance Institutions in Kenya, Kadet has continued to empower communities by providing access to easy-to-pay loans. Loan products available at the MFI are designed to offer solutions to challenges facing communities in these rural habitations. Obtain more information on Kadet from the press section of the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The client intends to increase the stock of sweaters, duvettes and ladies blouses because the profit margin is wide.

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
La socia  es natural de Quillabamba, pero hace algunos meses radica en la ciudad el Cusco, ella pertenece al banco comunal grupo esperanza. La socia vive en santa Beatriz D-4 en Cusco.

La socia tiene 26 años de edad y es soltera, ella en la ciudad del Cusco viene trabajando como cocinera en un restaurante, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar algunas cosas para uso propio y poco a poco continuar juntando y ahorrando dinero para comprar sus cositas para su hogar.

La socia esta muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus préstamo en el tiempo programado.

loans.use: uso personal.

loans.name: Ulana

texts.en: Ulana has one small daughter but no husband. She makes window curtains and decorations. Her business is located at home. The clients come to her with their ideas. Ulana shows them examples, pictures and give advice as to how better decorate their windows. Ulana has been in this business for 4 years. She makes about 4,000 UAH per months. Ulana would like to borrow 10,400 UAH to purchase fabric and threads for her work. When she gets too much work Ulana employees two more ladies to help her. Ulana wants to improve her living conditions and make enough to take good care of her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase materials in assortiment

loans.name: Marie's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are Marie C., Issa J., Ramatu K., and Yeabu K.. They named their group "Marie's Group" after the group's leader. They are small scale businesswomen based in the city of Makeni who have come to SMT/Kiva to seek their very first loan. They are requesting a loan of 500,000 SLL each to enable them to expand their businesses.

Marie C. is the leader of this group. Marie was born in Makeni thirty-five years ago. She is married to an architect, and they have three children. One of their children is in Junior Secondary School III (JSS III), another is in class two, and the last child is not of school going age. Marie sells fried food and has been in the business for many years.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en:
Mr. Noeun C. assists his wife selling fruit. They buy fruit from Derm Kor market in Phnom Penh for resale in front of a garment factory near their village. Noeun wants to create another business driving a remoque taxi (a motorbike connected to a trailer at the back). He will be able to earn more income to support his family. Hence, Noeun is requesting a loan of $1,200 US to buy a motorbike and a trailer for launching this business.

Noeun, 39, and his wife, Mrs. Chantha Sien, 40, have been married since 1990 and have five children: one son and four daughters. The eldest daughter works in garment factory and the other four children are in school. They live in a small village along National Road No. 5, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Noeun C. is not in the photo; his wife was available instead.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a trailer to drive as a remoque taxi

loans.name: Léonie

texts.fr: H. Léonie est née en 1970 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est une veuve et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Léonie vit seule avec ses enfants au quartier Finagnon à Cotonou depuis 10 ans. Seule Léonie assure les charges de la famille. Léonie a été à l'école jusqu'au secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Léonie vend des mèches et des produits pour cheveux dans sa boutique à son domicile. Léonie vend également des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Léonie s'approvisionne. Léonie est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de 8 crédits à ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. En vue de renforcer son activité surtout à l'approche des fêtes, et de mieux satisfaire ses clients, Léonie sollicite un neuvième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
H. Léonie was born in 1970 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is a widow and the mother of two children who are both in school. She has been living alone with her children in the Finagnon district in Cotonou for ten years. She alone ensures that family expenses are met. Léonie has attended secondary school. To provide for herself and these two children of her, she sells hair extensions and hair products in the shop in her home. She also sells mobile phone recharge cards. She stocks up from Dantokpa, the international marketplace of Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client who has already benefited from eight ALIDé loans, which have been repaid. With the aim of bolstering her business, especially as the holidays approach, and satisfying her customers further, she’s requesting a ninth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and phone cards

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and re-sell pagnes (a type of West African cloth) and clothing

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia JULIA tiene 26 años, es conviviente y tiene una hija llamada Nicol que tiene 5 años que estudia en el jardín. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la preparación de tortas, bocaditos a pedido. Sus clientes de la socia le hacen el pedido de 10 tortas a 15 tortas por día para eventos como cumpleaños, bautizos y matrimonios.  Ya es un año que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien, gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como harina, azúcar, leche, mantequilla y muchas cosas más. 

La socia es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “FUENTE DE VIDA” de la Asociación Arariwa. Cusco antiguamente, fue la capital del Imperio Inca y una de las ciudades más importantes del Virreinato del Perú. Declarada Patrimonio de la Humanidad y capital arqueológica de América 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our partner Julia is 26 years old, a live-in partner, and has a daughter named Nicol, who is five years old and in kindergarten. She alternates her household chores with the preparation of cakes and snacks by request. Her clients order 10 to 15 cakes a day for events such as birthday parties, baptisms, and weddings. She has had this business for a year now, and it has gone very well, thanks to all of the effort she puts forth in her work. Our partner is a hard-working and enterprising mother who is helping her family get ahead. She requires this loan to purchase more supplies, such as flour, sugar, milk, butter, and many other things. She is a native of the city of Cusco and belongs to the communal bank "Fuente de Vida" of the Asociacion Arariwa. In the past, Cusco was the capital of the Inca Empire and one of the most important cities of the viceroyalty of Peru. It was declared a patrimony of humanity and archaeological capital of America. Our partner is grateful for the opportunity provided through this medium, and likewise is committed to fulfill her payment in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies such as flour, sugar, milk, butter, and more

loans.name: Kimchheng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimchheng H. is 31 years old and she is the group leader of four members. They will each use the loan for a different purpose and they all live in Akreiy Ksatr village in Kandal province.

Mrs. Kimchheng H. is a grocer and her husband, Mr. Sophiep Chuon, is a construction laborer. Mrs. Kimchheng H. now wants to expand her store so she decided to ask for a loan to buy groceries to support her business.

Mrs. Kimchheng H. is the mother of four children, three of whom are studying at a local public school and the other is too young to go to school or work.

loans.use: To buy groceries to support her business

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La señora Delia M. Machuca es una mujer luchadora, tiene 45 años, es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos de 11, 18, 21 y 24 años, se dedica día a día al cuidado de 7 niños, ya que tiene un pequeño huahuawasi (kindergarten), llamado “LAS FRESITAS”, desde hace 9 años se inicio en este negocio porque sus hijos estaban pequeños y necesitaban de su cuidado y eso no le permitía salir de casa, además Delia también se dedica a otras actividades como tejidos, bordados de polos y venta de ceviche los domingos, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado arreglar su casa de material noble, pero ella tiene un gran sueño que es techar su casa.
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido para las instalaciones de agua y desagüe, Delia agradece el apoyo brindado ya que le es de mucha ayuda, para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Delia M. Machuca is a hardworking woman of 45. She lives with a partner and has four children of ages 11, 18, 21, and 24. Her business is a “huahuawasi” [kindergarten] called “Las Fresitas” [Little Strawberries], where she cares for seven children each day. Delia started this business nine years ago because she needed a business where she could be with her young children. She also has other side businesses, such as sewing, embroidery, and selling ceviche on Sundays. As a result of her hard work, she has managed to fix up her house with good materials, and her biggest dream is to add a new roof. This loan will be spent on the installation of water and sewage plumbing to her house. She is grateful for the support provided, which is a big help in improving her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Water and drainage plumbing

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 60-year-old married man and father of three children. He has owned a mini-market for the past 20 years. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his children's needs. A good number of the village clients pass by his shop and buy all types of products. 

Today, Mohamad is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase additional merchandise needed to satisfy the needs of his customers and make a profit.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana B. started farming in 2003. It has been her family’s source of income ever since. With eight children, she and her husband double their effort to make the most out of the farm. Ana is also starting to venture into another type of business,  hog raising, to better improve her income. She works hard to provide her family food to eat, clothes to wear and to give her children a proper education.

Ana is a new member of CEVI. She is applying for a loan of PHP6, 000. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies like fertilizer and hopefully will have enough left to buy piglets to start her hog raising business.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Sharifhocha

texts.ru: Зоиров Шарифхоча проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 50 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Шарифхоча имеет высшее образование. Более 10 лет занимается торговлей. У него торговая точка на рынке "Саховат". Он в основном торгует продуктами питания. До этого преподавал в школе. Шарифхоча хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить большую прибыль. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Sharifhocha Z. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 50 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife is a homemaker. Sharifhocha has a higher education. He has been involved in retail sales for over 10 years and has a retail outlet at the "Sahovat" market. He primarily sells food products. Previously, he was a school teacher. Sharifhocha wants to expand his business and make a large profit. He is requesting the loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en: Sourn L., 34, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. She is a housewife, while her husband sells car spare parts in the city, earning an income of $5 USD per day. L. is requesting a loan of $400 USD to purchase more spare parts to expand her husband’s current business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to pay for the children’s school. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy car spare parts

loans.name: Sandra Yanira

texts.es: Sandra Yanira G. O. de 40 años de edad, reside en San Juan Opico, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como mecánico. Sandra posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad así mismo posee una venta de tortillas, la cual está ubicada en su propia casa de habitación, lugar al cual llegan las personas a traer los pedidos de tortillas, negocios los cuales se completan, ya que cuando las personas llegan a comprar tortillas aprovechan y compran otros productos. Sandra es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual se esfuerza a diario por obtener una mejor vida junto a su esposo. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar maíz, gas propano, golosinas, pan, bebidas y todo lo necesario para invertir en la tienda, esto de manera que pueda obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sandra Yanira G. O., 40 years old, lives in San Juan Opica, located in La Libertad department. She lives together with her husband, who is a mechanic. Sandra has a shop where she sells basic necessities and also tortillas. The shop is located in her house, and people come to bring tortilla orders which she then completes. When people return to enjoy the tortillas they also buy other products. Sandra is a very hard-working woman who works hard every day to have a better quality of life with her husband. She is seeking a loan to have the necessary funds to purchase maize, propane gas, sweets, bread, lollies and everything else necessary to invest in the shop. In this way she hopes to obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perishables

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Onokwafo Nyame Trust Group

texts.en:
Abena B. is a lovely and hard-working woman. She is married to a cobbler and together they have three children. She is now thirty-eight years old. 

Abena lives together with her family in a family house at Sunyani, where she also does her trading. She is able to provide support to her family’s financial needs through the sale of 'kenkey'. Kenkey is one of Ghanaians' favorite local dishes that is rich in carbohydrates. It is prepared with corn dough made into balls, cooked 1-2 hours, and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish. It could also be enjoyed with other sauces. 'Kenkey' is known throughout all the tribes in Ghana and commonly sold on most streets.  'Kenkey' is a heavy diet and much preferred over beverages by people who do manual drudgery. Selling for the past 16 years, Abena has attracted quite a number of regular customers through good customer relations. 

Abena is currently the leader of a trust bank group called “Onokwafo Nyame” (translated as 'Faithful God'), made up of six members. The other members are also engaged in trades such as foodstuff selling, 'kenkey' selling, grocery sales, used clothing sales etc. They are requesting the loan to support their businesses. Their common dream is to be financially self-sustaining and be able to support their children through quality education.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients like maize, vegetables, fish etc.  in bulk

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline I. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old and married. To make a living, she owns and operates a service-based business, providing motorcab services to local community members. Evangeline's motorcab was on a trip when this picture was taken. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $200 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as working capital. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase spare parts for the motorcab. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the motorcab

loans.name: Tat

texts.en: Mrs. Tat T., 36, is a local rice trader in the village. She always buys rice in bulk at reasonable price from farmers. She also saves up many kg of rice before selling out for a profit. By doing this job, Tat T. is able to generate formal proceeds to help feed her five kids. All five of the children are attending the public local school. Also, she relies on the income from her husband’s business. He fishes in and around Tunle Sap Lake. Tat T. will use the loan she has requested to purchase piglets for a pigpen she built. With any remaining money from the loan, she will order rice to resell.

loans.use: To purchase piglets.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie M. is a married woman who lives in Purok Talisay, Brgy. Enclaro Vista Aligre, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  food vending and nipa (palm leaves that are woven together and used as roofing material). Her husband, Leopoldo, who is 56 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have six children who are 10 to  24 years old. 

Rosie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000 — increasing the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500, which she intends to use to lease nipa so that she could continue to save up for their future.  Rosie M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Yann Na Teom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has eighteen members who live in Thma Kor village, Kandal province. Mrs. Yann Na T. is the village bank president who was  selected by the other members. Each member will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Yann Na T. was born in 1964. She and her husband, Mr. Mun Lay, are fruit sellers at their local market where they are able to earn soM. money to raise their childR..

Since their business is going well they want to expand it but they do not have enough money to do this. So, to improve their business, Mrs. Yann Na T. is seeking a loan to buy more fruit to sell.

Mrs. Yann Na T. is the mother of three childR. whom all are studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Sithon

texts.en:
Mrs. Sithon M. (in the photo), is 42 years old, and has been a garment factory worker for five years. Her husband, Mr. Sokhom Khem, is 46 years old, and he raises and sells cows. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have one daughter who attends school. 

Sithon is applying for her first loan of $700 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Sabanoh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Sabanoh” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is John T. who is pictured on the left. John is fifty years old. He is married and has four children. Two of Mr. T.’s children are attending primary school, one is in secondary school and the other is already grown-up.

For more than five years now, John has been selling plastic bowls, spoon, cups, dishes, etc. With his share of the loan, John will buy plastic bowls, spoons, cups, etc.

loans.use: Buys plastic bowls, spoon, cups, dishes, etc.

loans.name: Voul

texts.en:
Voul T., 34, is a professional silk weaver, making $2.50 United States dollars each day in the Takeo province. She is married and has three children living at home to support. Her husband makes approximately $5.00 U.S. dollars every day as a taxi driver. 

Voul T. would like a loan of $500.00 U.S. dollars to purchase more silk. 

(Note: Voul T. and her husband were not available for the picture so Voul T.'s daughter is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase more silk.

loans.name: Mighty Power Group

texts.en:
Akine S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Mighty Power. He is 35 years old, single, and has two children who are between the ages of two months to five years. Akine was only able to attend school to eleventh grade due to a lack of financial support. He describes himself as a faithful man.

For five years he has been selling milk, tea, sugar, powder, soap, hair grease and mosquito spray in the West Point Market in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 20,000 LRD portion of this 71,000 LRD group loan to buy more cartons of milk, tea, sugar, powder, soap, hair grease and mosquito spray. His dreams are to improve his business, educate his children and build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Amondou B. is inset at lower right because he was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of milk, tea, sugar, powder, soap, hair grease and mosquito spray

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of thirteen people located in Daeum Rues village, Kandal province. Mrs. Sorn Y. is 51 years old and is the village bank president selected by the members, who will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Sorn Y. is a widow with two children, who are seamstresses in the garment factory. She farms rice on a rented plot of land and works very hard to support the family. Since she does not have enough money to support the farm, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate rice.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate rice

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin is a young woman from Tel village next to Nablus city in Palestine. She is married and has one child, a boy. Yasmin's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee. Yasmin wanted to use the plenty of free time she now has since her son began attending pre-school.

Yasmin rented a small clothing store where she sells kids wear. Yamsin bought winter cloths for the new season, she came to FATEN and took $3,000 loan, and will use some of the money to improve the store.

Yasmin appears in the picture here at her store in Tel village.

loans.use: Improve the store

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo D. is 42 years old, married and has four school-aged children. He is from the village of Divisoria, Santiago City in the province of Isabela on the Luzon islands. Reynaldo runs a general store from which he sells a variety of different products in the local community. Reynaldo has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Reynaldo joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. Reynaldo successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Reynaldo is requesting a new loan, his third from ASKI, of 9000 PHP that will be used for the same purpose. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: El sr. Víctor Hugo se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos,  el vive en la zona de Chacacollo sector de las ladrilleras, es muy dedicado a su familia  tiene un hijo en su primer matrimonio de 14 años y con su nueva familia uno de 10, es muy trabajador y  responsable, El Sr. Víctor Hugo  quedo viudo muy joven, fue un golpe para el pero supo salir adelante por su hijito que quedo huérfano de madre muy pequeño, pero la vida le dio una segunda oportunidad se caso de nuevo y su esposa se quedo al cuidado de su pequeño con quien tiene a su segundo hijo,  el destino de su crédito es para poder mejorar el lugar de trabajo y construir un horno para los ladrillos y así poder mejorar su situación económica, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Victor Hugo makes bricks and he lives in the region of Chacacollo, in the brick making district.  He is very devoted to his family. He has a son from his first marriage that lasted 14 years. He has a 10-year old son with his wife now. He is very hardworking and responsible. Victor Hugo was widowed very young and it was a blow to him but he was able to pull through for the sake of his baby boy that was left orphaned from his Mom. But life gave him a second chance and he married again. His wife cared for his little one and now they have a second son. The loan will be destined to improve his shop and to build an oven to bake bricks. This will improve his financial situation and he is very grateful for the support he has received.

loans.use: To build an oven and purchase materials.

loans.name: Grayik

texts.en:
Grayik H. is 45 years old. He lives in Zovaber village, Sevan area with his wife and his three children: two daughters and a son.
 
In 2002 Grayik  rented a small workshop where he has been involved in a tire casing repair service till now. Thanks to his business income, he provides for his family's needs and pays for his children's education. 

At the same time Grayik and his family engage in farming: they have cows, sheep, pigs and chickens and a plot of land. Grayik’s wife and son do the major part of the farm work and so help him to cover their family’s needs.

Grayik is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy some up-to-date tire casing repair tools for his workshop.

loans.use: To buy some up-to-date tire casing repair tools for his workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 15 sacks of flour; sugar, yeast and salt

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es: La representante del grupo las ORQUIDEAS  es la Sra. Erika   es la líder del grupo vive en la zona de Miraflores en la casa de sus suegros, tiene un hijo, ella vende pan, rosquetes, refrescos en la parada de buses que van al Chapare, es muy conocida en la zona, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería como refrescos ya que por estas fechas de fin de año su venta se incrementa ya que muchas personas viajan a l Chapare a pasar sus vacaciones. El  grupo  de personas jóvenes madres dos de ellas, esta conformado por vecinas y amigas de muchos años, viven en casa en alquiler  y cada una de ellas tienen  actividad propia venta de refrescos    venta de ropa interior, destinaran su crédito para incrementar su mercadería .
texts.en:
The representative of the Las ORQUIDEAS (The Orchids) group is Erika.  She is the group leader and lives in the Miraflores area in her in-laws’ house.  She has a son.  She sells bread, rosquetas (typical regional cookie) and soft drinks at the stop for buses going to Chapare. She is very well known in the area.

She will use the money from the loan to buy merchandise like soft drinks because sales during this end of year season increase because many people travel to Chapare to spend their vacations there.

This group of young people, two of them mothers, is composed of neighbors and friends of many years.  They live in rentals and each has her own business selling soft drinks or selling underwear.  They will use their loans to increase their merchandise.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca Estela F. de 46 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Santa Ana, en donde vive junto a su compañero de vida. Ella posee una pequeña librería, la cual esta ubicada frente a un colegio, lo cual es de mucho beneficio para Blanca, así mismo durante la temporada de fin de año comercializa juguetes adornos navideños entre otros más. Blanca solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir la librería con todo lo necesario para este inicio de clases, la cual se lleva a cabo en el mes de enero, por lo que ella desea aprovechar al máximo este fin de año debido a que todos los productos se obtienen a precios más bajos. Blanca desea mucho crecer en su negocio y de esta forma contar con más ingresos.
texts.en:
Blanca Estela F. is 46 years old and lives in Santa Ana department with her life partner.  Blanca owns a small bookstore which is located opposite a school.  This is of great benefit to Blanca.  During the end-of-year season, she also sells toys, Christmas decorations and other products.

Blanca is requesting a loan so that she can stock her bookstore with everything she needs for the upcoming back-to-school period which is in January.  She would like to be able to take full advantage of the end-of-year period because all the products she needs can all be bought at lower prices.  Blanca would very much like to grow in her business and, in this way, make more income.

loans.use: To buy stationery items to stock her bookstore

loans.name: San

texts.en: San V., 48, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia – an area known for angkorean temples. San sells groceries. Her husband is a farmer, earning $1 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $41 US on food and $50 US on other expenses. V. is requesting a loan of $800 US to fix up her grocery store. In the future, she would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To fix up a grocery store

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN ROQUE”  iniciará su ciclo número uno en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana,  se han reunido 8 mujeres para solicitar crédito y recibir servicios en salud y capacitación. Siendo una asociación comunal que se reúne por primera vez,  se observa entusiasmo y al mismo tiempo varias de las socias manifiestan timidez. 
Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: venta de productos de limpieza, costura de bolsas, venta de comida, venta de Wallake (caldo de pescado llamado Karachi), venta de paja, costura de camperas, pasanaquera, venta de comida.

La A.C. “San Roque” está dirigida por una mesa directiva, la señora Ana María es la presidenta, la señora Sofía es la tesorera y la señora Flora es la secretaria de actas. 

La señora  Ana María, presidenta de la banca comunal, es una mujer joven de 27 años de edad, aún no ha formalizado la relación con su pareja, tiene un niño pequeño y está en espera de un segundo bebé.   La señora Ana María aprendió costura hace  varios años en el vecino país de la Argentina, el crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de una máquina de costura recta.  Por ahora su trabajo consiste en la costura, sus clientes le entregan piezas cortadas y ella devuelve el producto terminado.  Cuando su trabajo aumenta le ayudan sus hermanos.

Cuando se le consulta a la señora  Ana María qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde:  “el ahorro y la caja chica”.
texts.en:
The San Roque Communal Association is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana Community Center. The group consists of eight women who have joined together to request a loan as well as receive health services and training. Being a Communal Association that is meeting for the first time, the group is observed to have enthusiasm even though some of the members display shyness.

Several types of businesses are represented: selling cleaning products, handmade purses, food, Wallake (a fish stew also called “Karachi”), straw, handmade jackets, and general merchandise. The San Roque Communal Association is led by its Board of Directors: Sra. Ana María (President), Sra. Sofía (Treasurer), and Sra. Flora (Secretary of Records).

Sra. Ana María serves as the Communal Bank president. She is a young woman who is 27 years of age. Even though she has not formalized the relationship with her partner, they have a young son and hope to have a second child. Sra. Ana María learned how to sew several years ago in the neighboring country of Argentina. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy an upright sewing machine. Today her work consists of sewing for her customers who bring her cut pieces and she is in charge of making the finished product. When her workload increases, she has the help of her siblings.

When asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer, Sra. Ana María responded with “the savings and having available cash”.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Loudes requiere un crédito para la reparación y mantenimiento del vehiculo de su esposo, quien trabaja como chofer en el Sindicato de Transportes Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz. Lourdes es comerciante y su esposo es transportista. Estas actividades son la fuente de ingreso que tienen para su familia.

Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la Zona de Valle Hermoso de la Ciudad La Paz.
texts.en: Lourdes needs a loan to service and repair her husband’s vehicle.  He works as a driver in the Miraflores Transportation Syndicate in the city of La Paz.  Lourdes is a merchant and her husband is in public transportation.  These activities are the source of income for their family.   She lives in her parents’ house located in La Paz’s Valle Hermoso zone.

loans.use: For her husband's passenger transportation vehicle's repair and maintenance.

loans.name: Maleki

texts.fr: Monsieur  Maleki  est  marié  et  a  un enfant  à  charge.  Pour  répondre aux  besoins de sa famille, Il fait le commerce    de  cartes de recharge  et  Kit  de  connexion.    Il   cumule 4  ans  déjà  dans  cette  activité et  s’approvisionne au près  des  agréés   Togocel   et  Moov.   Il  revend   les  cartes  dans  une baraque à wuiti.  Il  demande un  prêt  pour satisfaire  plus  de  clients.
texts.en: Mr. Maleki is married and cares for one child.  To meet the needs of his family, he is in the business of selling KIT rechargeable phone cards.  He has been at this kind of work for four years already and he gets his supplies from authorized suppliers in Togocel and Moov.  He resells the cards from a booth in Wuiti.  He is requesting a loan so that he can meet the demands of more customers.

loans.use: to buy telephone cards

loans.name: Mariliz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” COMUZONE III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mariliz; la socia tiene 38 años de edad,casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende todo tipo de productos como arrzo,azúcar,leche,aceite,golosinas,gaseosa entre otros, ella abre su negocio desde las 06:00am hasta las 09:00pm de lunes a domingo bueno este horario puede variar dependiendo de las actividades que pueda realizar la socia a la vez es docente de profesión actualmente no ejerce su carrera ya que está dedicada a su negocio pero no descarta la posibilidad de volver  a trabajar en el sector magisterio más adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Mariliz is a member of the Communal Bank “Comuzone III” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 38 years old, married, and has two children. Mariliz divides her time between her daily activities and managing her grocery store. She sells all types of products such rice, sugar, milk, oil, candy, sodas, and other items. Mariliz operates her business from 6am to 9pm, Monday through Sunday. This schedule varies depending on other tasks that she must complete. Mariliz is a teacher, but she is not currently pursuing this profession so that she can remain dedicated to her business. She does not rule out the possibility of returning to teaching at a later point.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more merchandise for her grocery store. Mariliz is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia T. is from the village of Paingon, Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is a 65 year-old widow and has 6 adult children. Eugenia operates a family member's business in the retail sector, running a general store. She has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Eugenia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to buy canned goods, biscuits, cooking oil, soy sauce and other goods for her store. Eugenia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase two sacks of rice and groceries for her sari-sari store. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Eugenia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of rice and groceries for her sari-sari

loans.name: Nushaba

texts.ru: Nushaba M. 37 let. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Nushaba zamujem i imeyet 2 detey , odin iz kotorix uchitsya v kolledje druqoy v shkole. Nushaba seychas nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa. Ona uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. On delayet yogurt, kefir i prodayet u sebya doma.
texts.en: Nushaba M. is 37 years old.  She in an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her family. Nushaba is married and has two children.  One child goes to college and the other to school.  Nushaba needs 2300 AZN to buy a cow to expand her business.  She has been raising cattle for seven years.  She makes yogurt and kefir and sells it from her home.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria De Los Ángeles se dedica a la venta de refrescos. Tiene más de 12 años con este negocio, le ha ido muy bien con los pocos ingresos que ha obtenido por medio de la actividad. Fue con su Madre que ella aprendió este tipo de negocio y fue con el paso del tiempo que Maria logro adminístralo para proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos de cada día. Este financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, pan, galletas, refrescos, hielo, bolsitas, enchiladas y tajadas. Sueña con sacar adelante a sus dos hijos que están menores de edad a su cargo.
texts.en:
María De Los Ángeles sells refreshments.  She’s been in this business for over 12 years. She has done well with the little income she earns through this activity.  She learned this type of business from her mother and as time went by María managed to run it to provide her family with daily income.

This loan is to buy snacks, bread, cookies, soft drinks, ice, bags, enchiladas and fried banana chips.  She dreams with successfully raising her two minor children who are in her care.

loans.use: to buy snacks, bread, cookies, soft drinks, ice, bags, enchiladas and fried banana chips.

loans.name: Yesenia Catalina

texts.es:
Yesenia, de 31 años de edad, nacida en la Ceiba comarca localizada en el departamento de León , es casada, madre de tres hijos , ella es comerciante se dedica a la crianza de cerdo , siembra de maíz. Inicio con esfuerzos propios, sembrando 2 manzanas de maíz ,2 manzanas de frijoles  y después fue comprando animales como cerdos y gallinas para criarlos cuando ella empezó en este negocio tenia 18 años de edad. Además cuando no están buenas las ventas, ella se dedica a limpiar y sembrar maní, Hortalizas, tomate, cebollas que son otros  ingresos  que ella tiene para mantener a su familia. 
Solicito el préstamo para comprar cerdos de  raza para desarrollo y crianza. Ella espera poder hacer crecer su crianza de animales, espera poder diversificar su negocio atraves de la siembra de granos básicos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Dentro de sus planes esta poder tener una granja de cerdos reproductores. Su próxima meta es construir  un galerón para sus animales.
texts.en:
Yesenia, age 31, was born in the region of La Ceiba which is located in the Department of León. She is married and the mother of three children. Yesenia is a merchant who raises pigs and grows corn. Through her own efforts, she started out planting corn on two plots of land and beans on another two plots of land. Afterwards, she bought animals such as pigs and chickens to raise. Yesenia started her business when she was 18 years old. Whenever her sales are not good, she provides cleaning services and grows peanuts, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions to earn additional income to support her family.

Yesenia is requesting a loan to buy breeding pigs to raise and develop. She hopes to expand her animal business as well as diversify her activities to include growing grains so that she can improve the quality of life for her family. Her plans include having a farm for breeding pigs, but her next goal is to build a barn for her animals.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is 36 years old, married, and a father of two.  He runs a nursery school which is affiliated with a church.  The school is only one year old and he has employed three people.  He was able to start the school through financial support from Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to expand the school and register more pupils.  He has requested 20, 000 KES to buy desks and chairs for the classroom.

loans.use: to buy desks and chairs for the classroom.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang, 47 years old, is a sugarcane juice seller. Her husband is a coconut shaver. Their income is $11 per day. They have six children, but only one of them is still studying. 

Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees and $10 for other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike and a carriage to sell shaved coconut, sugarcane juice and eggs together. 

Before, her family were farmers, but the income was so bad that she couldn't support the children in school, so her husband wants to do another career to get more income to support the family and he found shaving coconut is the best one to start. He has found that he can make a good income from this career, so he would like to continue and make it better.  

She would like to send all of her children to school until they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and a carriage.

loans.name: Diane

texts.en:
Diane is 29 years old and she has a 10-year-old child. Her husband is a motorcyclist. 

Diane sells food stuffs and she has been selling foodstuffs such as green bananas for the past two years. This business has earned her enough income to buy her own motorcycle and meet the needs of her family. 

She needs a loan to buy more food stuffs in order to make more profits. With the profits she plans to save until she can afford to build her own family house.

loans.use: to buy green bananas and other food stuffs for resale.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto natural de la ciudad de Kimbiri, tiene 42 años de edad, convive con Gladis de 33 años y fruto de su relación concibieron 03 hijos a quienes desea brindarle una educación justa para que mañana mas tarde sean hombres de provecho. Alberto es un hombre centrado y con muchas responsabilidades que cumplir para el bien de su familia, por ello se despierta  muy temprano para dirigirse a su centro de labor y abrir las puertas de su negocio en espera de sus primeros consumidores. Desde sus 21 años viene dedicándose a la de venta de productos de primera necesidad, tales como arroz, azúcar, fideos, detergentes,   entre otros. Se siente muy contento en su puesto de trabajo, por que gracias a su puesto de ventas, construyó su propia casa y con ello también sustenta los gastos de educación de sus queridos hijos. Su  puesto de ventas se sitúa en la ciudad de Kimbiri y es muy concurrido por su clientela. Con el apoyo del crédito solicitado, llevará acabo uno de sus deseos como es el de comprar una moto carguero para así atender pedidos y distribuir la mercadería a domicilios. Espera contar con el apoyo económico para poder prestar un buen servicio a sus consumidores exigentes. Este será su 11avo crédito con MFP y ya se siente muy contento al saber que en esta oportunidad también contará con el apoyo de todos ustedes, para llevar consigo su propósito, además se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente como solía hacer en los anteriores créditos. Con los 2,000 mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará una moto carguero.
texts.en:
Alberto is from the city of Kimbiri. He is 42 years old. He lives with Gladis who is 33 years old. They have three children and want to provide them with a good education so that later on they will be good men.
Alberto is a balanced man and he has many responsibilities to fulfill for his family. He wakes up very early in order to get to his place of work and to open the doors of his business for the first customers. For 21 years, he has sold basic necessity products like rice, sugar, pasta, detergent and other items. He is very happy with his business. Thanks to his position, he has built his own house and also he is able to keep up with the educational expenses for his dear children. His stand is located in the city of Kimbiri and it is popular with his customers. With the assistance from the requested loan, he will be able achieve one of his dreams to purchase a cargo motorcycle so he can take orders and deliver merchandise to homes. He hopes he can count on the economic support in order to provide his demanding clients with good service. This with be his 11th loan with MFP. He feels very happy to know that this opportunity is possible with the support of all of you so he can reach his intention. In addition, he promises to make his payments on time like he has done with his previous loans. With the requested 2,000 Nuevos Soles, he will buy a cargo motorcycle.

loans.use: buy a cargo motorcycle.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 22 years old and lives in West Point. She is single and has a four-year-old child who is attending school. In the past, she has been selling rice, oil, and charcoal. The major problems she is faced with are fewer customers during the wet season and her very low inventory. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, and charcoal. She hopes to build her house and send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, and charcoal

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es:
La Sra. Martha Azucena es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es madre soltera de tres hijos a los que ha tratado de darles lo mejor y una buena educación, se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en un colegio de la localidad donde ha brindado sus servicios por más de veinte años para la buena educación de los niños.
Cuenta con su propia vivienda con buenas condiciones, la que ha mejorado gracias a su salario y a los distintos créditos que le ha otorgado Ceprodel, una de las necesidades que tiene en estos momentos es adquirir un préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como ladrillos, zinc, cemento, alfajillas, arena, azulejos y pago de mano de obra para construir una cocina en su casa de habitación, por tal razón decidió solicitar su quinto crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de cumplir con su necesidad.
texts.en:
Martha Azucena is a native of  El Sauce municipality and a single mother of 3 children for whom she tries to provide a good education. She has worked as a primary teacher in a local school for over 20 years, dedicated to providing such a good education. 

Martha has her own house and it is in good condition, because she has made improvements, using her salary and various loans provided by Ceprodel. One of her needs at present is to acquire a loan to buy construction materials such as bricks, zinc sheeting, cement, window and door frames, sand, and tiles, then to pay laborers to construct a kitchen in her home. For that reason she decided to  request her 5th loan at Ceprodel, with the objective of providing for her kitchen.

loans.use: buy bricks, sheets of zinc, cement, window and door frames, sand and tile, then pay laborers to build a kitchen onto her house.

loans.name: Nhamoyapera Group

texts.en:
This is 41 year old Patricia (holding the folder) from Masvingo a town in south-eastern Zimbabwe. She is married with four children, all attending school. She also cares for four dependents. Patricia runs a food business selling vegetables and fruits. The business has been in operation for 1 year. She says the main challenges faced are low capital. 

Patricia has requested a loan of $300 to buy more produce for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general family welfare and educate all her children. In the future Patricia plans to operate several outlets.

loans.use: to buy more produce for resale

loans.name: Nicolás Rene

texts.es: Nicolás Rene tiene su negocio que es el servicio d brindar transporte uno  de sus mayores desafío a sido que tiene mucha competencia, pero Nicolás siempre le brinda a sus clientes un buen servicio, otros  de los problemas es el precio del combustible ya que no es muy estable ya que esto le genera poca ganancia. Nicolás sueña tener otro taxi para obtener más ganancias. El crédito es para la compra llantas y baterías.
texts.en:
Nicolás Rene has a business which is providing transport services.  One of his biggest challenges has been that there is a lot of competition, but Nicolás always provides his customers with good service.  Another problem is the price of fuel, as it is not very stable and he generates minimal earnings.

Nicolás dreams of having an additional taxi to generate more earnings.  The loan is to buy tires and batteries.

loans.use: to buy tires and batteries.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy Wanjiru is 27 years old and has four children, ages 8, 7, 2, and 5 months. She is married to Bernard. Her primary business is hawking peanuts in Mwiki, which she does with her husband. She has been in this business for the past four years. This business gives her an income of 5,600 KES monthly.

This is her second loan. She intends to use it to purchase more peanuts and to start a kiosk selling chips in order to increase her income. She will use the anticipated income to educate her children. She dreams of expanding the business to a fast food restaurant and also building a home.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts and chips to sell

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Vilanculos, na provincia de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos todos ainda frequentam a escola. Fez 6ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu da sua terra natal a em busca de melhores condições de vida, é fotógrafo ha mais de 5 anos e tem um salario de 12.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao de construcao de uma casa (areia, ferro, pedra, cimento, barrotes, e outros.) para continuar com a obra da sua casa.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Fernando was born in Vilanculos, in the province of Inhambane in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of four children, all of whom attend school. He went to school through the sixth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives with his family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
He left Vilanculos in search of a better life. He's been a photographer for more than five years and earns about 12,000 meticals a month. He uses his salary to pay for household expenses and also saves a little in a bank account. He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his first loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (sand, iron, stone, cement, rebar, etc.) to continue the construction on his house. He hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku so he can finish his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sand, iron, stone, cement, rebar, etc.) for his house.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
With the passion to see his children become professionals someday, Nestor strives to work in order to give his children the great opportunity of sending  them to school to finish their education. Nestor is 47 years old and is married. He has three school-aged children.
Nestor has been a farmer in the Philippines for over 20 years. Aside from farming, Nestor engages himself in a hog-raising business, primarily hogs for fattening. Nestor just started this business for an additional source of income for the family. He has experienced difficulties in financing his family needs, that’s why he strives to work, and doesn’t want to again experience a financial shortage.
Nestor wants to borrow a loan amounting P25,000 to purchase feed for the maintenance of his hogs. He hopes to maintain, and expand the business while he operates it.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old married to Sarah who is a business woman, and they are blessed with three children. He runs a general store and he has been in this business for seven years. Right now his monthly income from the business is KES 10,000.


He is taking out a loan of KES 30,000 which he intends to use to add more tea leaves, sugar, and wheat flour to his business inventory for sale. He plans to pay  school fees for his children with the anticipated profit from the business. 

This is his second loan and he successfully repaid his previous loan. His dreams and hopes are to own a big business.

loans.use: To buy more tea leaves, sugar, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 26 años, es una mujer responsable, convive con Rubén su pareja. Juntos habitan en casa de sus padres, junto a ellos y junto a su pequeña hija de 03 años, quien es su motivo de su esfuerzo. Hace 08 años que se dedica a la agricultura; sus padres le dieron una parte de su chacra para que puedan cultivar productos de cacao y así poder solucionar sus gastos. Con la ayuda de su pareja, trabajan arduamente para salir adelante y ofrecer un buen futuro para su pequeña hija. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que sus padres la apoyan mientras ella y su pareja van a la chacra. Considera que lo más difícil es tener que cuidar sus plantas de la plaga de insecots que afectan la producción. Este será su crédito número 05 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que contará con el apoyo financiero ya así se siente segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado se compromete en seguir cumpliendo con el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, comprará plantas de cacao para que pueda incrementar su producción.
texts.en: Elizabeth is a responsible, 26 year old woman.  She lives in her parents home with her partner Rubén and her little three year old daughter, who is the reason she works hard.  She has worked in farming for eight years.  Her parents gave her a part of their farm so that she could grow cacao and pay her expenses.  She and her partner work arduously to get ahead and provide their young daughter with a better future.  What she likes about her work is that her parents support her while she and her partner are at the farm.  She considers the hardest part of her work is having to protect her plants from blight, a problem that affects production.  This will be her fifth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will be able to count on the financial support as it makes her feel secure in going forward with her work. In addition, she is committed to continue making her payments on time.  With the 3,000 nuevos soles, she will buy cacao plants in order to increase production.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Joy has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Joy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a hardworking young married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She owns a retail shop that she started three years ago.  She meets the challenges of price fluctuations and inflation, plus customers who do not pay on time.  Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent home.  Her business goal is to expand her business into a wholesale shop. Sarah needs the loan to buy cassava flour, match boxes and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour, match boxes, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 43 years old, married, and has seven children. With four children in school, Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.
Rosalinda runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 19,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy additional items to sell. She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.
In the future, Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Jose Noe

texts.es:
José, está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo, ya que quiere darle continuidad al fortalecimiento del negocio, en esta ocasión quiere comprar pólvora, bebidas y productos domésticos, para poder afrontar la demanda.
Estos préstamos le han permitido mejorar y contar con más clientes y ventas, espera ser buen cliente y pagar con puntualidad para seguir gozando de este servicio.
texts.en:
José is requesting a loan once again, since he would like to continue strengthening his business. On this occasion, he wants to buy powder, beverages, and home products so that he can fulfill the demand from his customers.

These loans have allowed him to improve and to increase his sales and number of customers. He plans to be a good client and make his payments punctually so he can continue to enjoy the benefits of this service.

loans.use: to buy powder, beverages and home products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more artwork and artifacts to sell

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married father of one who lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He saved money to establish an entertainment store and to buy a play station; a business which has been in operation for three years.

Juma learned of Milango from an employee. He is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to purchase play station machines and two television sets. He will save the extra income obtained from this loan.

loans.use: to purchase play station machines and two television sets.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah used the previous loan to buy rice, sugar, and soap. Her business capital has now grown from 3,000,000 UGX to 3,500,000 UGX. Her dream is to build a permanent house, educate her children, and buy a motorcycle. She now needs the loan to buy rice, sugar, and soap for resale.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and soap for resale

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Âgée de 28 ans, Julienne a arrêté fréquenté l’école au niveau primaire. Julienne est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Isidore. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Julienne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Pour cette raison, Julienne vend des glacières et des plastiques par la technique de distribution ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Julienne s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au NIGERIA. La clientèle de Julienne devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Julienne sollicite une cinquième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des glacières et des plastiques.

loans.name: Kihuura Kwetegekera Group

texts.en:
Anatoli is a hardworking, 30-year-old married man living in Kagadi, Uganda, where he operates a retail shop together with farming, to generate his income. He desires to grow his businesses to meet his family’s demands despite a challenge of competition leading to low returns. 

Anatoli is requesting a loan to buy sugar, soap and other general merchandise for selling. He is a member of Kihuura Kwetegekera Group where clients don't pledge security, but guarantee each other to obtain a loan facility.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Cherie

texts.en:
Cherie is 38 years old and has four children. Cherie is married and has three children are still in school.

Cherie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Cherie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Cherie has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cherie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is married with 5 children, 2 in secondary school. He has received some basic training in entrepreneurship from World Vision. He started his motorbike transportation business 2 years ago after raising some cash from tobacco sales. He has now been able to raise some cash from the business to purchase a second motorbike. The loan of US450 from PEMCI is to make up for the shortfall. With the two motorbikes operational he will be able to repay the loan without fail. Motorbike transportation is emerging as a quicker alternative to bicycle transportation known as Boda Boda. The Motorbikes are used to ferry passengers long distances that the bicycles cannot reach. This emerging alternative will have a very positive and effective impact on the economy and the communities in the area.

loans.use: To buy an Additional Motorcycle

loans.name: Nol

texts.en: Nol S. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and eight children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  She works planting corn and gathering fish in the rainy season.  Her husband, meanwhile, is a construction worker and makes about $2.50 per day.  Three of her sons work construction with their father, one of her daughters works in a garment factory, and the other four children help to grow crops.  The family plans to use this loan to buy more corn seeds and also to buy a machine to help harvest their crops.  Additionally, they hope to buy a boat to help them gather fish during the rainy season.

loans.use: To buy a machine to help harvest crops and to buy a boat to gather fish

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is characterized as a very dedicated entrepreneur simply because she will not rest until she has sold at least something she has to offer. Whether in the cold or the scorching heat she has amazing perseverance in her business. Yelena owns a small kiosk at the central market in Berdyansk, where she sells women’s clothing and shoes. She has about 40,000 Ukrainian Hrivna, about $8000, invested in inventory and her net profit comes to 12,000 Hrivna or about $2400 per month.

Yelena and her husband, Vadim, have two wonderful children. Many times their friendly and joyous family can be seen together at the market. According to Yelena, her family gives her all the support needed for her business to be a success.

At the current stage of her business, Yelena would like to boost the variety of seasonal shoes she has to offer. She has asked for a loan of $1,200 to accomplish this goal.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal shoes

loans.name: Milton

texts.es:
Milton has a Nissan that he uses as a radio-dispatched taxi for the Apolo Radiotaxi Company.

His house is in the Villa Armonia district of La Paz. He is single and has one year of experience in this line of work.

This is his first loan request. He would use the loan to buy a two-way dispatch radio for his taxi; currently he rents the radio he uses. In this way Milton could avoid the monthly payment for rental of his radio, and he would benefit by having a mountain of extra change in his pocket.

His work qualifies him to receive this loan, because he has experience in transportation and he has sufficient income to cover loan repayments and personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Milton tiene un vehiculo Nissan que trabaja como radio taxi en la Compañía de Radio-taxis Apolo. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de villa Armonia de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y tiene experiencia de trabajo de un año. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para capital de inversión (compra de radio de comunicación) ya que actualmente el alquila una radio. De esta forma Milton podrá evitar el gasto mensual de alquilar una radio y se vera beneficiado con un monto extra de dinero en su bolsillo. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en transporte, lo cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo y sus necesidades personales.

loans.use: To buy a two-way dispatch radio

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 33 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband is unemployed. She is living with her family in a rented house. She has a small general store. She applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new ice box and more new goods for the store. She also wants to renovate the shop by painting it and making new shelves. She wants to increase her income and improve her living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new ice box and more new goods

loans.name: Haelen

texts.en:
HAELEN, age 34, runs a general store called "Imma's Shop" (named after her son Immanuel), and also sells clothing from house to house. She lives with her shopkeeper (her niece) in back of the store in a one-room house. Haelen sends money to her mother in the village, who is raising her 14-year-old son. She was brought to Dar es Salaam over 4 years ago by her sister in order to find work, after she and her husband separated. Since then, her sister has passed away.

Haelen opened her shop in 2003. There, she sells sugar, beans, rice, sodas, ice cubes, and other general food items. She makes about $18 a week from this business. Rent for her shop costs about $20 a month and she pays her shopkeeper a salary of the same amount.

Realizing that the shop business was not dependable because of the fluctuating costs of her inventory, Haelen started selling clothes on the street about 6-7 months ago. From this business, she makes a profit of about $35 a week. Her customers generally pay her by weekly installments. Besides paying for school fees and general expenses, she is using her profits to build a house on land that she recently purchased.

Earlier this year, Haelen took out a loan which helped her move her shop to a different location. Having paid this back successfully, she hopes to take out another loan to increase her shop’s inventory and to buy more clothes to sell.

She belongs to the group "Giraffe," which consists of 27 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost her telephone and grocery business

loans.name: Khasan

texts.en: Khasan B. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. He decided to become the client of MicroInvest in 2006 because he heard many successful stories about it from his friends who had benefitted from its loans. Increase in income helped him return his previous loan. Mr.B. is engaged in the home business livestock raising . He also works as a security guard in the food bazaar in the Nausky region.  He is currently requesting a loan for the purchase of fodder for his livestock.

loans.use: for purchase of fodder

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
Mathias B. has been a carpenter for three years. He is 25 years-old and single.

He is requesting $525 to buy wood and supplies for his carpentry business. Mathias is also a member of a lending group called “Kyere Nyame Association”, which consists of 11 entrepreneurs in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy wood and supplies for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
K. Shoira has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004. She considers herself to be a serious and business-like client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure.

Mrs. K. Shoira sells men's clothing and shoes. She works with the direct suppliers, so she trades at prime cost and has many repeat customers. Mrs. K. Shoira has applied to KIVA for a business development loan of 2500 STJ for 8 months to develop her business by importing new seasonal goods.

loans.use: To buy new seasonal goods

loans.name: Ana Edelma

texts.es:
Ana Edelma G. R. is an energetic, creative businesswoman. In order to help her husband raise their two children, she runs a curiosity shop out of her home. To increase her revenue, she goes door-to-door selling cleaning products to customers and friends. This way she can earn more and improve her quality of life. As she herself says: "these days everything is more expensive, and you have to work hard to be successful." She is a leader in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana Edelma González R. es una mujer empresaria muy dinámica y creativa, para poder ayudar a su esposo en la educación de sus 2 hijos, cuenta con un negocio de venta de curiosidades, el cual esta en su casa. Para incrementar sus ingresos, ella esta vendiendo de manera ambulante con sus clientes y amigos productos de limpieza y de esa forma poder mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, ya que como Ella misma lo dice: “en estos días todo esta mas caro, y es necesario esforzarse mas para tener éxito”. Ella es una mujer líder dentro de su comunidad.

loans.use: To buy more goods at a better price

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana María R. is married and has two dependent children. She has a general store in which she serves customers herself in her house in the “Five Pines” district of the town of Chinandega. She has devoted herself tirelessly to this business with the aim of improving her family’s economic conditions which desperately need this support. Her husband has also helped her in the store and both together have made huge efforts to advance their school-aged children.

Today, it is of particular importance to note that she has applied to Ceprodel to meet these needs by obtaining a credit which will permit her to buy products such as vegetables and other consumable goods. She strongly trusts that her request will be approved and she will be able to access this loan so she can continue with her grocery-store business from her home.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Juana María R. es casada y con dos hijos a su responsabilidad. Su negocio es la pulpería el cual es atendida por ella misma en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega.
