Se ha dedicado arduamente a este negocio con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia que tanto necesita de su apoyo. Su esposo también la ha apoyado en la venta y ambos juntos hacen los mas grandes esfuerzos por sacar adelante a sus hijos en edad escolar.

Hoy en día es de suma importancia mencionar que ha acudido a Ceprodel para suplir su necesidad y obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los productos como las verduras y otros comestibles. Ella confía grandemente que su petición será aprobada y podrá obtener el crédito para continuar con su negocio de pulpería en su casa de habitación.

loans.use: Stock her general store with more products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing and housewares for a small business.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophy S. is a villager in Trapaing Ronas Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Virak Svay, is a construction worker. They have three children. All three are too young to work or attend school.

In order to travel to work easily, Mrs. Sophy S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to use for work. In the past, Mrs. Sophy S. obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets for breeding. She has fully paid off her original loan. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to use for work.

loans.name: Angel Alfonso

texts.es:
Angel has a job as a driver, but upon seeing that with his wages, he wasn’t able to support his children, he decided four years ago to dedicate himself to the sale of toys in the villages. Upon realizing that it was going very will for him, he started to sell at he village fairs, and this is how each day he has increased his sales.

He needs a loan of $250 which he will repay in four months to buy merchandise and have a better inventory to sell at the town fairs.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Ángel tiene un empleo de chofer, pero al ver que con su sueldo no le alcanzaba para mantener a su hijos decidió hace 4 años dedicarse a la venta de juguetes en los pueblos, al darse cuenta que le iba muy bien, empezó a vender en las ferias de los pueblos, y es así como cada día han ido aumentando sus ventas.

El necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía y tener mayor inventario para vender en las feria del pueblo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Martina Sabina

texts.es: Doña Martina a sus 48 años de edad, ha podido sobresalir de tantas dificultades pues es madre soltera de su hija de 15 años de edad, está separada, pero el padre de su hija la apoya económicamente, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, tiene que velar por su hija para que pueda salir adelante en sus estudios, actualmente está en secundaria y se requiere de muchos gastos y atención personal. Doña Martina trabaja en un comedor y es la que prepara los alimentos que ahí se ofrecen, tiene cinco años de estar laborando en el comedor, aunque no es fácil por que desde muy temprano llega a su trabajo y sale tarde, y tiene que estar pendiente de su hija, su abuelita cuida de la adolescente para que ella no esté sola en la casa. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para poder hacer reparación en el techo que está en mal estado para eso necesita comprar perlines y zinc. A largo plazo es poder cambiar de trabajo para tener más tiempo para su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Martina at 48 years of age has been able to overcome many difficulties. She is the single mother of her 15 year old daughter, and is divorced, but the father supports his daughter financially. Martina lives in the North Laureles neighborhood. She has to monitor her daughter so that she comes out ahead academically, as she is currently in high school and requires many things and personal attention. Ms. Martina works in a cafeteria, and is the one who cooks the food that is offered there. She has been working there for 5 years, although it is not easy because she arrives early and leaves late, and has to be available to her daughter. Martina's mother looks after her daughter so that she doesn't have to be home alone. The loan is to repair the roof of the house, as it is in bad shape. To do this, Martina needs purlins and zinc. In the long run, Martina would like to change jobs to have more time to spend with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase zinc sheets to roof her house.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is a wife and the mother of four children, who are now independent.  She is a member of the group named 'Adjinyemise' Trust Group.  Members in this group guarantee and provide support to one another in repaying their loans. 

Faustina Akwertey has been selling used clothes for the past year at the Odumase market in Koforidua, Ghana. She relies on the income from her sales to support her household, both in the provision of food and payment of utility bills.  She is requesting a loan to enable her to inject more capital into her business.  She will purchase more bales of used clothes.  She hopes to reinvest her income into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more lace and used clothes.

loans.name: Rosario Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Rosario del Pilar M. Chávez  tiene 28 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal  Santa Elena II, vive en Mz. A 39 lote 16 Manuel Arévalo  II etapa del distrito La Esperanza provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Rosario es Auxiliar Contable, pero no ejerce su profesión, se casó y tiene  un hijo que depende económicamente de ella.
Rosario del Pilar se dedica a la venta de productos de Unic, es vendedora 3 estrellas eso indica que es una mujer emprendedora  y que lo que se propone lo cumple.
Recuerda que el primer crédito de 200 soles  que fue devuelto en 4 cuotas sirvió par incrementar su negocio.
Con este crédito de 1200 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá, una parte en su negocio y otra parte la tendrá como capital.
Rosario tiene un gran sueño y seguramente lo logrará porque es una mujer emprendedora y con mucha visión de negocio, ella sueña con ser directora de Unic y lograr el auto unic.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosario del Pilar M. Chávez is 28 years old and belongs to the Santa Elena II Community Bank. She lives at Mz. A 39 lote 16 Manuel Arévalo II etapa in the La Esperanza district of the Trujillo province in the La Libertad department of Peru. Rosario del Pilar is a Junior Accountant but she doesn't practice her profession. She is married and has one child who is economically dependent on her. Rosario del Pilar sells Unic products. She is a three star saleslady, which indicates that she is a hard worker and finishes what she starts. Her first loan of 200 soles was repaid in four installments. Rosario del Pilar used the loan to grow her business. This loan of 1200 soles will be repaid in six installments. Rosario del Pilar will invest a portion of the money in her business and the other portion she'll use as working capital. Rosario del Pilar has a big dream, and because she is a hard worker with great business vision she'll surely achieve it. She'd like to be the head of Unic and earn the Unic car.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetic products. Capital

loans.name: Komi

texts.en: Komi A. is 35 years old and a married father. He lives and works in the village of Wome, a small village located in a beautiful, lush area of Togo near the border with Ghana. Komi’s children all attend school, and he provides for them as best he can, while his wife takes care of the family and their home. As most people do not drive cars in Wome and instead drive motorcycles, Komi started a mechanical business. As seen in this photo, Komi buys used motorcycles and parts and puts them together again, in order to then sell the new, improved motorcycles. With this loan from Kiva, Komi looks forward to expanding his business and the space in which he works so that he may better serve his ever-growing clientele. He thanks Kiva for the opportunity to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To expand his business and the space in which he works

loans.name: Khat

texts.en:
Khat S., 47, is married and lives in Saang District, Kandal Province, Cambodia. She works with her husband on her rice paddy growing rice, corn, nuts, and cucumbers, making collectively around $5.50 per day from her activity. Khat S. has six children. Two of them are students and four of them are employed as workers. Khat S. learned farming skills from her parents starting from when she was 10. Even thought it’s hard work, she really adores it and will never give it up.

This year her output is decreased. Some of her crops were destroyed by insects and rats. In order to prevent that happening again and to increase her output margin, Mrs. Khat S. and her husband would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase insecticide, seeds, gasoline, and fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase insecticide, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Teopista Nantume Group

texts.en: N. Teopista is a farmer with plantations of bananas, beans, maize, cassava, and potato. She has a stall at her home where she sells cabbage, tomatoes, onions, carrots and spices, some from her plantations and other items that she buys from fellow farmers. She is married with 5 children, all in school, and she pays their school fees single-handedly with the help of loans. She has been able to buy herself a plot and more household items, a thing she had lost hope of achieving. She needs her portion of this group loan to buy more produce for sale.

loans.use: Buying more produce for sale.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita C. grows pigs in her backyard. She has been raising pigs since 2004, using her own little savings. She started her business with two piglets. Up until now, she grows pigs because she enjoys the work and is able to earn a profit from this kind of endeavor. She is 53 years old. Two of her eight children are still in college. She needs more income to support their studies.


She is asking for a loan from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy feed for the pigs. Specifically, the loan will go to pay for two sacks of starter feed, three sacks of hog grower feed and four sacks of hog finisher feed. With her loan, she is assured that she will have bigger pigs to sell and will have additional income for her family. She is also looking into some other possible income areas to support her family. CEVI provides everyone a chance to change his or her life. Through the credit assistance, training and insurance coverage that they give, many are able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Ilolo Group

texts.en:
Sara has been selling alcohol in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for four years. She belongs to the Ilolo group loan (Group code 2003). Every day she works at her business for six hours.
  
She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more alcohol for her business. She is hoping that with this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Sara is 35 years old, married, and has four children. She also cares for two additional dependants. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Esnati, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more alcohol for her business.

loans.name: Suisami

texts.en:
Suisami A., 42, is married with 4 children. She has 4 years of experience planting taro, yams, and bananas. She sells to the village people and general public 3 days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD).

She has no previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Suisami’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and supplies for her farm

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es: La señora Silvia reside en el barrio Hialeah en la ciudad de Managua, su esposo es albañil y tiene tres hijos de 7,15 y 18 años  de edad, ella tiene 35 años de edad, su negocio es una pequeña pulpería que administra desde hace cuatro años, el cual inicio con la necesidad de ayudar  a su esposo a solventar los gastos del hogar, sus planes es poder terminar de hacer su casa, apoyar a sus hijos con los estudios. Con esta solicitud de crédito va invertir en materiales de construcción para poner  techo  a  un cuarto ya que ha ido construyendo poco y lo que mas desea es poder tener una casa digna y segura para su familia, la ventaja que tiene que no gasta en mano de obra que es cara ya que su esposo la construye, este es su segundo ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias por sus metas alcanzada. A futuro espera vender otros productos que le generen buena ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs.Silvia lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of the city of Managua, her husband is a builder and they have three children, 7,15 and 18 years old. She is 35 years old and her business is a small general store which she has been running for the last four years. She started the store in order to help her husband with the home expenses, and she plans to finish her house and help their children with their education. She will use the proceeds of this loan to purchase construction materials for a roof of a room that they have been building little by little. What she most wants is to have a proper home that will be safe for her family. She has the advantage of not needing to pay for labor since her husband is doing the building. This is her second loan with Afodenic and she is thankful for the goals that she has been able to achieve. She plans to sell more products in the future that will generate good income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for a roof and construction of a room in her house.

loans.name: Chineye

texts.en: Chineye is 30 years old and married with a child. She is a tailor by profession and also sells clothes and tailoring materials. Chineye is requesting a loan of N 50,000 to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
Zoraida tiene 48 años de edad, tiene una sola  hija quien vive con ella la cual es empleada en un supermercado y le ayuda con los gastos familiares. Ella vive en un barrio muy populoso de la ciudad de Itá, en donde posee una despensa hace mas de 16 años, allí surte a sus vecinos y amigos de: carne, carbón, azúcar, yerba, bebidas en general y otros insumos de primera necesidad.
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de dichas mercaderías, a modo a aumentar su inventario y de esa manera sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Zoraida is 48 years old, has one daughter who lives with her and who is employed in a supermarket and assists her with the household expenses. She lives in a well-populated neighborhood of Ita city, where she has owned a convenience store for over 16 years. Her neighbors and friends buy meat, charcoal, sugar, tea, beverages, and other basic needs products. The loan she seeks will be used to buy the aforementioned merchandise thereby increasing her inventory and in this way also her family’s income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, beverages and other merchandise.

loans.name: Dodo

texts.en: I. Dodo is 42 years old and the father of three children. His main work consists of breeding cattle. This very remunerative activity enables him to provide for the needs of his family. A very ambitious man, Dodo would like to buy a greater number of cattle, and to build a barn to house them, in order to ensure their safety. Due to a lack of finances, he is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni for the realization of this project. When his dream is carried out, Dodo will be able to have a greater source of revenue for his growing family. With your help this will be possible. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy cattle and young cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann sells provisions, such as drinks, wine, noodles, bathing soap, breveages, etc. Ann is 37 years old and married, with a child. Ann is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Martha Lilian

texts.es: Martha Lilian A. Y. de 34 años de edad reside en Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San Salvador. Martha vive en casa propia donde posee un negocio hace diez años es una venta de pupusas  y también hace cuatro meses adquirió  un pequeño chalet ubicado en el polideportivo de la zona, que es un lugar donde llegan muchos a jóvenes a jugar varios deportes, los negocios de Martha poseen buenas ganancias ya que es una persona muy amable con sus clientes, el destino del crédito que solicita Martha es para materia prima de las pupusas y también para surtir su chalet en el cual desea incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Martha Lilian A. Y. is 34 years old and lives in the city of Delgado of the San Salvador department. Martha lives in her own home where she has had a business for the last 10 years of selling pupusas (corn flat breads). Additionally four months ago she acquired a small cottage near the sports center of the area, this is a place where a lot of young people go to play various sports. Martha's businesses make good profits since she is a very likable person with her customers. The purpose of the loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of raw materials for the flat breads and also for the furnishing of her cottage where she is wanting to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw material for flat breads and purchase of merchandise for the cottage.

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Mujeres Solidarias, se conformo en fecha 13 de noviembre del 2006, gracias a que la anterior Directora General la Sra. Aída Luz R. quien se dedica a la venta de bijouterie, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto. 
El grupo en el transcurso de los ciclos, no tuvo inconvenientes   gracias a su trabajo solidario lograron salir adelante y seguir trabajando con el programa hasta estos días.
El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante es de   994.117 Gs., lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como venta de comidas, venta de mercerías, venta de mercaderías para la despensa, kiosco (arroz, azúcar, fideos, lácteos, panificados, yerba, etc.), venta de ropas, venta de frutas, venta de croché, venta de bijouterie etc.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya. Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y tienen un trabajo solidario impecable.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Solidarias (Women of Solidarity) was formed on Nov. 13, 2006, thanks to the work of former general director Aída Luz R., who makes a living selling jewelry. She contacted an adviser about having weekly meetings with working women from the area. Once she was told about the group loan program, she was able to bring together 17 women who take a lot of pleasure in their work. The group has not had any problems during the loan cycles thanks to the members working together to make headway, and they have continued working with the program to this day. The average loan per member is 994.117 Gs., which will be used for different activities such as selling foods, selling haberdashery, selling items for grocery stores and kiosks (rice, sugar, noodles, milk products, breads, etc.), selling clothing, selling fruit, selling crafts and selling jewelery. All the members carry our their work to repay the funds and they help each other to reach the common goals that everyone has within the group and Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya. The members actively participate in their weekly meetings and have impeccable solidarity.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and supplies for the members' respective activities

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
La señora Lola, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 32 años, 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Deseando ver profesional a sus hijos y tener sus propios ingresos para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Se dedica a la Venta de Comidas, hace 07 años atrás y los realiza viajando por los pueblos aledaños, junto con su esposo.
Aprovecha vender, en épocas festivas como: (fiestas patronales, fiestas patrias, san juan). Nos cuenta que sus ventas le salen muy bien y esta presente en cada evento festivo que se presente en su ciudad.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y le va muy bien, tiene sus clientes fijos y ya es conocida por sus clientes y por la buena sazón que le pone a sus comidas.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con sus ventas de comidas, posteriormente desea implementar mas su negocio con un Restaurant bien acondicionado para brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio y atención. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Lola belongs to the "Uprightness and Work" Communal Bank in the District of Juanjui, Marshal Cáceres province, Department of San Martin. She lives in a shared home, is 32 years old and has 2 children that still depend on her. She would like her children to become professionals and have their own incomes. In order to help them achieve this, she decided to start her own business. She has been dedicated to the sale of foods for 7 years. She carries out her sales by travelling to the adjoining towns along with her husband. She takes advantage of festival periods,such as local holidays, independence days, & San Juan. She tells us that her sales turn out well and she is present at every festive event that is presented in their city. Currently, she continues with the same business and it goes very well. She has loyal clients and already is known by her clients and for the delicious seasonings that she puts in her foods. With this loan of 3,000 Soles she will buy supplies for her prepared foods, such as bags of rice and sugar, chickens and eggs in cartons, bananas in bunches, noodles and oil in dozens and also kitchen utensils in order to offer a better quality of service. She feels compelled to continue with her food sales. In the future she would like to augment her business with a well-furnished restaurant to offer her clients better service and attention. She thanks the Manuela Ramos group for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to prepare her foods for sale.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
As an entrepreneur, Mrs. Rosie G. of Cangapas, Anahaw, Hinigaran City, Negros Occidental, is always looking for great investment opportunities. She is 38 years old, married with 4 children - her oldest is 16 years old, and the youngest is 10.

Because of the farming activity in the area where Mrs. G. lives, she started a rice trading business - buying rice at harvest time from June to January and reselling milled rice at retail prices to the community and the neighboring towns. The family also owns a small farm which is managed by her husband, and she also put up a "sari-sari" or general store. The 3 business activities helps support the needs of their young family and earns about PHP 6,500 a month.

She plans to use her 15th cycle loan amounting to PHP 29,000 as additional capital for her rice retailing business, the income of which she plans to pay for the school tuition of her children, set aside some amount for their future and invest the rest back into her business. 


About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her Rice Retailing

loans.name: Sorry For Me Group

texts.en:
This is Marie C., Adamsay T. and Ann-Marie Kanu of the "Sorry for Me group". Their leader is Marie C. on the right.  They are small-scale entrepreneurs in Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000.00 for each to enable them buy more goods to sell. With more goods at their disposal, they will be able to make more profit and thus improve in their livelihoods. 

Their leader is now thirty-six years old, she is a married to a motorcycle driver and they  have three children.  One of her children is in class one, the other is not of school going age and other is still suckling. Marie sells market food: rice, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, pepper and fish at Makeni second largest market. Marie has been a businesswoman for three years now. With this loan, she will be able to further expand her business.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Confiance. Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe Confiance sont des femmes mariées  ayant en moyenne 40 ans et en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à Sanoubougou  I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur  premier prêt et espèrent maintenir cette relation. 
Elles font la vente du bois de chauffe, d’huile alimentaire, de cartes de crédits téléphoniques prépayées, des tissus et  des chaussures.
 Avec ce premier  prêt, elles comptent acheter, 1chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 4 bidons de 20 litres d’huile alimentaire, 10cartes de crédits de 2000FCFA, 30 cartes de crédits de 1000FCFA, 5 rouleaux de tissus pour homme et  3 douzaines de chaussures. Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville et les villages avoisinants et effectuent leurs ventes dans les différents marchés tel celui de Sanoubougou, dans les  quartiers de la ville de Sikasso et à domicile, au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, mais  souvent à crédit.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille; l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles espèrent sur des prêts plus élevés pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager un point de vente.
texts.en:
The six members of the 'Confiance' group are married women with an average age of 40 and on average, 4 children. They mostly live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou I, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They work with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele; they are on their first loan and are hoping to maintain this relationship.

They sell firewood, cooking oil, prepaid telephone cards, fabrics, and shoes. With this first loan they hope to buy 1 truckload of firewood, 4 jerrycans of 20 liters of cooking oil, 10 phone cards at 2000 F CFA, 30 cards at 1000 F CFA, 5 bolts of cloth for men, and 3 dozen shoes. They do their buying in the marketplace of Sikasso and the surrounding villages and make their sales in the various markets such as the one at Sanoubougou, in the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, and out of their homes, for cash, to a clientele composed of men and women, and often for credit.

They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 22,500 F CFA of which part will be saved or used for family expenses with the remainder invested back into their businesses. They are looking forward to receiving higher amounts in future so that they can satisfy their clientele appropriately and be able to open up a sales point.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Odisa

texts.es:
Odisa es una mujer perseverante y activa, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 43 años, es madre D. cinco hijos, D. los cuales dos son mayores D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes al por menor, tiene una bodega en su casa, también se dedica a la elaboración D. carbón, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo, que se dedica a la compra y venta D. tablas. Odisa forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Claritas 2” desD. hace un año y cuatro meses, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue para invertir en gaseosas para vender.
En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito D. 1000 soles, que será utilizado para comprar productos para su bodega (arroz, azúcar, fideos, detergente, etc.), ya que recién esta empezando con este negocio y necesita surtirlo. El sueño es tener una tienda bien implementada, con artículos para toda ocasión.
texts.en:
Odisa is a perseverant and active woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 43 and has five children. Two of the children are adults. She sells retail groceries. She has a convenience store in her house. She also manufactures coal. She counts on her husband’s support. He buys and sells lumber. She has been part of the Las Claritas 2 Communal Bank for one year and four months. She used her first loan to buy soft drinks to sell. She currently needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy products for her convenience store (rice, sugar, noodles, detergent, etc.). She has recently started this business, and she needs to stock it. Her dream is to have a store that is well set up with articles for every occasion.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her convenience store (rice, sugar, noodles, detergent, etc.)

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie D. is from the village of D'BAN Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Elvie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elvie makes and sells food in the local community. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

Elvie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business so she can improve her family's living situation. Elvie is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional equipment for making food. This is Elvie's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template to allow the Field Partners to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for making food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase building materials in bulk for business

loans.name: Juana De La Cruz

texts.es: Juana de la Cruz tiene 25 años de edad, esta señora se dedica a la venta y elaboración de rosquillas. Ya que hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio desde muy joven ya que su familia se dedicaba elaborar y vender estos productos, además su Mama estaba interesada que Juana aprendiera a esta actividad para que saliera adelante y mantuviera a su familia, mas tarde ella decide hacerse cargo de este negocio para mantener a sus hijos. El financiamiento que solicito es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para maíz, queso, leña entre otros productos. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana de la Cruz, 25, makes and sells rosquillas (a ring-shaped cookie). She has been in this line of work for 9 years starting very young since her family was involved in this activity. Besides, her mother was interested in that Juana learn these skills so that she could get ahead in life and be able to support her family. Later on, Juana decided to take over the business in order to support her sons. The financing will be used as working capital to buy corn, cheese, firewood, among other products. Her desire is to improve her dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of oxen

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 42 years old and married with four children, the eldest of whom is 12 years old. Grace's husband sells planks to support his family. Grace is a friendly and hardworking woman who sells foodstuffs to make a living. She works for long hours to enable her to meet the demands of her customers and also her family members. With her children still growing up, she hopes to give them a good quality education. Grace also loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.
Grace is a client of Kiva partner, Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO). She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

About Lift Above Poverty Organization(LAPO)
Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: El sr Walter S. su negocio es venta de CD y accesorios y películas de video está situado en la costado oeste del mercado municipal este tramo el lo alquila mensualmente paga una cuota, el dinero lo solicito para compra de CD, DVD película y limpiador de CD. El negocio lo empieza vendiendo CD en una esquina ponía su bolso con los CD pero después vio que tenía muchos clientes y decido alquila ese local tiene 3 años de estar alquilando antes vendía CD ambulante el sr S. es casado  tiene un bebe de 4 años y su esposa está embarazada esperando el segundo bebe, el necesita un préstamo para poder incrementar aun mas su negocio ya que le están pidiendo más películas y ahorita él no tiene capacidad de invertir más en su negocio ya que el capital propio que tenia  ahorrado lo utilizo para preparar a su esposa ya que pronto dará a luz a su nuevo hijo
texts.en:
Walter S. has a business in which he sells CDs and accessories along with movie DVDs. His business is located on the western edge of the city market; his stall has a monthly rent, which he pays in installments. The money he is asking for is for purchasing CDs, movies on DVD, and CD cleaner. He started his business as a street vendor, selling CDs out of a bag on a corner. After he saw that he had many customers he decided to rent this stall, which he has had for 3 years now. Walter is married and he and his wife have a 4-year-old; his wife is pregnant and they are expecting their second child. He needs a loan so that he can increase his business even more, since his customers are ordering more movies and right now he doesn’t have the means to invest more in his business. That is because Walter is saving his own capital to use for preparations for his wife, since she is due to bring their newest child into this world very soon.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing CDs and movie and music video DVDs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase maize in bulk

loans.name: Jyanti

texts.en: Jyanti K. has two sons who attend middle and high school. She lives in a joint family with her father-in-law and mother-in-law. Jayanti already owns one cow, and she has been selling milk in the area. In Nepal, pure, fresh cow’s milk is highly valued for its nutrition. Jyanti lives in a growing neighborhood, and in that area the demand for milk is constantly increasing. She carries her milk containers and sells door to door daily, in the morning and evening. Because of the rising demand, Jyanti wants to buy another cow to increase  milk production. She is requesting a loan of NPR25,000 to purchase a jersey cow, which produces more milk than normal cows. Jyanti has grassland of her own, so she does not have to buy food for her cows.

loans.use: To buy a jersey cow

loans.name: Turdiali

texts.ru: Бозоров Турдиали проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 62 года. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Клиент пенсионер. Более 6 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно- рогатый скот у себя дома. В этой деятельности ему помогает жена. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Turdiali B. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 62 years old, married and has one child. Our client is retired. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 6 years and breeds cattle at home. His wife helps him with this business. Turdiali primarily raises and sells livestock. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene M. is from the village of Barina-ut, Iligan City. She is 33 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Arlene owns and operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Arlene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Barina-ut, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Wisma Cempaka 2 Group

texts.en:
Ni Made R. S. (0) is a 39-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali.  Ni Made is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Wisma Cempaka 2 (MUK-0019).


Ni Made is married and has two adult children.  To make a living, Ni Made owns & operates a general store selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  Ni Made has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2010, Ni Made joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Made is requesting her first loan from MUK.  She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 IDR, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by Ni Made from MUK.  Ni Made plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.


Note to Kiva Lenders: This group uses a community lending model (commonly referred to as Village Banking) that is very common throughout Asia. In this model, a select number of group representatives will take out a large loan on behalf of their entire group (often an entire village). They will then distribute and manage the loan and collect repayments for the lender. This is a common and efficient practice in the region, but it makes reporting on Kiva somewhat unusual. Unlike most other loans, Kiva’s partner MUK will be in contact primarily with the group leadership team who in turn will be overseeing the end borrowers.  As such, journal updates likely will reflect the performance of the lending group rather than the individual end borrowers. 

To learn more about Village Banking on Wikipedia, please click on the following link: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Village_Banking


Ni Made R. S. (0) merupakan 39 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Made adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 4 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Wisma Cempaka 2 (MUK-0019).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual produk makanan & barang kebutuhan sehari-hari di tengah masyarakat setempat.  Ni Made sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 1 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Made menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Made bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Made meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 2,500,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


Pesan untuk Peminjam Kiva: Grup ini memakai model pinjaman komunitas/""community lending"" (biasanya dijuluk Bank Desa/""Village Banking"") yang populer di Asia. Di model ini, sejumlah representatif dari grup akan meminjam uang sejumlah lebih besar untuk seluruh grup (kadang-kadang seluruh desa). Representatif ini akan distribusi dan mengendalikan pinjaman, dan mengkoleksi pembayaran untuk peminjam akhir. Ini adalah praktek umum dan efisien di daerah ini, tapi merumitkan cara lapor untuk Kiva. Tidak serupa pinjaman lain, partner Kiva, MUK, akan menjadi kontak utama dengan tim kepemimpinan grup, yang sebaliknya menjadi kontak dengan peminjam akhir. Demikian, jurnal yang ditulis akan merefleksikan hasilnya tim kepemimpinan, bukannya peminjam-peminjam akhir.

Untuk belajari lebih banyak tentang Village Banking di Wikipedia, mohon kunjungi website ini: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Village_Banking.  "

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Harun

texts.en: Harun is a 44 year old commercial dairy farmer. He also runs a retail business in his local market. Since he joined Lenres group in Faulu Kenya which consists of business persons, he has become focused and determined in his business. The group members support each other by guaranteeing loans. He has requested a loan of Kes.80,000 from Faulu Kenya, to buy a dairy cow and a calf, which the group members have guaranteed. He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To buy a cow and a calf.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura L. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. He is 49 years old. Laura is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Laura owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as coffee, sugar, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Laura has been engaged in his business for over 17 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Laura joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laura has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Laura is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Laura from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tusubira Women's Group 2, Lugazi

texts.en:
45-year-old Sarah K. exudes diligence. For this widowed mother of three, being a stickler for hard work has laid for her a rock solid foundation for short and long term success.

To shoulder her family responsibilities, Sarah has, for the last four years, been plying her plastics-sales business in the heart of Lugazi Town. In a week, she says she makes profits to the tune of 100,000 shillings and with this, she has managed to establish a firm foothold for her business in a highly competitive business genre.

By virtue of this accomplishment, and with her determination, Sarah’s future prospects are looking good. With the support of this loan, she sees herself restocking her plastics-selling shop with items like basins, jerry cans and buckets.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics like basins, jerry cans and buckets for her shop

loans.name: Koileken Ole

texts.en:
Koileken is 37 years old and married to Lucy K., with whom he has one child. He has been in wheat farming since 1998 and he sells all his produce to the Cereals Board, a government body.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to prepare his land and buy seedlings for wheat and barley planting.

In the near future, Koileken plans to buy his own farm equipment, which will save him the cash he spends on renting this equipment, and also will make his farming more convenient, as he will have the equipment to himself.

loans.use: To prepare his land to plant wheat and barley

loans.name: Bich's Group

texts.en:
Bich T. H. P. is 33 years old. She is married with two children. She lives in Xom Ngoai village. She has a store that sells bicycle parts and does repair of bicycles and motors. She has had this job many years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND to expand her store.

About other borrower in her group:

 Dung T. N. is 49 years old. She would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND to breed the pigs and poultry.

loans.use: to expand her store

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg P. is 52 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (a traditional Mongolian housing tent) in Tuv province, Mongolia. Her husband is handicapped, but works as a carpenter and an ironsmith in their town, while her son is a masonry worker for a private construction company in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Narantsetseg operates a sewing business in her town and mainly produces tent covers and some clothing, as well as running a cow farming business. The family feeds 10 cows and milks 6 of them and would like to enlarge their cow farm in the future. Narantsetseg is a modest, hard working and creative woman, who is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to expand her cow farm business.

loans.use: To expand her cow farm.

loans.name: Rwentobo Tukore Women's Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
K. Bujuguri, aged 40, is married with a family of four children.

Bujuguri has been operating a retail shop in Rwentobo trading centre, Ntungamo, for over ten years. There, he trades in a variety of products common for domestic use like sugar, soft drinks like sodas, water, cooking oil, and much more merchandise.

Bujuguri does this business alongside his farming practices that include growing sorghum and millet which are used as food crops in Uganda.

Bujuguri’s main drawback is that he has a limited variety of products in his shop that cannot satisfy his customers’ demand. Therefore, he is looking forward to increase the stock in his business when he gets this loan and also to expand into a wholesale shop. This will help him earn more revenue and sustain his daily life needs and further educate his children.

Bujuguri belongs to a group of members who insure each other in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To increase the stock in his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To replace her existing home appliances

loans.name: God Help Us Group

texts.en:
Satta T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Help Us. She is 55 years old and is married with five children who are between the ages of 10 and 35 years. She was not able to attend school herself due to financial constraints.

For twenty years, Satta has been selling bananas, tomatoes and oranges in Joe Bar’s Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more bananas, tomatoes and oranges to sell.

Satta describes herself as an honest and trustworthy woman whose dream is to improve her business, build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, tomatoes and oranges to sell

loans.name: Mahira's Group

texts.en: Mahira E. is the leader of this group. She is 23 and married. Her husband raises money by working as a private builder. Together, the couple brings up a son. Mainly, the family gets some profits out of farming. Still, in order to obtain a refrigerator, the family needs to obtain a loan. In future Mahira wants to purchase other necessary household appliances, to build a house for her brother and to pay for her son’s circumcision. Matluba E. is the treasurer of the group. She is 49 and married. Her husband makes his bread by working as a private builder. They have two daughters, one of whom is divorced and lives with her parents. The family earns money by cultivating potatoes and cotton on their own allotment and out of their business profits they have managed to make house repairs and to arrange for their daughter’s wedding. In order to make their plans to purchase fertilizer and garlic come true, the family needs to obtain a loan. In future Matluba wants to build a house and to pay for her grandson’s circumcision. Patilahon O., 66, is married and her husband is a pensioner already. The couple has a son, 35 years old, who is a private builder. The family business consists of cultivating corn and onions, and also cattle breeding. Their earnings gave them an opportunity to increase their cattle stock and to build a stable. The purpose of this loan is to buy potato and onion seeds and to fertilize their soil for planting. In future, Patilahon wants to arrange her son’s wedding, make house repairs and enlarge her stock-raising business. Talasbek D., 25, is married and has two children. The family makes its bread by having their own business selling cigarettes and sunflower seeds, which they started fourteen years ago. Today, at home, they have opened a shop where Talasbek’s wife sells. Also they have a billiard room, which gives a daily income. Besides those businesses, they are engaged in cattle breeding and Talasbek earns additional money by working as a taxi-driver. The purpose of this loan is to expand their commodity business. In future the family wants to build a bath-house and increase their cattle stock. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing more fish to sell

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Prossy has a business of selling food, which she has had for 6 years, and she also sells charcoal.

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food and charcoal. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Prossy hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Prossy hopes to own a retail shop.

Prossy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: To buy food and charcoal.

loans.name: José Ricardo

texts.es: En un sector muy comercial en la carrera 77, justamente en la localidad de Engativá en la ciudad de Bogotá, José Rodrigo  de 66 años,   tiene un almacén y laboratorio fotográfico que significa el sustento de su familia; él es un hombre casado y tiene 6 hijos en las edades de 25 y 37 años, e inició su actividad desde hace 45 años en un laboratorio fotográfico,  y después se independizó emprendiendo el suyo propio, en el sitio en que ahora está ubicado desde hace 32 años: en Santa Elenita. Con el pasar del tiempo la tecnología ha dado un vuelco a su propio quehacer y a su mercado, por eso su mayor sueño es   tecnificar su microempresa,  adicionándole tecnología de punta, pasar de la fotografía análoga a la digital y acceder a herramientas de ofimática, computadores etc. Este es un requerimiento que tiene  del mercado y de si mismo, para sostenerse en el y lograr ser exitosos, por lo que se ha propuesto  lograr  hacer de su negocio una unidad económica más rentable y con mayor acceso de clientes jóvenes. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el quiere comprar  materiales e insumos de fotografía,  como papel fotográfico, para obtener mas utilidades mediante su compra por mayor cantidad, poder ofrecer nuevas opciones a sus clientes actuales,  y mas adelante  irse dirigiendo  a la consecución de sus metas.
texts.en: In a very commercial sector of Carrera 77, in the area of Engativá in the city of Bogotá, 66-year-old José Rodrigo has a photography store and darkroom that provides the income to support his family. He is a married man with 6 children between the ages of 25 and 37, and he began his business 45 years ago in a darkroom. After that, he started a business of his own on the site where it has been for 32 years: in Santa Elenita.  With the passing of time, technology has altered his business and its market, and therefore his dream is to technify his microbusiness by adding cutting-edge technology, changing over from analog technology to digital, and acquiring office tools, computers, etc. This is a requirement of the market and of himself, in order to sustain his business and achieve success. Therefore, he has proposed to make his business more profitable and more desirable to younger customers. This is his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and with it, he would like to buy photography materials and supplies, such as photo paper, in order to get more use out of buying in larger quantities, to be able to offer new options to his current clients and in the future to move toward achieving his goals.

loans.use: To buy photography materials and supplies, such as photo paper, rolls, frames and albums.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty B. lives in the Ntinda neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.  Alaisha   has a farming business. She has been in this business for 3 years, and she works 7 days a week. Betty sells her products at the wholesale market.  

Betty has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more millet, mother spawn and mushroom seeds.  She also generates additional income through rental rooms.  The main business challenges for Betty include seasonality and transportation.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start exporting mushrooms to other African countries.  Betty lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication

loans.use: To buy more millet, mushroom and mother spawn seeds.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold C. Jr. is from the village of Port Area, Iligan City. He is 23 years old. Arnold is single. To make a living, Arnold owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing Internet and computer services to local community members. Arnold has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arnold joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arnold has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. Arnold is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional computer sets. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Arnold from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional computers

location.town: Port Area, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es: Jacinta Q. tiene 42 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos tres de los cuales son mayores de edad y uno de ellos tiene dieciséis años. Ella tiene un pequeño kiosco en un paradero donde vende golosinas y comida desde hace 8 años. Solicitó el préstamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar mas mercadería para su kiosco y en el futuro  le gustaría tener una tienda de abarrotes en general.
texts.en: Jacinta Q. is 42 years old and the single mother of three adult children and one 16 year old.  She has a small kiosk at a bus station where she has been selling snacks and food for the past eight years.  She is asking for this loan, through EDAPROSPO, in order to buy merchandise for her kiosk.  In the future she would like to have her own grocery store.

loans.use: COMPRAInventory

loans.name: Samuel Munene

texts.en:
Samuel has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last three years.  He is 51 years old, married to Naomi Wacuka, and they have four children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of Kiva's field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for the next planting season. The climatic conditions for this area are very suitable for potatoes, and this is the region that produces a large amount of potatoes, which are in high demand in Kenya.

In the future, he hopes to practice large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.en:
71-year-old Crescencia is a married woman from the town of Trinidad. She owns and manages a sari-sari store where she sells snacks and other kinds of products. She also makes vinegar out of coconuts and sells them at her store. Aside from that, she also grows pigs and chickens in her backyard. Crescencia does her best to help provide for her family.

Crescencia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crescencia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Crescencia is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Irvin

texts.es:
Irvin tiene 20  años de edad, es soltero y reside en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, los cuales cría en un lugar cercano a su casa.  Él los engorda con alimento balanceado y cuando ya están en un estado de desarrollo adecuado, los vende a sus vecinos de la zona y a los comerciantes que llegan al lugar. Esta actividad le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Irvin siempre se esfuerza para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente él desea comprar más alimento balanceado para su ganado. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Irvin is 20 years old, single, and lives in the district of Tambogrande, which is in the province and region of Piura. This area is characterized by the fact that most of the people there cultivate fruit.

Irvin raises sheep, which he keeps near his house. He fattens them with a balanced diet and when they are adequately developed, he sells them to his neighbors or to the merchants who arrive in their area. This works makes it possible for him to help with his family's daily needs.

Irvin is always working to help his family get ahead. At the moment, he would like to buy more well-balanced food for his animals. For this reason, he decided to request a loan of 800 nuevos soles from Edpyme Aternativa. This sum will help him meet his goal.

loans.use: to buy a balanced diet for his animals

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: La Sra. Felicia G. C. vive junto a su esposo. Tiene casa propia la cual se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de los Aquijes. La Sra. Felicia es propietaria de un automóvil que alquila diariamente. Su esposo trabaja como chofer del vehiculo. La Sra. requiere el crédito para hacerle mantenimiento a su vehiculo. Su sueño segun nos comenta es comprar un nuevo vehiculo. La Sra. está muy agrdecida por el crédito que le podamos otorgar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felicia Gutiérrez C. lives with her husband.  She has her own house located in the Los Aquijes district.  

Felicia owns a car that she leases out daily.  Her husband works as the driver.  She needs a loan for vehicle repair and service. 

Her dream, according to her, is to buy a new car.  She is very grateful for the loan we might grant.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 41 años se dedica a la venta de tortillas y ropa nueva. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos por lo que se siente muy contenta. Tiene 4 hijos pero solamente 2 están a su cargo, ella siempre ha sido una mujer luchadora.  Esta inversión será una gran ayuda para tener los productos necesarios para la elaboración de sus tortillas y la ropa. Las aspiraciones son con respecto a su trabajo es contar con esta fuente de ingreso por vario tiempo, para salir adelante con sus hijos, quienes también deben estudiar y prepararse académicamente. El financiamiento es para la compra de maíz, bolsas, cal y leña.
texts.en:
Vilma is 41 years old and devoted to selling tortillas and new clothing. This is not the first time she has applied for credit since has been extremely pleased with the loans. She has four children, but only two are still dependents. Vilma has always been a determined woman.

This investment will be a great help since she can acquire the necessary supplies for making tortillas and selling clothes. Her aspirations with respect to her business include having a source of income for various needs, such as helping her children get ahead so that they can study and prepare themselves academically. This loan will be used to buy corn, bags, lime, and firewood.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy supplies and merchandise for her tortilla and clothing businesses

loans.name: Rocio

texts.en:
Designing, creating, and selling jewelry, accessories, and other crafts is second nature to Rocio, who grew up in Otavalo, Ecuador, the home to one of South America’s most famous crafts market. After moving to the United States in 1998, Rocio knew that opening her own business was a natural choice. “All of my family does this job. It’s what I know and what I learned. When I first came here it was really hard to find a job; instead, I went into business for myself and began selling crafts on the street in downtown San Francisco,” said Rocio. 

Rocio and her husband Alejandro now own a small store, Inkza Crafts, in San Francisco’s Mission District, and also sell their goods at festivals around the Bay Area. Rocio handles the store’s marketing, customer relations, and inventory while Alejandro manages the accounting and administrative aspects of the business. 

Her favorite part about owning a small business, Rocio explained, is being a part of her community. “Each day I am able to meet and make connections with the people around me. I feel free.” As their own bosses, Rocio and Alejandro are able to spend more time with their children. “Our kids can be part of our work. They come to fairs with us and enjoy the food and all the people.” 

One quarter of the merchandise found in Inkza Crafts is designed by Rocio herself, while the remaining inventory is made by indigenous artists throughout Latin America. The store’s success since opening in 2003 has allowed Rocio to work more on her own designs, and she recently has started to sell her products wholesale. A few stores around the Bay Area now sell her jewelry and crafts, and she is excited to increase that number over the next year. 

Rocio and Alejandro first came to Opportunity Fund in 2007 and, using two successive micro loans, were able to build up their inventory and expand their business. Unfortunately, their store was damaged and items were stolen during a recent break-in. A $3,000 micro loan will help them to replace this lost inventory.

loans.use: to replace inventory after a robbery

loans.name: 18-4-78 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Tương N. Thị (106) is a 57-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Tương is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 78 Quảng Hưng (18.4.78 Quảng Hưng).

Tương is widowed and has four adult children. To make a living, Tương raises ducks for sale. Tương has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 700,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2011, Tương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  Tương is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan of 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. Tương plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the other borrowers in the group:
1. P. Thị Chăm (107) is a 39-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food.

2. T. Thị Hằng (108) is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock.

3.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Norabel

texts.en:
Norabel P. is from the village of Kimanait, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Norabel is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Norabel owns & operates a business, selling snacks & other delicacies like halo-halo, rice & cassava cakes in the local community. Norabel has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Norabel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Norabel is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like milk, sugar & food flavorings. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Norabel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed like milk, sugar & food flavorings.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El señor Luis Heriberto L. es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora quien es maestro de distintos colegios de Masaya. El salario de un profesor en Nicaragua es muy bajo es por ello que él solicita el crédito para poder mejorar su vivienda la cual está en malas condiciones para enfrentar el invierno. 
Con el crédito el comprará materiales de construcción para la vivienda.
texts.en:
Luis Heriberto L. is a hard-working and entrepreneurial person who is a teacher in several schools in Masaya.  The salary for a teacher in Nicaragua is very low and this is why he is requesting the loan to be able to improve his house which is in bad condition to face winter.  
With the loan he will buy construction materials for the house.

loans.use: with materials to improve his home.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Mrs. Sor is a 48-year-old married woman who plants different kinds of crops on her farmland to earn a profit. She is a villager who lives in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. Her husband has skills for building houses. They have two childR. – one is a construction worker. Mrs. Sor has had great success growing rice crops, which is an annual process. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year. Rainy season is coming now, and Mrs. Sor would like to ask for a Kiva loan to rent a machine to plow her farmland and to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her crop to grow well.

loans.use: to rent a machine to plow her farmland and to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her crop to grow well.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy toothpaste, washing soap, bath soap, rice, and many items for her business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 37 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  She lives with her family in the town of Banga, South Cotabato.

Analyn is engaged in farming. She primarily grows rice crops to sell.  She also raises pigs in her backyard and makes "chorizo" to sell to the people in her community. She plans to use this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Analyn hopes that this loan to help improve her farming business.

loans.use: ourchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 27 years old and a focused single young man. He has been running a butchery for one year. He earns extra income by carrying out dairy farming. 

In the next five years, he wants to transform his business into a restaurant. He harbors dreams of being a meat distributor and to open other outlets. He wants to realize this dream by working closely with Faulu Kenya.   Hence he has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a deep freezer.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer

loans.name: Nohemi

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA GENERACION III”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nohemi; la socia tiene 46 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 3 hijos 21, 15, 4 años de edad; La socia  alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista; la socia es docente de profesión; por ahora la socia se dedica a las cobranzas; la socia trabaja junto a su pareja  en su molinera;  su conyugue se dedica a moler diferentes granos y ella hace las cobranzas a las diferentes empresas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz, de diferentes tipos y molerlos para hacer harinas de maíz (polenta).

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Nueva Generación III" ["New Generation III"] communal bank, which can be found in the district of Huanchac, province and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Nohemi. She is 46 years old and in a common-law marriage. She has three children, ages 21, 15, and 4 years old. She divides her time between her daily activities and her small business. Nohemi is a teacher by profession, but for now she makes collections for her and her partner's mill. Her partner grinds different grains and Nohemi goes to different businesses to make collections. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of different types of corn and to grind them to make corn meal (polenta).

She is grateful for the support being offered to her and promises to be disciplined in her compliance with the repayment terms.

loans.use: to purchase different types of corn

loans.name: Maria Florencia

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria es casada, tiene varios hijos, todos ya mayores D. edad, con ocupaciones laborales, su marido es técnico en refrigeración,  realiza trabajos a domicilio y en su casa, son una familia trabajadora.
Ella tiene una despensa, la que explota hace ya 10 años, por medio D. este negocio ella logra generar un poco D. ingresos con lo cual logra ayudar a su marido con los gastos D. la casa. La Sra Maria es muy conocida en el barrio asi que por eso tiene mucha clientela. 
Ella comenta que uno D. sus sueños es poder ampliar su pequeña despensa, pues D. esa forma podrá ofrecer más comodidades a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. comestibles, bebidas, hortalizas con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
