Maria is married and has several adult children who work.  Her husband is a refrigeration technician and makes house calls and also works out of his home.  They are a hard working family.

She’s had a grocery store for ten years and generates an income which allows her to help her husband with the household expenses.  Maria is very well known in the neighborhood and has many customers.  She says that her dreams are to be able to expand her small store and be able to offer more items to her customers.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy food, drinks, and vegetables to stock her store.  She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity that it gives her.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
This borrower is from Benito Soliven. She is 38 years old, married, and has two children. 

Janette has had a food business since 2010, where she sells tomato, cabbage, pineapple, and other products. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. Her store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

She is requesting for a loan of PHP6,000 to purchase additional eggplant, tomato, potato, cabbage and pineappleto sell to their community. The income she will generate will be used to renovate the outside and inside of her store. She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family's quality life.

loans.use: to purchase additional eggplant, tomato, potato, cabbage and pineappleto sell in the community

loans.name: Mambo Kwisha Development Association Group

texts.en:
Some business people have been taking advantage of the skyrocketing food prices in Uganda and East Africa to get more from clients. Because food prices have of late been going up, some restaurant owners have also decided to hike the prices on their menus. Somebody not abreast with the current economic situation may think she or he is being ripped off. Some business people may be doing that, but not 44-year-old Betty, a happily married mother of 5, who has been in the restaurant business for the last 30 years. Betty has steered clear of exploiting her clientele though she has found it inevitable to hike her food prices, but by a lower percentage.

Betty also works in the city council, which means it's easier for her to use some of her savings to purchase foods for her restaurant in case of shortage. She generates a weekly income of 100,000 UGX and calculates she will be able to make more once she gets this Kiva loan. Betty was in a bar business prior to this. Her future plan is to expand her business into a full hotel.

This is the fifth time that Betty's group is receiving a loan from Pearl Micro-finance. Their repayment record has been good. Betty intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase more cutlery and plates for her business. She will use the rest of the proceeds to carry out renovations on her restaurant premises.

loans.use: to purchase more cutlery and plates and to renovate her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a variety of garments to meet customer demand.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado San Roque esta situado en la ciudad D. Curuguaty. Todas ellas son amigas y vecinas D. esa ciudad, que se organizaron con el propósito D. procurar para sus familias unas mejores condiciones económicas. Actualmente se encuentran 11 mujeres dentro del grupo, trabajan dentro del segundo ciclo del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la Fundación.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Flora, ella se dedica a la venta D. lencería, trabaja en esto hace ya un tiempo por lo que ya tiene una clientela, la mayoría D. mujeres, bien definida. Comenta que tienen muchas ventas y pedidos con los que debe cumplir. Le gustaría poder seguir creciendo con su negocio, para que D. esa forma pueda seguir manteniendo a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. lencerías para la posterior venta, sabe que D. obtener el crédito, este le será D. gran ayuda, pues con esto podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The San Roque committee is located in the city of Curuguaty. All the members are friends and neighbors from that city that organized themselves for the purpose of obtaining better economic conditions for their families. Currently there are 11 women in the group. They are working in the second cycle of the women entrepreneurs program of the Foundation.
One of the members is Flora. She sells lingerie. She has been in this business for awhile, so she already has a well-defined customer base, the majority of which are women. She says that she makes a lot of sales and has many orders to fill. She would like to be able to continue growing her business, so that in this way she can continue supporting her family. 
She is requesting the loan to buy lingerie to later sell. She knows that obtaining the loan will be of great help to her as it will enable her to supply and meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy lingerie to later resell.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujeres Emprendedoras" se originó a través de promociones que fue hecho en el barrio. Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio. El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espíritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa. Desean poder crecer no solo económicamente sino también en lo personal.
Una de las miembros es la señora Raimunda, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles, mediante lo cual puede ayudar en los gastos de la casa y en la manutención de la familia. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes,pues tiene una sazón deliciosa. Así también nos dice que le gustaría poder seguir con esto e ir creciendo día a día gracias a su trabajo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, pollo, harina, huevos y otros, los cuales son insumos necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos que ella vende.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Entrepreneurial Women) committee was created as a result of promotional work that took place in their neighborhood.  All the members of the group are from the same area.  They are neighbors and acquaintances from the same neighborhood.  The aims of each and every one of them are to work, to promote a supportive spirit within their group and to reach the top level of the program.  They would like to grow not only financially but also on a personal level.

One of the members of this group is Raimunda whose business is selling food.  This work enables her to help cover her household expenses and help support her family.  She tells us that she has a lot of customers because her food tastes delicious.  She also tells us that she would like to be able to continue in the program and continue growing every day thanks to her work.

Raimunda is requesting a loan to buy meat, chicken, flour, eggs and other products which are the supplies she needs to make the food that she sells.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, flour, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Liberato

texts.en:
This is Liberato, 37, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Daisy, a housewife and mother to their four children. Liberato, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Liberato operates a tailoring business. He mainly offers office uniforms, pants, shorts, and the like. Seasonal demands for clothing like school uniforms are available all year round. He also does repairs and alterations. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of Php3,750 in sales every week.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Liberato hopes to be able to expand soon and hopes to support his children's schooling up to college level. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en: Sherlita is 52 years old and lives in San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City. She is married and has two children. Sherlita has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more stock for her general store. Sherlita has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Jeny Joansa

texts.es:
Jeny Joansa tiene 41 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de quince y veinte años de edad en el cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC Vuelve la Esperanza está conformada por 13 socios y socias, está ubicada en la Parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la Oficina.

Jeny se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz, soya, cacao, plátano las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.

Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, semillas de calidad, líquidos para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos para lo posterior venderlos a un buen precio.
El crédito será de mucha ayuda porque le ayudará a mejorar la calidad del producto.
El sueño es poder comprar una casa para poder vivir ahí con la familia y no estar preocupado pagar el arriendo.
Los desafíos a los que se presenta a diario son los intermediarios, la competencia, las plagas en los cultivos.
En los tiempos libres le guata estar con la familia y poder disfrutar de las festividades de la localidad.
texts.en:
Jeny Joansa is 41, married, and has two children. She lives with her husband and her children, ages 15 and 20, in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  The "Vuelve la Esperanza" communal bank is made up 13 members, and is located in San José del Tambo parish, 60 minutes from the branch office. 

Jeny is a farmer, and grows corn, soy beans, cacao and plantains. She carries out her purchases and sales in San José del Tambo, every weekend. She is applying for the loan to buy organic and chemical fertilizers, quality seeds, and herbicides in order to maintain her crops in good condtion and sell them at a good price. 

The loan will be a great help to her, because it will help her improve the quality of her product.

Her dream is to be able to buy a house for herself and her family to live in, and not worry about paying rent. The challenges that arise daily are  competition, dealing with middlemen, and crop pests. In her free time she likes to be with her family and enjoy local festivals.

loans.use: To buy organic and chemical fertilizers, quality seeds, and herbicides in order to maintain her crops in good condition, and later sell them at a good price.

loans.name: Amba B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Amba B Group in Western Kenya! Phylis is the facilitator of the Amba B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Phylis takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have quality maize seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Phylis had an excellent maize yield harvesting 22 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Phylis was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Phylis and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Phylis will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing. 

Phylis is pictured with her group members in the above photograph.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is a 39-year-old single parent living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She started with a retail shop and got capital to start a clothing shop seven years ago. She faces a challenge of price fluctuations and inflation, high fuel and transportation costs, and seasonal customers. 

Her personal goals are to educate her children and to buy a car. 

Rosette needs the loan to buy clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Jenelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages.  She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Jenelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jenelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Ketty

texts.es: Ketty, de 32 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de amable y social. Esta separada, vive en compañía de su padre, madre y su hijo de 9 años de edad a los que quiere mucho, instalados cómodamente en la casa de sus padres. El negocio que tiene Ketty es la venta de frutas, las cuales compra por las madrugadas consiguiendo las más frescas, para luego venderlos en el frontis de la casa de sus padres donde acondicionó una pequeña mesa y los exhibe al público durantes las mañanas, y por las noches se dedica al venta de comida al paso como salchipapas, Juanes, pescados asados. Tiene más de 4 años realizando esta actividad y en este tiempo su madre es quien la apoyo atendiendo a los clientes. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en casa y poder cuidar de su hijo menor, así como el ingreso económico que le apoya para pagar la alimentación y vestir de su hijo y de ella misma, ya que con la pensión que le pasa su ex pareja y padre de su hijo, no le alcanza. Pero ahora ya se siente más tranquila económicamente e incluso tiene planes de abrir una bodega de venta de abarrotes en la casa de sus padres ya que ellos la apoyan en todo. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra de frutas a precio por mayor e ingredientes para la preparación de comida.
texts.en:
Ketty is 32 years old and is a hardworking, earnest, friendly, and sociable lady.  She’s separated and lives with her parents and nine year old son.  She loves them all very much and they all live comfortably in her parent’s home.  She sells fruits, which she buys at dawn, buying the freshest fruits, and then sells them in front of her parent’s house, where they set up a small table.  She shows the fruit to the public throughout the morning.  In the evenings she sells “salchipapas” (potatoes and sausage), Juanes, and grilled fish.

She’s been doing this for four years and her mother has been helping her tend to customers.  She enjoys her business because it allows her to be home and care for her youngest son.  The income also allows her to pay to feed and clothe him and she, since the support she gets from her former husband is not enough.  Now she’s comfortable financially and also plans to open a grocery store at her parent’s house, since they support her in everything she does.

This will be her first loan through MFP and it will allow her to solidify her plans.  She will use the 800 PEN ($300) to buy fruit at better prices, and ingredients for preparing her dishes.
.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Mahukpego Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUKPEGO est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Eya est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Eya est âgée de 25 ans et vit au Bénin. Eya n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Eya est mariée à un tailleur du nom de Anselme. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et deux restent à sa charge. Eya vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Depuis deux ans environs, Eya vend des ustensiles de cuisine de façon ambulante. Eya s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Eya sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUKPEGO, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Mahukpego group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. It is the third time that this group has requested financial aid from Alidé, in order to raise their business volume. The representative of the group, whose name is Eya, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Eya is 25 years old and lives in Benin. She did not go to school and she is married to a tailor called Anselme. The couple has four children, some of whom are at school and two of whom are in their care. Eya lives with her husband and her children. 

She has been selling kitchen utensils on a door-to-door basis for around two years and gets her supplies in a market in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand and in order to increase her turnover and income, Eya is, together with the other members of the Mahukpego group, requesting a third loan from Alidé. The first two loans were repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Paola se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 4 años de edad a quienes siempre les ha querido brindar una buena calidad de vida, por esto hace aproximadamente 2 años montó su propio taller de confección motivada en generar ingresos para su hogar, pues los ingresos que genera su esposo no son suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. La actividad de la confección la aprendió de su madre quien también confecciona, y así montó su taller de confección donde ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros principalmente en la elaboración de tendidos y cortinas para el hogar. Paola busca que un préstamo le permita comprar una máquina fileteadora con la que pueda realizar el terminado de las confecciones de mejor calidad y así entregar mejores productos a sus clientes.

De esta manera espera que sus ventas aumenten, pues podrá tener mejor calidad en su trabajo y así ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Además, así podrá poco a poco ir construyendo el capital con el que pueda cumplir su sueño de sacar su línea propia de ropa interior y vestidos de baño.

loans.use: Comprar una máquina fileteadora con la que pueda realizar el terminado de las confecciones de mejor calidad y así entregar mejores productos a sus clientes.

loans.name: Albertine1

texts.fr: Âgée de 33 ans, ALBERTINE1 a très peu fréquenté l’école mais a appris la coiffure, activité qu'elle exerce depuis dix ans dans sa régoin. ALBERTINE1 est mariée à un couturier du nom de Mathieu. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. ALBERTINE1  vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges du ménage. ALBERTINE1 vend de façon secondaire, des mèches et des produits cosmétiques ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. ALBERTINE1 s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. La clientèle de ALBERTINE1 devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, ALBERTINE1 sollicite une sixième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des mèches et des produits cosmétiques.

loans.name: Marelebohile's Group

texts.en:
Marelebohile is a 45 year old mother of 4 aged between 16-24 years. She not only takes care of her children but has to take care of her two young nieces aged 7 and 5 who have lost both their parents. Mamojalefa lives in a traditional hut that is not well ventilated, nor warms up well in winter. She works long hours to ensure there is enough food for her children who are still going to school and only help her in the field on Saturdays and Sundays. She has to wake up very early, between 3am and 4am, during the week to start preparing the fire for cooking breakfast, heating water and warming the house for her children before they go to school. Collecting firewood, setting up the fire and doing the actual cooking demands a lot of her time. Temperatures in the Lesotho highlands are never really high; winters can get very cold and often Marelebohile has to start the fire inside her hut. Starting a fire often releases smog and smoke which when inhaled in large quantities over a period of time can lead to lung diseases, eye problems and in the worst case to death. In these circumstances, life for women like Marelebohile has been very difficult.

ACE has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, in order to be able to sell on credit clean cook stoves which provide women like Marelebohile the chance of cooking in a way that does not harm them and their families, and that does not require a lot of wood, which is hard to find in Lesotho, nor expensive paraffin and gas . This stove can  be started with the use of very little, readily available biomass like dry twigs and dry cow dung that do not require lengths of time to collect. It does not produce smoke while burning, thus making it safe to be used inside the homes. This stove comes with a solar panel for charging the battery which runs the fan in the stove, a USB port for charging phones and a mini LED lamp. A life improving package for these women. This stove saves them time to be with their family, saves energy, eliminates the element of toxic inhalation, house burning and has given them the freedom to have a better lit home to see better in the evening while cooking and enables children to do their homework.

loans.use: To be able to pay for the ACE cook stoves that are sold on credit so as to improve their lives in terms of the time they spend in homes collecting firewood for cooking.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Emma is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Madam Philomina D. is very dynamic and sells items ranging from fashionable earrings, necklaces, bangles, perfumes, powder, combs, hair accessories, etc but on a very small scale. She would very much like to own a shop and include more items. She is seeking a loan of $900.00 from Kiva to help her put up a shop and sell more items. Her zeal to work harder all the time cannot be over-emphasized, she can indeed pay back every penny.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is not only a school teacher at the 24 de mayo (May 24th) school in the district that she lives but is also a farmer. She already has 12 years of experience in this area. Together with her husband, they have been able to combine their careers as teachers at the local school with their love of farming. They have done this in a very responsible and direct way.

Betty asks for a loan so she can prepare the land for the new crop and renew it as well. She also needs to buy supplies and products that are required and needed for it.

Betty is 40 years old and is married. The well-being of their only son who goes to school and studies is very important to them and they fight for it each day. The conditions of her home are cozy although is made out of wood. They have live happily in this area for 40 years. She hopes that with the crop's earnings, she can buy an irrigation pump and another one for fumigation as well as being able to acquire her own land.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer.

Betty ademas de ser maestra en la escuela “24 de Mayo que preside en el recinto, también se dedica a la agricultura en la que ya tiene 12 anos de experiencia. Junto a su esposo han podido llevar de la manera mas directa y responsable esta actividad, tanto en la agricultura como en carrera de maestros en una escuela de la zona.

Betty pide el préstamo para reactivar sus sembríos, comprando los insumos y productos que requiere y necesita un cultivo como es el arroz.

En la actualidad Betty tiene 40 anos de edad y esta casada. Su esposo también es agricultor y maestro como ella. Ellos luchan día a día por el bienestar de su único hijo que actualmente estudia. Las condiciones de su vivienda son acogedoras a pesar que esta hecha de madera. Felizmente tienen viviendo 40 anos en esta zona. Ella aspira que con la ganancia de la cosecha, pueda comprar una bomba de riego y otra de fumigación, además de poder adquirir sus propias tierras también.

loans.use: Rice cultivation, agricultural products and supplies needed for the crop.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 28 years old and has a welding business in the Kirkuk market. He has applied to get $1200 to purchase a new welding machine. He has a small family consisting of his wife and two children. He wants to enhance his living standard and increase his income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new welding machine

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Business description

José started his business two years ago. The products that he offers include: breakfasts, lunches and snacks. He pays personal attention to his clients every day from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m.

Loan use

José needs a loan to purchase materials to fix his diner and to acquire tables, plates and kitchen utensils.

Personal information

José is 23 years old and single. Through his business he helps relatives. He started his business with his own capital. The restaurant is part of his mother's home. With the loan he hopes to make repairs to the diner and make his business more mobile. Through this he'll be able to improve his customer service.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

José inicio su negocio hace 2 años. Los productos que ofrece son: desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas la atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 6-a.m.-a -9pm.

Uso del Préstamo

José necesita del préstamo para invertir en la compra de: materiales para arreglar su local y en la adquisición de mesas, platos y de utensilios de cocina.

Información Personal

José tiene 23 años. Es soltero .En la atención de su negocio le ayudan sus familiares .José inicio su negocio con capital propio. El local ocupa una parte de la casa de su madre. Por lo que necesita del crédito para realizar arreglos de su local e implementar más mobiliarios. Para de esta forma mejorar el servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: Repair restaurant

loans.name: Kazimey

texts.en: Kazimey U. was born in the Russian Federation of Dagistan in 1965 and then moved to the town of Khachmaz on the northeast coast of Azerbaijan. He owns his own hauling truck (called a “kamaz” in Azerbaijan), and he makes his living by transporting masonry bricks to construction sites. Kazimey has been working as a truck driver for the last ten years and is married with two children. He is currently requesting a loan of $1,200 so that he can make some much-needed repairs to his truck.

loans.use: To repair his work truck

loans.name: Chamroeun

texts.en:
Mr. P. Chamroeun and his wife have been married since1987. They have four children; two sons and two daughters. One of the sons builds wooden houses with him and one of his daughters is working in a garment factory. Chamroeun and his family live along National Road number One about twenty five kilometers from Phnom Penh. He started his business in the year 1985. His wife stays at home and takes care of their children.  

Chamroeun is requesting his first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $500.  He will use this loan, in addition to other money he has saved, to purchase supplies for finishing his wooden house (shown in photo).

loans.use: Home building

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 36 year-old Editha B.. She is single with four children, ages 2, 4, 6, and 8, and has one other dependent who is her nephew.

In 2007 Editha established a café business. Editha has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA and now requires a loan of $875 in order to purchase additional stocks of ingredients and soft drinks in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support; hence, poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Asisat

texts.en: Asisat A. is a 42 year old mother of 4 children and is a strong and focussed woman. She has been operating this business for the past 15 years and is very familiar within her community and friendly with the people around her. Her longevity in this business gives her an edge over her competitor. She has been a LAPO member for the past 3 years. She requests a loan of $450 to buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Djahid

texts.en: Djahid (his brother is pictured ) is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town. He is settled in the Fizuli region, Bala Bahmanli village. He has 5 years of experience in this business.  Now this 30-year-old man needs a loan of $1200 to buy more clothes to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy clothes for the business

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris has been selling clothing for a long time. She offers her products in different areas of her town, and in the smaller towns nearby. Doris is a strong woman with many goals. She now wants to add to her business by selling shoes. She is 57 years old and is the mother of 7 children, who are now all grown and live with their own families. She and her husband, Octavio, live alone. She is requesting a loan for the purpose of achieving her goal. Let’s help Doris attain her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Doris se dedica a la venta D. ropas desD. hace mucho tiempo, sus productos los oferta por los diferentes lugares D. su zona, y a los caseríos aledaños a su ciudad. Doris es una mujer fuerte y con muchos objetivos, pues ahora quiere complementar su negocio con la venta D. zapatos. Ella a sus 57 años D. edad es madre D. 07 hijos los mismos que ya son independientes y viven fuera del seno familiar con sus respectivas familias, gozando actualmente solo D. la compañía D. su amado esposo, Octavio, para lograr su propósito solicita un préstamo. Apoyemos a la señora Doris a lograr su meta.

loans.use: An injection of capital so that she can begin to offer shoes, athletic clothing, and other clothing.

loans.name: Celia Del Pilar

texts.es:
Celia is a member of Banco Comunal Mujeres Soñadores, and is located at Jr. Raymondi 958 in the Callería district of Ucayali. She is 43 years old, has one child and her husband works in a mine. Celia took out an initial loan of $100 and invested it in a small shop selling cosmetics.

Today, she continues selling cosmetics and also prepares gourmet chocolates which are very rich in flavour. In the mornings she prepares the chocolates and in the afternoons she sells her products.

With this loan of $925, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy perfume, lipstick, talcum powder, eye shadow, pieces of jewelry, sugar, chocolate, pecan nuts, peanuts etc.

Despite her physical disability, Celia continues making progress and says that working with Manuela Ramos is a great help as it enables small businesswomen to generate both income and savings.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Celia pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Soñadoras, ubicado en el Jr. Raymondi 958, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años y es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo trabaja en una mina, es así que Celia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña venta de productos de belleza. En la actualidad continua con sus productos de belleza, también prepara chocotejas que son una manjar muy rico, por las mañanas prepara sus chocotejas y en las tardes sale a ofrecer sus productos y cobrar. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: perfumes, labiales, talcos, sombras, colonias, joyas, azúcar, chocolate, pecanas, maní, etc. Celia pese a su discapacidad física ,ella sigue adelante y dice que es un gran apoyo trabajar con Manuela Ramos por que les ayuda a las mujeres microempresarias para poder generar ingresos y ahorrar.

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing to resell in her community.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Thorn S., 27, lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia with her husband, Chhet Bun Thol, and takes care of her two young children every day.

Her husband is the only source of income for the family. He typically makes $13 USD each day in his auto body shop. He has been repairing cars for about fourteen years and his business is running very well. He could use some new equipment, though, and the family would like to see their income increased through this investment.

Thorn S. has asked for a loan of $600 USD to purchase some tools, paint, and other items that her husband needs to improve his business. She believes this loan will provide a great opportunity for her family and looks forward to seeing how her standard of living can be improved.

Thorn S. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband, Chhet Bun Thol, appears in the photograph.

loans.use: Purchase auto repair tools, paint, etc.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Flor de Maria lives in the neighborhood of Villa Venezuela in the city of Managua. She is married, and she and her husband are both merchants. She has 6 children, of whom two are in her care. Mrs. Flor sells costume jewelry and makes fried snacks, which she sells at night. She began the business with the help of her husband and with her savings.

The loan will be used to buy perishable goods for the production of the fried snacks and, as a result, she will be able to serve more clients. Because of a lack of capital, sometimes she doesn’t have as much food as she would like. With the sale of the fried snacks, she hopes to be able to invest more into her costume jewelry business.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Flor de Maria habita en el barrio Villa Venezuela de la ciudad de Managua, es casada y su esposo al igual que ella es comerciante. Tiene 6 hijos de los cuales solamente dos están a su cargo. Doña Flor se dedica a la venta de bisuterías y a la elaboración de fritangas, venta que realiza diariamente por las noches. Empezó el negocio con la ayuda de su marido y con ahorros de ella.

El préstamo será usado para la compra de productos perecederos para la elaboración de las fritangas y así poder atender a más clientes, ya que por la falta de capital, algunas veces no hace tanta comida como ella quisiera. Con las ventas generadas de la fritanga espera poder invertir más en el negocio de la venta de bisuterías.

loans.use: To buy perishable goods for the fried snacks

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.es: El Sr. Hermenegildo es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 52 años de edad. Toda su vida ha trabajado en la preparación y venta de rosquillas. Son cuarenta años de experiencia ya que su familia de eso subsistía, y así aprendió a trabajar y hacer las ricas rosquillas que son elaboradas a base de maíz, queso y manteca, actualmente está soltero, sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes. El préstamo lo necesita para comprar un caballo y así facilitar  sus ventas y poder moverse con  rapidez.
texts.en:
Mr. Hermenegildo is 52 years old and is a hard working man. His entire life he has worked in the preparation and sales of hot cakes. He has 40 years of experience. His family used to live off the hot cakes, and as a result Mr. Hermenegildo has refined a delicious recipe, combining corn, cheese and butter. Currently, he is single and his children are grown up. Mr. Hermenegildo is requesting the loan to purchase a horse which will help him sell his product and move more quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a horse

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan B. is the father of three kids who are currently in school. He is a 48 year old businessman. He owns a rubber products shop and sells items such as rubber barrels, plates and gallons containers. He has been in business for the past twenty years. He says the rubber products are in demand because households use his items to store water during water shortages.  He will use the loan to re-stock his shop to improve sales. He believes that the loan will allow his business to grow. 

He belongs to the community group named "Hyebenehi" Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee each other, providing social collateral to access loans.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of plastic containers and barrels.

loans.name: Khom

texts.en: Mrs. Khom K. is a villager in Prey Run village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Because her field is infertile soil and she does not have much money to hire a laborer to support her production, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and hire a laborer to support her field to make her crops more productive. Her husband, Mr. Chan Soern, is a construction worker. Mrs. Khom K. is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and hire a laborer to make her crops more productive

loans.name: Djénéba

texts.fr:
Madame Djénéba  S. est âgée  de 60 ans et vit avec son mari et ses 6 enfants dans le quartier Pelengana Sébénikoro de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas été à  l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença très tôt les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère. Elle opta pour la grillade de l’arachide et l’achat vente du mil depuis maintenant 10 ans. 

Pour griller l’arachide elle met dans une poêle du sable et de l’arachide la dessus et le tout sur du feu. Avec une louche, elle remue incessamment  l’ensemble durant quelques dizaines de minutes jusqu'à ce qu’elle se rende compte que la chaleur du sable a bien grillée les grains d’arachide.

En vue de satisfaire sa clientèle plus en plus croissante elle a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, depuis 3 ans. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous correctement bien remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel. 
Ce  nouveau prêt servira  à acheter,  15kg sacs d’arachide et 10 sacs de mil auprès des producteurs des villages environnants de Ségou.
Madame  Djénéba  S. effectue ses ventes au marché château de Ségou et dans les différentes foires (lundi de Ségou et jeudi de Banankoro), au comptant en détail à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 37 500, qui servira à rembourser les intérêts du prêt et à supporter certaines charges familiales. Son ambition est de constituer un trousseau de mariage pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Djénéba S., 60, lives with her husband and her six children in the Pelengana Sébénikoro neighborhood of the town of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Having not been able to attend school for family reasons, she began early on to earn her living helping her mother. She chose to roast peanuts and sell millet, which she has been doing for 10 years now.

To roast the peanuts, she puts sand in a skillet and peanuts on the sand, then puts the skillet on the fire. With a ladle, she stirs continuously for a good many minutes, until she can tell that the heat of the sand has roasted the peanuts correctly.

Wishing to satisfy the needs of her ever-growing clientele, she turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. After four group (solidarity) loans and two individual loans, all correctly reimbursed, she is now on her third individual loan.

This new loan will be used to buy 15 sacks of peanuts and 10 sacks of millet from the farmers in the villages around Ségou. Mrs. Djénéba S. makes her sales in the Château market in Ségou and in the various fairs (on Monday in Ségou and Thursday in Banankoro), retail and for cash or credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to make a monthly profit of 37,500 F CFA, which will be used to make repayments on the loan and to cover certain family expenses. Her dream is to get together a trousseau for each of her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of peanuts and millet

loans.name: Pring

texts.en: Mrs. Pring H. is a villager in Andoung Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Since her field is far from an irrigation system, it is difficult to water her crop, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump to water her crop. Additionally, she will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Uk Kan, helps her with the plantation. Mrs. Pring H. is 46 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom work in a garment factory, while the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy a pump to water her crop.

loans.name: Amina Nalubega Group

texts.en: N. Amina sells used clothes from Mityana by moving around to the daily markets in and around Mityana, Mubende, and all the surrounding areas. She is a married woman with 5 children and more 2 children in her care. She sells mostly ladies skirts and blouses, nets, and children’s wear. She has used previous loans to increase her clothing inventory. As a result, Amina has been able to buy herself a plot of land and a sewing machine that she uses for part- time tailoring. She also owns a cow that gives her milk for sale. She needs her portion of the group loan to purchase clothing inventory.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Berdimurod

texts.en:
Berdimurod T. has always been a hard-working man, who has made sure, from his young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married and has two children. Berdimurod has a general store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs, etc.. With a starting capital of 500 USD, thanks to perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise 8 years ago. 

Over time, he expanded his business and today this has  become a family business and his daughter and son are also engaged in this business. Today he needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of his goods. With this purpose in mind,  he is requesting a loan of  800 USD for a term of 9 months. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business. 
      

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
N. is 36 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province. He has been a fisherman since 2000, and earns his living with skill and hard work. During the morning and in the late afternoon he works from his small boat with his fishnets along the Tonle Sap river. His wife, Cheng, is 38 years old and helps N. in the business. He has three children, all of whom are single and under his care. 

Income from his fishing allowed N. to buy a motorbike for his family, and now he is requesting a loan of $200 to buy more fishnets to help his business grow. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living. N. dreams of having a big house for his family and of his children earning college degrees.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets for his business

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: La Sra. Maritza C. Z. tiene 46 años de edad, ella vive en la colonia Morazan, tiene un hijo de 12 años de edad, es soltera y se dedica a la venta de golosinas como ser: tacos, enchiladas, tortilas con quesillo, burritas, baleadas, los domingos hace sopa de mondongo y sopa de pescado, ella tiene 15 años de tener su negocio, dicho negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitacion, su deseo es remodelar su casa y poder hacer un comedor mas grande en el cual puedan llegar muchos clientes, esta es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maritza C. Z. is 46 years old, she lives in the Morazan district, has a 12-year-old son, is a single mother and sells snacks such as tacos, enchiladas, cheese tortillas, burritos, and baleadas. On Sundays she makes tripe soup and fish soup. She has had her business for 15 years, and carries on said business in a room in her home. She hopes to remodel her house to make the dining room larger so that she will be able to attend to more clients, this is her only means of income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of vegetables, meats, tortillas, cheese, butter, beverages, plates, cups, coffee, and biscuits

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Doña Ofelia M. R. es una señora de 53 años de edad. Vive con su esposo y sus siete hijos. 

La comunidad en la cual vive doña Ofelia se llama El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias que azotan la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. 

Cuando no existían actividades muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajos en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en la Zona Atlántica de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado, por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona y de esta forma evitar migrar.

Desde hace dos años doña Ofelia se ha involucrado en la producción de leche y queso como una forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Dice estar muy contenta porque gracias a este proyecto ha podido salir adelante y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y de los niños. Además, la actividad ha involucrado desde su inicio a toda la familia; su esposo la ayuda con el ordeño y los niños ayudan con el pastoreo de las vacas en los ratos libres después de la escuela.

El queso de la región donde vive doña Ofelia es famoso en todo Costa Rica. Es un queso fresco que se le conoce tradicionalmente como “queso tipo Turrialba”. A los “ticos” (como se les conoce a los habitantes de Costa Rica) les gusta mucho consumir este producto; se le encontrará en las mesas acompañando cualquier tipo de comida, especialmente en los desayunos  junto a tortillas, arroz, frijoles, huevos, el típico “gallo pinto”, entre otra variedad de comidas.  Por esta razón, el mercado para dicho producto es realmente bueno.

Doña Ofelia  desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar una vaca lechera más y así aumentar la producción de leche. Ella sabe que contar con una vaca más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser una microempresaria exitosa y  sacar adelante a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida, la motiva a esforzarse con gran esmero y dedicación.

Doña Ofelia es cliente de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una organización local socia de la micro financiera EDESA. Gracias a su vinculación con esta organización ha obtenido ya 7 micro créditos y los ha cancelado satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
Ofelia M. R., 53, lives with her husband and their seven children. Ofelia lives in the El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba community, in the Cartago province. It is a small, rural community of approximately two thousand inhabitants. The inhabitants work in milk production and coffee farming. The landscape is very irregular, and much of the land is maintained as tropical rainforest. The community has very picturesque scenery that combines the tropical rainforest with two pretty ponds, coffee plantations, and dairies. El Sauce is located at about one and a half hours by bus from Turrialba, which is the closest commercial center. Nevertheless, several times a year the road is impassable because of the rains. This is, without a doubt, one of the major challenges for the community. When there weren’t many jobs, many people chose to leave to look for work in Turrialba or in banana plantations located on the Atlantic coast of Costa Rica. Lately the prices of coffee and milk have improved, so now people from the area are looking for ways to invest in projects in their own area and avoid migrating. For the past two years Ofelia has been involved in milk and cheese production as a way to generate income for her family. She is very happy because this work has allowed her to get ahead and to help her husband with the expenses of the children and the house. Also, the whole family is involved. Her husband helps her with the milking, and the children help with the care and feeding of the cows during their free time after school. The cheese from the region where Ofelia lives is famous throughout Costa Rica. It is a fresh cheese that is traditionally known as “Turriabla Cheese.” Ticos (a nick-name for the people of Costa Rica) like to buy Turrialba cheese to eat with any type of food, but especially at breakfast, along with tortillas, rice, beans, and eggs. That is why the market for these products is good. Ofelia would like a micro loan for the amount of $900 (500,000 colones) to buy another milk cow and increase the milk production. She knows that having another cow is a big sacrifice and will require more work. Nevertheless, the desire to be a successful microentreprenuer and improve the family living conditions motivates her to put forth great effort and dedication. Ofelia is a client of the Producers Association of El Sauce, a local partner organization of the microfinance organization EDESA. Thanks to her ties to this organization, she has received 7 micro-loans and she has repaid them satisfactorily.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es socio del Banco Comunal Maria Celeste.
Jorge es casado, tiene 45 años y 2 hijos, Jorge junto a su esposa tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende comida y también reparte a los comerciantes del mercado, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Jorge necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar por sacos.
Los sueños de Jorge son que su hijo ingrese a la universidad y tener un local propio y estable.
texts.en:
Jorge is a member of the Maria Celeste Community Bank. He is 45 years old, is married and has two children. Jorge and his wife have a sales post in the 12 de Abril Market, where he sells food daily, and also serves the commercial businesses of the marketplace. Jorge is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles ($350 USD), with which he plans to purchase large sacks of rice and sugar for use in his business. Jorge hopes that his son can attend university and he also hopes to have his own stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para en la compra de arroz, azúcar por sacos. (For the purchase of sacks of rice and sugar)

loans.name: Shazia Nadeem Group

texts.en:
Shazia baji is a group leader of four ladies who belong to her community. They all are very hardworking ladies. They are applying for a loan for different works but have one motto, to increase their profit, because economic condition of Pakistan is getting worse day by day and it's difficult for a single person to meet the house expenses. So they all also handle their own businesses to share the financial burdens of their husbands.

Shazia baji is applying for a loan to buy electric supplies such as wires, switchboards and switches for her husband's electric shop. Mubeen baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell. Rehana baji and Nasreen Akhtar baji each want a loan to buy sewing machines for sewing clothes. Asia baji wants a loan to buy bed sheets to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy electric supplies for electric shop.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 43-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their five children. Sonia has been working as a seamstress for thirty-five years. She sews curtains, clothes and even wedding dresses. She also sells thread.

Sonia requested a loan of $1,600 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tissue, thread and accessories for her sewing. This is her fourth loan and she has always repaid on time. Her previous loans helped her purchase a new sewing machine and improve her work.

Sonia is special in her work because she does it well. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Sonia decided on doing her work because she learned it since she was young; she took after her father’s work. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase tissue, thread and accessories for her sewing

loans.name: Humorbi

texts.ru: Чумаева Хуморби проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 42 года. Замужем, имет 2 детей. Хуморби более 6 лет занимается услугой, она занимается пашивкой. Муж занимается услугой такси. Клиентка просит кредит, для закупа сырья, чтобы предоставлять качественные услуги.
texts.en:
Humorbi J. lives in the Hamadoni region. She is 42 years old. She is married and has two children. Humorbi has been providing services as a seamstress for more than six years. Her husband is a taxi driver. The client is asking for a loan to buy raw materials to provide quality services.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Samuel Kamenwa

texts.en:
Samuel is 28 years old and married with one child. He owns rental houses in Mwimtu, Kikuyu, Kenya. His clients are low income tenants. Samuel also rears pigs and sells pork to pork product dealers. He learned about KADET through his friends who are also members.

He intends to use his loan to build permanent rental houses. He hopes to expand his pig farming so as to connect with companies that deal in major pork products like Farmers Choice.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To build more rental houses.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
IMELDA P. is 52 years old, married with 8 school-age to adult children and a resident of Brgy. Jerusalem, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental.

Imelda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 and for the past 6 years enganged in selling dried fish and rice in her local community. This earns her approximately PHP 20,000 per month and is a big factor in the financial security of her relatively large family.

With some of the children still going to school, Imelda is determined to increase her income potential so that she could set aside some money for the education of her children while providing for their immediate needs. 

For this 11th loan cycle, Imelda is borrowing PHP 17,000.00 to increase the volume of her inventory and have more items to sell to her customers. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: ADDITIONAL INVENTORY AND WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene S. is from the village of Poblacion, Mambajao Camiguin. She is thirty years old and married with two school-age children. To make a living, Irene owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) retail shop. She sells a variety of different products to the local community. Irene has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Irene joined HSPFI, a Kiva field partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Irene is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie P. is a villager maintaining an eatery business. He is 34 years old, married to Elaine, and they have a son, named Russ Evan, who is 3 years of age. His family lives harmoniously in Barangay Centro 1 Angadanan, Isabela – a simple town where most residents have their own ways of becoming more productive in their livelihoods.

Before now, Ronie was managing a general store and later decided to shift into an eatery business, which is good, according to him. To expand his business, Ronie decided to request a loan from Kiva lenders of 14,000 PHP. He believes that, with Kiva’s help, he will be able to make his eatery progress.

loans.use: Additional capital for an eatery

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: Maria del Socorro B. M. tiene 48 años. Es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de taxi. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica este negocio, por lo que poco a poco fue ahorrando para lograr comprar un carro y así con la ayuda de su esposo que es mecánico, y así comenzó con este humilde negocio. Por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse la vida de una manera muy responsable. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para repuestos que son necesarios para el taxi. Su deseo es de seguir trabajando para seguir adelante.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Sabougnouma. Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Sabougnouma sont des femmes mariées  avec en moyenne  28ans et 2 enfants. Elles  vivent  dans des familles monogames au Millionkin un des quartiers de la ville de Loulouni, 3ème région administrative de la république  du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle qui ne cesse de croître. 
Elles  font de la restauration avec la préparation et la vente d’atiéké et de haricot cuisinés.
Avec leur premier prêt, elles comptent acheter, une grande quantité d’atièkè, de l’huile et du haricot (50kg de graine de haricot).  Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Loulouni ville et les villages avoisinants et  vendent à Loulouni ville,  à domicile, au marché et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante. Elles vendent au comptant  souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille; l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager un point de vente.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers pour la restauration.

loans.name: Gran Fortaleza De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal; “LA FORTALEZA DE SAN JERONIMO”; Nuestros socios son un grupo muy alegre y muy bien organizado, ellos son 14 socios, se ausentó una de las socias, la Sra Mery F., debido a que se fracturó la mano hace 3 días atrás; pero en su representación está la hermana de la socia, ellos se reúnen en el distrito de Huanchac en el local de la institución.

Nuestros socios alternan sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista en todas sus formas, un socio vende  ceviche (plato típico de Perú a base de pescado y limón), otras dos socias atienden un restaurante de platos típicos, otro socio es albañil, otro es mecánico, otras socias venden ropa, otras trabajan en un hospedaje, haciendo la limpieza general, otro socio está en la venta de auto partes, otro maestro de obras, otras socias venden en sus carretas pollipapas y salchipapas, otras venden comidas en general y venta de papa en el mercado. Todos nuestros socios requieren el préstamo para poder de este modo reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios, haciéndolos prosperar y crecer más.

Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This group belongs to the communal bank "La Fortaleza de San Jeronimo." The group is comprised of 14 members who are happy and very well organized. One of the members, Senora Mery F., is absent, due to the fact that she injured her hand three days prior, but pictured in her place is her sister. This group meets in the Huanchac distract where the bank is located. These members alternate their activities in the home with retail trade in all its forms: one member sells ceviche (a typical dish of Peru made with fish and lemon), other members serve in a restaurant that sells typical Peruvian dishes, another member is a bricklayer, another is a mechanic, other members sell clothing, others work in a boardinghouse doing general cleaning, another sells auto parts, another is a master builder, other members sell pollipapas y salchipapas (typical Peruvian meals of chicken or sausage served with fried potatoes) on the streets, others sell meals in general and sell potatoes in the market. All of the members need a loan to reinvest in their businesses, so as to make them prosper and grow. These members appreciate and value the loan granted through these means, and they are committed to making the payments on their various debts on time.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to reinvest in their various businesses

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista is a 50-year-old single mother of four children between the ages of 5 and 20 years .All her children go to school. She rents a two-room house where she stays with seven people. Teopista takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets two meals a day. She doesn’t incur additional transport to and from shopping because she buys from people who get it in the  villages. She has a small bar selling all types of beer and local gin and sells to all categories of people both at retail and at wholesale. Teopista works seven days a week .She receives an average of 30 customers a day. Her major business challenges include thieves and the rainy season, which hinders her customers from coming to her because she works in a muddy place. Teopista‘s monthly expenses includes school fees, rent for her business premises and residence and feeding the family. She has been in this business for 15 years and with MCDT for five years, servicing her 12th loan working with the same group mates. Teopista joined MCDT because it was near her home and also she wanted to increase her capital. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of local gin and crates of beer. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and start selling at wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk

loans.name: Maria Eudocia

texts.es:
La señora  María B. es socia del banco comunal La Merced hace 3 ciclos,  éste banco está ubicado  en la parroquia Santa Ana en la ciudad de Cuenca. Nuestra socia vive en la comunidad Solorosa,  ella tiene 27 años de edad está  casada y su esposo trabaja como chofer de un bus interprovincial, concibió dos  hijos que se encuentran de 7 y 6 años ellos estudian en la escuela República de Colombia de su  comunidad,  gracias al esfuerzo mutuo lograron construir su casa propia que aún le falta los acabados

María se dedica a la cría de animales como  chanchos, cuyes y gallinas, los vende  en la Feria Libre de Cuenca o en su comunidad, con  los préstamos recibidos compró sus animales  para su criadero y  con el préstamo que le entreguen va a comprar  chanchos y alimento para su crianza.

Su meta es llegar a terminar su casa y empezar con un negocio de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Maria B. has been a member of the community bank “La Merced” for three cycles, this bank is located in the Santa Ana church in the city of Cuenca. Our member lives in the Solorosa community, is 27 years old, married and her husband works as a driver of an inter-provincial bus, she has two children ages seven and six, they study in the “Republica de Colombia” community school, with mutual effort they were able to build a house that still needs some finishing touches. Maria raises livestock, such as pigs, guinea pigs and hens, and sells them in the free market of Cuenca or in her community, with the loans received so far she bought livestock for the farm, with the new loan she will purchase pigs and feed to raise them. Her goal is to finish her house and start a business to sell food.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs and feed to raise them

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando D. is a corn grower. He manages a small parcel of land to be able to provide his family an adequate supply of food, clothes and other basic needs. Aside from having corn, he also raises four cows, three pigs and chickens.

He would like to apply for a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow his crop well.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith sells sarongs and laces to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction she has with her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. Judith is 45 years old, and married with six children. Her youngest child is 7 years old. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports the family. Judith is an LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.) Judith is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more sarongs and laces to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and laces to sell

loans.name: Carmen Alicia

texts.es: Carmen Alicia R. A. de 49 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijas. Carmen posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos  comestibles y de primera necesidad. A pesar de que cuenta con muy poco tiempo de tener la tienda, cuenta con muchos clientes, es por esto que ella tiene la necesidad de poder incrementar su inventario, por el hecho de que no posee muchos productos para ofrecer, por ser un negocio nuevo. Carmen solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar productos perecederos como huevos, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, como también bebidas y golosinas. Ella es una persona quien se ha esforzado mucho por poder brindarles lo mejor a sus hijas, es por ello que nació la idea de tener un negocio propio, ya que esto beneficiaria en gran manera la economía de su hogar. Razón por la cual Carmen deposita sus esperanzas en poder mejorar sus ganancias gracias al préstamo solicitado, puesto que será este el que le permitirá invertir en el negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen Alicia R. A. is 49 years old and lives in Ciudad Arce in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and two daughters. Carmen owns a store where she sells food and basic staples. Although she has only recently opened her store, she has many customers and because of this she needs to be able to increase her inventory as she currently does not have many products to offer given that hers is a new business. Carmen is asking for a loan with which to buy perishables such as eggs, rice, beans, sugar as well as drinks and candies. She is someone who has worked very hard in order to give the best to her daughters and it is for them that she came up with the idea of opening her own store as it is of great benefit to the household's finances. This is why Carmen is placing her hope in being able to improve her earnings thanks to this loan as it is what will allow her to invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishable goods for resale

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 53-year-old married man with two children. Since 2004 he has owned a photography shop. He has vast experience in this line of work, as he has been in the business for 36 years. In addition to working in his studio, Hussein photographs special events such as weddings and private ceremonies. He is happy with his business and always learns the new systems and programs that are specific to the photography sector. Today, Hussein is requesting to borrow $1200 USD to buy an advanced digital camera to be up to date with the market and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy an advanced digital camera

loans.name: Silvia Gabriela

texts.es:
Doña Silvia Gabriela O. habita en Chichigalpa en un barrio que se llama el pueblito, este barrio es uno de los más antiguos de este pueblo, su dirección es frente a la Iglesia de El Pueblito, también una de las Iglesias más antiguas, ella es una señora muy dispuesta al trabajo y a la superación, es casada, tiene 40 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, dos mujeres y un varón, el mayor está en la universidad, la mayor de las dos niñas está en secundaria y la menor en primaria, el marido tiene un bus con el que trabaja para una empresa privada con el cual transporta personal de esta empresa, de esta manera él contribuye con los gastos de la familia. 
Doña Silvia trabaja con la institución desde el año 2004, tiempo en el cual se le han otorgado la cantidad de 34 créditos, demostrando en todo este tiempo mucha responsabilidad con sus obligaciones, estos créditos le han ayudado de gran manera, ya que con ellos poco a poco ha podido ir ampliando su negocio, y a la vez mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia Gabriela O. lives in Chichigalpa in a neighborhood called el pueblito. This neighborhood is one of the oldest in the town. She lives in front of the Church of El Pueblito, also one of the oldest churches. She is a woman who is prepared to work and do better. She is 40 years old, married and has three children, two girls and a boy. The oldest is in college, the oldest girl is in high school and the youngest in grammar school. Her husband has a bus and works for a private company transporting company personnel. He contributes towards family expenses this way. Mrs. Silvia has worked with the institution since 2004. During this time she has received 34 loans and shown she is very responsible with her obligations. These loans have helped her greatly since she has been able to expand her business little by little and at the same time improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise: Rice, Oil, Sugar, Beans and Cosmetics (Creams, Lipstick, Nail Polish, Eye Shadow, Cases).

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa V., from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao Camiguin Province, is 41 years old, married, and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Marissa owns and operates a specialized retail business selling personal jewelry including necklaces, bracelets, and earrings in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for four years, earning about 2,500 monthly.

In 2009, Marissa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI, she is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be Marissa's second loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Seab

texts.en:
Mr. Seab N., age 53, and his wife, Mrs. Meun Hor, age 52, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1970 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. All of their daughters weave silk at home and the sons attend school. His wife stays at home and does housework.

Seab has been raising chickens for one month. He is requesting his first loan of $1,200 to use for his chicken business.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for his business

loans.name: Love

texts.en:
Love D., 34, is married to Richard D., a buy-and-sell agent, and they have three children. She helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life by selling silver jewelry.

Love has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.
