She is consistent in paying her dues and uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her jewelry business.

Love would like to apply for a PHP 18,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more silver jewelry so that she can offer more choice to her customers.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying more silver jewelry

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy E.  is a 45 years old.  She is married to a commercial driver and they are blessed with 6 children. Mercy’s children are doing well at school and this is her joy as a mother. She owns a restaurant where she sells mouth watering  Nigerian cooked food. Mercy loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. 

Mercy says thank-you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and five children. He is the sole income provider for his household. He has been working as a car mechanic for 30 years. He has owned his own shop since 1979.
He is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. He plans to use the loan to purchase new machines for his business. These may include a car scanner and a special device to check a car’s carbon dioxide level. This will be his first loan from Ameen. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by five per cent.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen
Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To purchase new machines, such as a car scanner and a device to check a car’s carbon dioxide level

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando tiene 46 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de serigrafía. Hace más de 13 años que se dedica a este negocio. El inicio en un espacio muy pequeño de su humilde vivienda, pues siempre está pendiente de sus 3 hijos y como buen padre les ayuda en lo que sea necesario y en lo que él puede, por lo que siempre busca la forma de generar ingresos a su familia, a pesar de ser una persona muy humilde es muy trabajador. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como pinturas, mantas, tinta, mecate, alambre entre otras cosas. Sueña con ser un gran empresario y ampliar su negocio aun más.
texts.en:
Rolando is 46 years old and he has been working in the silk screen-printing business for more than 13 years. He started working in a very small space in his humble house, as he always takes care of his 3 children and, as every good father, he helps them providing for what they need and any way he can; this is why he is constantly working to improve the income of his family, in spite of being a humble and hard-working man. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy core materials like paints, fabrics, inks, ropes and wires among other things. His dream is to become a big entrepreneur and thus expand his business even more.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core products.

loans.name: James Nkoyetu

texts.en: James has been planting wheat to sell since 2003. He is 40 years old, married to Nelly K., and they have five children. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to buy fertilizers and pesticides in preparation for wheat planting. In the future, James plans to buy his own combine harvester and tractor which he will also hire out to other farmers to diversify his income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides in preparation for wheat planting

loans.name: Brigette

texts.en:
Brigette P. is a 33-year-old married woman who supports her family through her general store business. She lives in Brgy Lakawon, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental with her husband and their two children.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her family's living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

Brigette is now borrowing 20,000 PHP to have additional working capital for her general store.  Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Brigette aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Rithy Leng Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Rithy L. was born in 1970 who is a villager in Trapeang Leuk village in Takeo province. She is also a village bank president of village bank loan having been selected by its thirteen members. While each members of this village bank loan will use portion for their loan of different purposes. Mrs. Rithy L. and her husband, Mr. Oeurn Samret, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family moreover she is also a crab and vegetable seller at her located market. Her obstacle is that her field is infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Rithy L. is seeking for a loan to buy fertilizer, hire plow machine to plow her field, and rest of the loan she buys more vegetable to resale. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is a construction worker, while the others are studying in local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, hire plow machine to plow her field

loans.name: Betty Patricia

texts.es:
Betty de 41 años, ella tiene un salón de belleza en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana,  llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas). 

Betty comenzó cortando cabello y pintando uñas en su casa, hasta que pudo reunir dinero para comprar los utensilios de que necesitaba para su salón de belleza, poco a poco y con la ayuda de su esposo pudo readecuar su casa para ubicar su negocio. Ahora trabaja desde las 14h00pm hasta las 22h00pm todos días. 

Para poder agrandar su negocio ella necesita comprar con el préstamo muebles para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener mejor amoblado su salón de belleza y así asegurar el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Betty is 41 years old and has a beauty salon in the front part of her house. She lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area named after the many orchids that existed when the place was discovered).

Betty began cutting hair and painting nails from her home in order to earn money to buy equipment she needed for her beauty salon. Little by little and with the help of her husband, she was able to remodel her house so that she could fit in her business. Now she works every day from 2pm to 10pm.

In order to expand her business, she needs a loan to buy furniture. In the future, she wants to have better beauty salon furniture and be able to secure her children’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture for her beauty salon

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees has been living in a small city in Punjab, Pakistan called Kot Radha Kishen for the last 25 years. Kot Radha Kishen is known for its dairy industry as most of the people live there have dairy businesses.  

Balqees’s husband also operates the same business as most of the people do here. He works in the wheat fields in the morning and in the evening he sells milk of his buffaloes. Currently, he has a buffalo at his house. Balqees also helps her husband in his business. She takes care of the buffalo when her husband works in the field. 

She is the mother of two daughters and two sons and lives with her family in a three-room brick house.  Three of her four children are getting their education and are in 6th, 3rd, and 2nd standard respectively while her eldest son left school after his 8th year and started driving. He drives a rickshaw to supplement the income of his family. 

Balqees has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s dairy business. With the loan amount her husband will buy another buffalo and increases the milk-production.  Balqees is confident that her husband will be able to make positive use of the loan money and increase his income by selling good quantity milk to his customers. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and is on her 4th loan. She has maintained a good credit record in past loan years and has never missed any meeting.

loans.use: Purchase another buffalo for her husband's dairy business

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: Olivia vive en casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio está ubicado en el pueblo de Achacachi en comunidad Huanuco. Olivia es productora  de leche, su producción es  entregada a la empresa de lácteos Pil. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera la cual le permitirá aumentar su producción de leche. Es su primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Olivia lives in her parents' home, located in the village of Achacachi in the community of Huanuco. She owns a dairy and sells milk to Pil, a large distributor of dairy products. This is her main source of income. The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow which will increase her milk production. This is Olivia's first loan with Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dairy cow.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Seang S., 37, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. S. raises pigs and produces rice wine, earning an income of 6 USD per day. Her husband is a soldier in the province, earning an income of about 4 USD per day. The family has to spend 50 USD on food, 15 USD on public transportation, and 15 USD on their children’s education every month. S. is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase pigs and chickens to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. Sokhorn's husband appears in the photograph because S. is not available.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and chickens

loans.name: Peres Chepkinyor

texts.en:
Peres Chepkinyor K. is a 63 year old lady married to James K.; they have five children, ages 42, 40, 38, 35, 22 and 20. They live in Kipkaren in Eldoret- Kenya. Peres has been in the grocery store business for the past four years, where she earns an income of Kshs.6,000 per month.

Peres was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and she is applying for her second loan of Kshs.15,000 with KADET LTD. With this loan she plans to buy tomatoes, onion, vegetables, Fruits and irish potatoes.

She hopes to expand her business and operate a large scale grocery.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions, vegetables and irish potatoes.

loans.name: Hannah Ekua

texts.en:
Hannah Ekua O. is a widow and has seven dependants. She has received senior high education. Hannah sells banku at Abura, which she has been doing for 20 years. Hannah uses her income to educate her children and feed her family. Hannah will use the loan to purchase more maize to prepare banku for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to save to further her children's education.

The picture shows Hannah in the process of cooking banku she’s going to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to prepare banku

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora, de 40 años, está casada con Florián, de 43 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos, José, de 16 años y Jesús, de 2 años de edad. A los que cuida y educa en su casa propia ubicada, en la localidad Sangani. Hace 3 años, que se dedica a la agricultura, donde siembra café, en sus 3 hectáreas de terreno agrícola. Donde después de cada cosecha, vende en el mercado central de su localidad. Pero, lo que más le gusta a ella, es el trabajo de profesora, actividad que desempeña hace ya algunos años. Sin embargo añora aquellos tiempos en los que toda la familia compartía momentos gratos en los cuidados que le brindaban a sus plantaciones. Por ello quiere seguir sembrando, pero en mayores cantidades para obtener una buena producción. Más adelante planea abrir una librería en su casa, ya que no existe una en su localidad. Es el sexto crédito con MFP y se siente orgullosa de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde todo este tiempo pudo aprender a surgir y salir adelante. Con el crédito que obtendrá, podrá invertir en el mantenimiento de sus cafetales; ya que está recultivando (renovando plantaciones de café), para la temporada que se avecina.
texts.en:
Teodora, age 40, is married to 43 year old Florián.  They have two children, 16 year old José and 2 year old Jesús.  They take care of the children and are raising them in their own house in Sangani.

She has been growing coffee on three hectares of farmland for three years.  After every harvest she sells the coffee at the central market in her area.  However, what she likes the most is teaching, which she has done for some years.  Nevertheless, she yearns for the times that the whole family shared good times taking care of their crops.  That is why she wants to keep farming, but in greater quantities in order to get good production.

Later, she plans to open a bookshop in her house because there are none in her area.

This is her sixth loan with MFP.  She is proud to belong to her communal bank, where she was able to learn to excel and get ahead.  She will use the loan for upkeep of her coffee fields.  She is again preparing the land for growing coffee for the coming season.

loans.use: Maintenance and care for her coffee crops

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Presentación; ella tiene 55 años de edad, casada  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de picantería (ella prepara platos típicos a base de leña y carbón) siendo su horario desde las 08:00am hasta las 07:00pm, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo ambos sacan a su familia adelante mediante su negocio.

La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para su negocio como carbón,leña,arroz,aceite entre otros. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
[Presentación] is a member of the “Vamos Juntos” (Let’s Go Together) communal bank, located in the Cusco district, within the Cusco department and province.

Adelaida is 55 years old.  She is married, has four children and sells food (typical dishes cooked under firewood and charcoal) from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM.  She works alongside her husband and, together, they are moving their family ahead through this business.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies and ingredients, such as charcoal, firewood, rice, and cooking oil, among other things.

Our associate appreciates those persons who help make this dream possible through this means and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Supples and ingredients

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena I. is a married woman who lives in Barangay San Jose, Puerto Princesa City. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store, a cashew brittle business and a banana chips business. Her husband Ronaldo, who is 45 years old, works as a government employee to earn his living. They have one child who is five years old. Rowena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 7 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 14,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $288, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 8th loan, she is borrowing 19,500 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital for buying cashew nuts and more stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future. Rowena I. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, 58 años, es una madre muy dedicada a su familia y a su trabajo, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más D. 30 años,  trabaja apoyando a su esposo, quien se dedica al trabajo D. cerrajería  y  fabricación D. muebles a base D. fierros, en su taller, que se encuentra ubicado en el primer ambiente D. su casa. Para Elena sus días son D. arduo trabajo, por las mañanas prepara el alimento para su familia y para los empleados que trabajan junto a su esposo, y por las tardes  se dedica a coser, tapizar los forros para las sillas y muebles que su esposo fabrica. Es así como se encarga D. darle los toques finales D. los muebles que fabrican, y del que tiene mucha acogida por parte D. sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo, es la independencia en el desarrollo D. su trabajo y además lo rentable que es. En adelante, anhela ampliar su negocio y mejorar sus herramientas D. trabajo. Es su noveno crédito con MFP y se compromete pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y en su banco comunal, se considera como una socia muy entretenida. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará  fierros, ángulos, D. esa manera incrementará su stock D. materiales para continuar trabajando con tranquilidad.
texts.en: Elena, age 58, is a mother who is extremely dedicated to both her family and her work. She lives with her husband and their 2 children in their own house. For over 30 years, she has worked helping her husband, who is a locksmith and maker of wrought-iron furniture, in the workshop in the front part of their home. For Elena, the days are hard work. In the mornings she prepares food for the family and the employees who work with her husband, and in the afternoons she is busy sewing: making upholstered covers for the furniture her husband makes. In this way, she is in charge of putting the finishing touches to the furniture they make, and these are well-received by her customers. What she likes best about her job is the freedom she has in her work, and also the fact it is so profitable. Going forward, she hopes to enlarge the business and get better tools to work with. This is her 9th loan from [field partner] MFP, and she promises to make her repayments on time. The others in her communal bank consider her a very pleasant member of the group. With the loan she is seeking, she will buy iron, and thus increase her stock of materials to continue working and have peace of mind.

loans.use: To buy iron and tools she needs for her workshop.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 27 years old and married.  He sells water to earn a living.  He has been in the business for almost two years.  So far, he has employed one person in his business.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money and has acquired business skills.  He needs more workers to supply water to other regions, so he has requested 20,000 KES.

loans.use: To pay for laborers

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly is a married woman who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a pig fattening and a food vending business. Her husband Saol H., who is 56 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 5 children who are between 15 and 32 years old. Melly joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Melly has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,800, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to pay for more funds in business operations so that she can continue to save up for family needs and her children’s education. Melly is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Capital for pig fattening and food vending businesses.

loans.name: Mahmadrasul

texts.ru: Бобохонов Махмадрасул проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 46 лет. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Образование-среднее. Более 8 лет занимается растениеводством. Он в основном выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа семян, минеральных удобрений и топлива. Он намерен посеять, и получит хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en: Mahmadrasul Bobohonov lives in the Vahdat region. He is 46 years old. He is married and has five children. He has secondary education and has been in agriculture for more than eight years. He grows mainly vegetables. He is taking out the loan to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer and fuel. He plans to sow and collect a good harvest for resale.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: Joel Ramírez C.  es un joven muy trabajador que desea prepararse cada día mejor académicamente. El hace unos meses se graduó de la universidad pero a aun esto no lo detiene a estudias un lengua extranjera. Joel en este momento solicita del apoyo para poder pagar un curso de Ingles y comprar libros de esta manera podrá obtener mejores ofertas de trabajo y así sus ingresos sean incrementados.
texts.en: Joel Ramírez C. is a very hard working young man who wants to improve his education every day. He graduated from university a few months ago but even this will not stop him from studying a foreign language. Now, Joel is requesting a loan to pay for an English course and to buy his books. This will help him obtain better job offers and therefore increase his income.

loans.use: to pay for an English course

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Marilu; La socia es casada,  tiene 39 años de edad, y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de materiales de construcción, la socia compra todo tipo de materiales, desde, piedras, arena, ladrillos y agregados para la venta, ella desea aumentar su capital y con ello su mercadería, la socia hace de este préstamo un capital de trabajo ella comprará materiales al por mayor  y de este modo se abastecerá. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Juntas y Unidas" community bank. This bank is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco. 

The member is Marilu. She is married and is 39 years old and has two children. She is dedicated to buying and selling construction materials. She buys all types of materials including rocks, sand, bricks and gravel to sell. She wishes to increase her capital and with it her  merchandise. The member is requesting this loan of working capital to buy materials at wholesale prices and, in this way, get supplies. The member is requesting the loan to purchase construction materials.

The member is happy with the loan granted and promises to make her payments at the established deadlines.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of school supplies, such as books, notebooks, uniforms, and backpacks

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en: Nergui is a 41 year-old widow, and lives with her three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live together in ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  Her two sons are helping her business and her daughter attends a university. Nergui operates a construction material business and also produces metal nails in a rented stall at the largest market in her town. There are few competing businesses at this market, and her business has seen steady growth. Through the years, Nergui has gained much experience and grown her business. She hopes to save some money to build her own house and to be able to provide for her children’s education. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to increase her working profit by buying some metals to produce metal nails.

loans.use: to purchase some metals to produce metal nails.

loans.name: Iasha

texts.en:
Iasha T. is 60 years old. He is married and lives with his wife Naira in the village of Supsa, Lanchkhuti District. Iasha and his wife are engaged in agricultural activities. They have a plot of land where cucumbers are grown. The harvested cucumbers are sold locally. Also, Iasha has a tractor. In case of orders, he tills the plots in his and neighboring villages. He uses his tractor on his plot as well.

With the requested credit, Iasha plans to purchase fuel for his tractor and fertilizers in order to cultivate his land. Afterwards, he will sow the cucumbers. According to Iasha’s estimations, after cultivation he will have more and better quality cucumbers than in previous years, as he hasn’t fertilized the plot for several years. Part of the profit will be reinvested in the business. In addition to the cultivation, he plans to renovate his tractor for the next season. He hopes that some funds will be left for renovation of the house as well.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and fertilizers

loans.name: María Bertha

texts.es:
La Señora. María O. es socia del banco comunal Narancay Bajo, vive por el sector del Vergel en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad en 1999 fue nombrada patrimonio cultural de la humanidad por la belleza colonia de su centro histórico, Cuenca es cuna de grandes atletas, pintores, escritores y artesanos, tiene una variedad en su gastronomía, su gente es muy amable y cordial.
 
Doña María tiene 30 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 10 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su hermana la misma que es prestada.
 
La Señora. María se dedica al comercio, vende frutas y esta actividad la desempeña hace 10 años, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunas y lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas para seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Su sueño es tener  casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. María is a member of the Narancay Bajo Community Bank. She lives in the Vergel neighborhood in Cuenca City. This city was named a World Heritage Cultural Site in 1999 because of its beautiful colonial architecture in its historical center. Cuenca is the birthplace of athletes, painters, and artisans. It has a great variety of restaurants. Its people are friendly and polite.
Mrs. María is 30 years old. She is a single mother of two children, ages 10 and 2. Her first child attends a little school in the city. She doesn’t have her own house. She lives with her sister in a house that is on loan to her.
Mrs. María sells fruit. She has been doing this business for ten years. She works from Monday until Friday from six in the morning until five in the evening.
This is her second loan with the community bank. She is going to use the money to buy more fruit in order to continue expanding her business.
Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena lives in the village of Tupsan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 56 years old, widowed and has four grown children. For the last six years, she has made a living by running a food stall where she sells snacks, ice cream and other items. She earns about 5,000 PHP a month.  

In 2010, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid two previous loans from HSPFI and is applying for a new one, for 8,000 PHP, to buy more items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to continue improving her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith tiene 28 años de edad, ella es soltera y sin hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en un caserío llamado Hualtaco II ,en el distrito de  Tambogrande, ubicado a 8 Km de esta ciudad, cuenta con luz eléctrica pero  no tiene agua ni desagüe.

Judith cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por ella misma. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida  y con clientes fidelizados Con esta actividad ella ayuda en su hogar con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Judith  está solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles, este dinero lo utilizará para comprar mas mercadería para su negocio  de esta manera Judith satisfacerá su demanda ya que en los últimos meses se ha incrementado. 

Judith  con mucho esmero y trabajo desea poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, ella cuenta con buenas referencias, pues las personas que la conocen la describen como una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Judith tiene 28 años de edad, ella es soltera y sin hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en un caserío llamado Hualtaco II ,en el distrito de  Tambogrande, ubicado a 8 Km de esta ciudad, cuenta con luz eléctrica pero  no tiene agua ni desagüe.

Judith cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por ella misma. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida  y con clientes fidelizados Con esta actividad ella ayuda en su hogar con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Judith  está solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles, este dinero lo utilizará para comprar mas mercadería para su negocio  de esta manera Judith satisfacerá su demanda ya que en los últimos meses se ha incrementado. 

Judith  con mucho esmero y trabajo desea poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, ella cuenta con buenas referencias, pues las personas que la conocen la describen como una persona tranquila y responsable.

loans.use: Compra de mercaderia para su negocio.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman, age 51, has owned and operated a grocery store since 1999. In addition to grocery items, she sells a number of gifts and gadgets, which she added to her inventory in order to increase her income. She lives in Tyre with her husband and two children.

Iman is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business capital by purchasing gift items and summer beverages to offer for sale. She also intends to use some of the profits from her loan funds to continue building her family house.

This is Iman's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. Her previous loan helped her to introduce new products to her business, and this investment helped to increase her income.

Iman works hard on improving and expanding her business so that she can help to provide her family with the best possible standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase gift items and summer beverages to offer for sale in her shop

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Menuisier de profession, Komlan a ouvert un atelier depuis 2005. Il est spécialisé dans la fabrication de meubles (chaises, garde à manger tables) Il sollicite ce troisième prêt pour acheter du bois à Lomé afin de fabriquer des meubles. Il a 34ans et père de 02 enfants. Sa femme est revendeuse.
texts.en: A carpenter by trade, Komlan opened a workshop in 2005. He specializes in manufacturing furniture (chairs, pantries, tables) He is requesting this third loan to buy wood in Lomé to make furniture. He is 34 years old and the father of two children. His wife is a reseller.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 37 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Marilou works very hard to provide for her family.

Marilou runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Marilou has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, bread, noodles, and sugar.

Marilou would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a married woman with three children. Two children attend school while one is still too young for school. Nyevu's greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail clothes selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 35,000 KES, she wants to purchase 60 sacks of charcoal and 20 pairs of Khangas for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 60 sacks of charcoal and 20 pairs of Khangas for sale.

loans.name: Jeam

texts.en: Jeam, 35 years old, is a worker. Her husband is a construction worker. Their income is $8 per day. She has three children. Two of the children are studying. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work with her husband. Before, she was a farmer but she could get little income so she changed to work as a worker. She also does farming when she has free time from her work to make more income to support her children, as she wants to send them to study at the university.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah is 35 years old and married.  He does dairy farming to earn a living for his family.  He joined Faulu Kenya so that he would access financial support easily.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has also learned how to manage his business well.  Isaiah hopes to start large-scale farming in the future.  

He has requested for 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow and animal feeds.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and animal feed.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
La señora  Socorro , se dedica a la venta  de pan desde hace diez años  es una señora muy reconocida en su localidad por el  riquísimo pan que  elabora , empezó hacer pan desde los trece años puesto que su madre Albina se dedicaba a la  elaboración de pan .
Su  esposo  Amadeo  le ayuda  a amasar los ingredientes para el pan y  a vender el pan de casa en casa.
Tiene la cantidad  de dos hijos varones  Gilberto  y Fernando  quienes ayudan comprando los ingredientes que necesita  un día antes de que vaya hacer el pan .
Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar mas insumos para la elaboración de pan como son :  harina, levadura , huevos , manteca etc.
Antes no contaba con una panadería  pero gracias a las ganancias  ahora ya cuenta con una panadería  , sale a vender pan  a otras localidades y en ocasiones  sale a vender en su localidad  de casa en casa  ya que sus hijos se quedan atendiendo la panadería.
Esta  muy contenta  por que cumplió uno de sus sueños que es  tener una panadería pero le gustaría elaborar pasteles  para bodas es una persona  que le gusta  cumplir sus metas.
Le da las gracias a fundación realidad  por ayudarla a cumplir sus sueños
texts.en:
Socorro has been selling bread for the last ten years.  She is very well known in her community because of the delicious bread she makes.  She started out 13 years ago because her mother, Albina, also baked bread.  Her husband, Amadeo, helps her knead the dough and to sell the bread door to door.  She has two sons, Gilberto and Fernando, who help her buy the ingredients she needs the day before she’s going to bake the bread.  She requested the loan to buy more ingredients to make bread like: flour, yeast, eggs, shortening, etc.

She didn’t used to have a bakery but thanks to profits she now has one.  She goes out to other localities to sell bread and sometimes goes out in her own location to sell door to door while her children stay tending to the bakery.

She is very happy because one of her dreams came true: to have a bakery.  But, she’d like to bake wedding cakes also.  She’s a person who likes to reach her goals.  

She thanks Fundación Realidad for helping her to make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy bread baking supplies.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a business woman aged 33. She is married and blessed with two children. For the last 13 years, she has been selling sand soil and building blocks to make a living. She has been able to improve her business since she joined Faulu Kenya. In the next 5 years, she wants to buy a piece of land. 

She is requesting for a loan of 25,000 Kenya shillings to buy sand soil and blocks to sell.

loans.use: To buy sand and blocks to sell.

loans.name: Jose  Roberto

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto esta  casado con la  señora  San Juana  y   tienen   ya   treinta  y   cinco   años   juntos   y  han  formado  un a   bonita   familia,  actualmente  ellos  se  dedican  a  atender   una  tienda   de abarrotes , la  cual  les  a permitido  salir  adelante  día    con día,  ellos  están  muy  contentos  por  habernos   encontrado  ya  que  los  apoyaremos   en la realización de  su proyecto,  el cual  consiste  en  realizar  la compra  de  mercancía  para  su tienda ya  que  desean   tener  en  inventario  los  diferentes  productos  que   les  demandan   sus clientes   así como también  seguir  brindado  el  excelente   servicio  que   los caracteriza.
texts.en:
Sr. Roberto is married to Sra. San Juana. They have been together for 35 years and have formed a beautiful family. Roberto currently manages a grocery store, which allows him to move forward day after day. He is pleased to have contacted Credituyo for assistance with completing his project.

Roberto plans to buy merchandise for his store. He wants to have an inventory of different products so that he can meet the demands of his customers and continue providing the excellent service for which he is known.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Ikhlass

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 36 years old, married and the mother of three children.

Ikhlass is a tailor. She started working in 2000. She makes, repairs or alters suits, coats and trousers for women. She has more than ten years experience in this field. She understands local customers and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for a $2,400 loan in order to purchase a tailoring machine and to renovate and redecorate her workplace. She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and to renovate and redecorate her workplace.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina and her husband are both farmers.  They did not pursue their education due to lack of financial support. They plan to educate their six children so that they will not be like them.  They want their children to earn a degree so that they will find good jobs someday. Despite financial difficulty, they look for possible solutions to support the education of their children. 

Carolina and her husband aim to increase their corn production so that they will earn a higher income and satisfy their needs.  Due to the high cost of commodities, Carolina is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and pay the labor cost required in planting corn. They hope that this loan will help them make an improvement in their business.

loans.use: buy corn seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and pay labor cost

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cylinders of gas to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Шавкат проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 44 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Шавкат занимается торговлей. У него имеется собственный магазин, где он продает детскую одежду. Этим видом бизнеса занимается восемь лет. Кредит берет для приобретения новых видов костюмчиков.
texts.en: Shakvat lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 44 years old, married and has four children. His wife stays at home and Shakvat is in retail. He has been managing a children clothing store for the last eight years. He is requesting this loan to purchase a new batch of children outfits for the winter season.

loans.use: to purchase new kids of outfits

loans.name: Armen

texts.ru:
Армену 26 лет; он живет в  городе Капане. После окончания капанской средней школы, Армен поступил и окончил в Ереванский Государственный Университет (факультет радиофизики).
В данный момент Армен работает электриком и проживает в селе Цав, Сьюникского региона. Армен не женат и  живет вместе с родителями. 
Сельскохозяйственным бизнесом Армен и его семья занимается уже на протяжении 7 лет. У них есть небольшой собственный участок, а также арендованный земельный участок, на которых они выращивает яблоки, груши, картошку и капусту на продажу. Кроме растениеводства, Армен и его семья занимаются животноводством: разводят крупный рогатый скот и кур.   
Вместе с родителями Армен реализует выращенные овощи на рынках Сьюникской области, а мясо, молоко, яйца, фрукты и оставшиеся овощи у него покупают постоянные скупщики прямо из дома.
Армену нужен кредит в 1.000.000 армянских драм, для покупки  нового сорта картофеля для засева и организации посевных работ (покупки дизельного топлива, удобрений и т.д.).
texts.en: Armen is 26 years old; he lives in Kapan. After finishing middle school in Kapan, Armen entered and graduated from Yerevan State University (Radiophysics Department). At this time, Armen works as an electrician and lives in the village of Tsav in the Syunik province. Armen is unmarried and lives with his parents. Armen and his family have been in agriculture for the past 7 years. They have their own small piece of land and lease some more land, on which they grow apples, pears, potatoes and cabbage for sale. Besides growing crops, Armen and his family raise livestock, raising cattle and chickens. With his parents, Armen sells the vegetables in the Syunik regional market, but his regular customers buy meat, milk, eggs, fruit and vegetables directly from his home. Aren is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 dram to buy new varieties of potatoes to sow and to prepare for the sowing season (purchase diesel fuel, fertilizer, etc.)

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings, fuel and fertilizer

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 49-year-old married lady who is blessed with four children, ages 9 through 22. 

She has been operating a green grocery to earn a living.  She has engaged in this business for two years.  Besides, she does farming to supplement her income.  Her desire is to own a lorry for transporting fruits and vegetables to the market place where she runs her grocery business. 

Ann needs some capital to start a business selling charcoal.  Hence she has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy charcoal.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Alan

texts.es:
Alan pertenece al banco comunal “La Colmena De Pilcopata” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Pilcopata de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco.

Alan tiene 25 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, él nació en la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado pero él vive  en la ciudad de Pilcopata y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Alan es el mantenimiento de carros y motos. Ya son cinco años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

En esta oportunidad Alan requiere el préstamo para comprar repuestos de motocicletas.  Su sueño de Alan abrir una tienda de venta de repuestos.       

Alan agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Alan belongs to "La Colmena de Pilcopata" (Beehive of Pilcopata) community bank; members meet every thirty days in the city of Pilcopata, which is in the Paucartambo province of the Cusco department. 

Alan is 25 years old and has a son with his common law wife. He was born in Puerto Maldonado but lives in the city of Pilcopata, where he works. His primary economic activity is car and motorcycle maintenance. Alan has been in this business for five years already, and it's going very well. 

At this time Alan needs the loan to buy motorcycle parts. His dream is open a store to sell automotive parts. 

Alan appreciates and values this loan, and promises to meet his monthly payment obligations.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Shamsidin

texts.ru: Шамсидин житель района Хамадони. Ему 57 лет. Он женат. У него 10 детей. Шамсидин занимается выращивание овощей. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа топлива.
texts.en: Shamsidin is a resident of the Hamadoni district.  He is 57 years old, married and has ten children.  Shamsidin is involved in growing vegetables.  He has been in this business for 15 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of fuel.

loans.use: to purchase fuel

loans.name: Lor

texts.en:
Mr. Lor, 45, is a farmer who lives in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. He also sells firewood. He is a diligent and responsible father who works outdoors from dawn to dusk to support his three school-age children. He does this because he wants them to have an education and get good-paying jobs after they graduate. 

Mr. Lor would like borrow some funds from Kiva, through HKL, to buy a new plowing machine because his is old and often breaks. With his new plowing machine, he hopes that he won’t have any difficulties to perform his farming tasks as he has before.

loans.use: to buy a new plowing machine.

loans.name: Erasmo

texts.es:
Erasmo es un hombre de 58 años de edad, casado, tiene 4 hijos de 18, 20, 23 y 28 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de charque (carne deshidratada).
Él es emprendedor, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘alto peñas’ caracterizado por su cercanía al lago sagrado Titicaca, área agrícola dónde se cría ganado; vacuno, ovino y camélido, se vive de la pesca y también de cereales y vegetales del lugar, como la quinua, el chuño, la haba, la papa, etc. caracterizada por el clima frío, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-12 grados centígrados y donde los rayos solares golpean con mucha fuerza la superficie.
Erasmo es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a la agricultura y con sus 2 hijos menores porque los mayores ya son independientes, viven en una casa construida de adobe con techo de paja que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la elaboración y comercio de charque; que es carne deshidratada; se cubre con sal y se expone al sol hasta que se seque, en la actualidad se usa para conservar la carne por períodos prolongados. El comercio lo realiza en comunidades vecina como también en la ciudad, existe una gran variedad de comida que se cocina con este producto. “el charque se puede cocinar o se puede comer crudo, porque los rayos solares la cocinan…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un invernadero para producir vegetales. Él desea realizar la compra de ganado vacuno para faenear y producir charque en cantidad. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Erasmo solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno para faenear y producir charque.
texts.en:
.
Erasmo is a 58 year old man.   He has children who are 18, 20, 13 and 28 years old, and his business is the sale of charque(dried meat).

He is enterprising, independent, steady, responsible and hard-working.  Erasmo  carries out his business in the community  of  Alto Peñas, noted for its nearness to sacred Lake Titicaca.  This is an agricultural area where livestock is raised:  beef cattle, sheep and camelids (llamas).  People eat fish and also the cereals and vegetables of the areas, such as quinoa, chuño, beans, and potatoes.  The area is known for its cold climate, with temperature varying during the day between 1 and 12 degrees Centigrade.  The sun's rays strike the earth strongly.

Erasmo is dark-skinned, with short black hair, and is  short in stature. His native language is Aymará,  the language spoken in the area.  He speaks Spanish as a matter of general knowledge and for his business.  Erasmo shares his life with his wife who works at farming, and with his two younger sons, since the older ones are already on their own.  The family lives in a house built of adobe with a straw roof, which has electricity and well water.  

His business is the preparation and sale of charque, meat which is covered with salt and placed in the sun until it is dry. This method is used to preserve meat for long periods of time.  Erasmo makes his sales in neighboring communities and also in the city.  Many kinds of food are cooked using this product.  "Charque can be cooked or eaten raw, since the sun's rays have cooked it, " he says.  Erasmo's dream is to have a greenhouse for growing vegetables.  He wants to buy beef cattle to slaughter and produce a large amount of charque.  This is the first loan for him with the institution in the six years he has been working at this activity.  These are the reasons why Erasmo is asking for a loan to buy beef cattle to slaughter and produce charque to sell.

loans.use: to buy beef cattle to slaughter and make dried beef to sell

loans.name: Nuzhat

texts.en: Nuzhat  is a married woman and has been running her beauty parlor along with her husband(also shown in the photo). She is doing her job passionately; she knows the techniques of makeup and hair design and serves her customers by providing bangles, jewelry etc. She is a well-known beautician in her town. Nuzhat  is a responsible mother of 3 children. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a Murabaha loan of 20000 PKR  to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams to cater to a large number of customers efficiently to earn good amount of income for bearing her everyday expenditures.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams to cater to a large number of customers efficiently

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a widow with 2 children who are in primary school. Her husband passed away in 2001. She has some basic training in the area of health care and operates a small chemist (pharmacy) in her rural village. She intends to use the loan of US$300 from PEMCI to stock her chemist and to boost her business’s profitability. This being the only health care facility in her village, Judith is playing a very key role in supporting the well-being of her community. She is also distributing free Malaria drugs under a Government program.

loans.use: Chemist (Pharmacy) Owner

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
Yusif is a single man.  He lives in the Salyan region in Yenikand village. He started his business 3 years ago. Having borrowed $400, he bought 6 sheep and 2 goats.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy 8 pregnant sheep in order to increase the size of his herd.

loans.use: to buy eight pregnant sheep

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
I feel it necessary to ask for a loan of $1,200.00 dollars in order to install protections on my home, as there have been various robberies and I do not want this to happen to my family. I have 2 adolescent girls and my husband and I work all day.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Me veo en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls para poner las protecciones de mi casa ya que sean presentados barios robos y no quiero que les vaya a pasar algo a mi familia. Ya que tengo 2 hijas adolescentes, y mi esposo y yo trabajo casi todo el día.

loans.use: Window and Door Protection

loans.name: Ciria Lidia

texts.es:
CIRIA -62 years old- runs a small grocery store at home. She is a widow and has 8 children. She belongs to the group Tres Estrellas 3 (Three Stars 3), along with Ms. DOLORES CASTELLANOS J. (who makes bread at home and sells it door to door). With her share of the loan, Ms. Ciria hopes to stock her store better, buying more groceries and beverages; and Ms. Dolores will buy a hundredweight of flour to scale up her bread production.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

CIRIA, de 62 años de edad, posee una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Es viuda y tiene 8 hijos. Pertenece al grupo Tres Estrellas, junto con doña DOLORES CASTELLANOS J. (quien prepara pan en su casa y lo comercializa de puerta en puerta). Con su parte del préstamo, doña Ciria espera abastecer mejor su local, comprando más mercadería y bebidas, y doña Dolores comprará un quintal de harina para poder así aumentar la preparación de su pan.

loans.use: Grocery store (Tienda de abarrotes)

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 37 years old and has three children (ages: 11, 10, 8). She is married and the whole family of five live in her house. She runs her business out of her house, selling fabrics, primarily bedding (i.e., sheets, pillow cases, curtains, etc.) Ana has already successfully paid back one loan from Esperanza for 5000 pesos (150 USD). She is requesting this second loan to buy a sewing machine, so she can make her own products out of cloth.

Ana was born crippled. Her legs are badly deformed, but she still walks on them and is able to work to proviD. for her family.

NOTE: This is a group loan, there are four other women in her group. This $900 loan will fund Ana's business as well as four other businesses in her solidarity group. She and four other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza's business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective business and will pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be maD.. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine to manufacture the bedding products she sells

loans.name: Nelnila

texts.en: Nelnila is a single lady with a small business selling office and school supplies in Zaporoshye, Ukraine. She is a very experienced entrepreneur, having been in business for twelve years. Reasonable prices, good product selection and hard work have been the secrets to the success of her business. Nelnina would like to continue that success and has requested a loan of $1000 to increase her working capital. This will allow her to buy new inventory items to sell and enable her to match her products with customer demand so that she can earn a good profit.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Osteria

texts.en:
Vegetarians avert your eyes! This is Osteria M. and she runs a butcher’s shop in the rural town of Mlandizi, about 30km outside of Dar es Salaam. In Swahili, a butcher business is called ‘kuchinja ngombe”, which literally translated means ‘the slaughter or ruthless killing of animals’. Ruthless killing? Maybe I’ve just managed to change the minds of a few meat-eaters!

Osteria established the business in 2006 and requires a loan of $375 to purchase additional equipment and stock. She is married to husband Leonadi with whom she has three children, Grace, 14, Ronado, 9, and Devota, 2.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation for women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment and stock for her butcher's shop

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 27 year-old woman who owns a small cosmetics shop in the region of Nabatieh, in the south of Lebanon.

Sabah is known in her community to be an independent, self-sufficient young woman. Sabah is asking for a loan to be able to buy enough merchandise to sustain and develop her shop.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Chang

texts.en: Mrs. Chang C., 44, is a mother of two children who works as a rice seller.  She normally makes a profit of $7 a day. Her husband, Mr. Deth Kneth, 46,  works as a farmer to supplement the household income, and can make up to $2 a day. Mr. Deth plans to purchase a mill to assist in grinding the rice crops. Grinding rice is a profitable activity. To buy this machine the couple has asked for a loan from KIVA of $800.

loans.use: This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a mill.

loans.name: Anorjon

texts.en:
B. Anorjon has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2003. She is a very reliable and responsible client. The stability of her business helped her to repay her previous loans on time and to improve her business, so she opened a store that sells material and curtains. She has a very good assortment and many repeat customers because she sells at prices that are lower than the bazaar prices.

Mrs. B. Anorjon has applied to KIVA for a loan of 2100 STJ for 6 months to buy new goods for her business.

loans.use: To buy new goods for her curtain store

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Prom S. P., 24 years old, lives in Siem Reap Province where she is employed by a local golf course, making $3 U.S. per day. Her husband, 28-year-old Hoin Hea, earns just under $2 per day working at the same course. They have two young children, both currently enrolled in school. During the rainy reason their house offers little protection from the elements, so Prom is requesting a loan of $400 to buy the materials needed to repair their roof. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase materials to repair their roof.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.es:
Angelita is a member of the Banco Cumunal Virgen de la Natividad, located in the Jr. Sinchi Roca 125, of the Calleria district, Departamento de Ucayali. She is 32 years old and the mother of two children. Her husband is a professor, but his income is not enough to support the family. Due to this Angelita used the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, in the amount of s/.300, to open a small grocery store where she mainly sells candy and soft drinks.

Currently, she sells her products from her home to be able to spend more time with her young children, to be able to do the housework and in this way tend to her business in a more relaxed manner.

With this loan, in the amount of S/. 1,500 which will be payed in 4 months, she will purchase: a variety of candy, soft drinks in different prices and some groceries.

With a lot of effort Angelita is helping her family get ahead, to achieve the well being they need and to have a more comfortable life, free of need.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Angelita pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de la Natividad, ubicado en el Jr. Sinchi Roca 125, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es profesor, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no le alcanza para mantener a su familia, es así que Angelita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega de venta de golosinas y gaseosas. En la actualidad vende es su casa sus productos para poder estar mas tiempo con sus hijos que aun son pequeños, y así puede realizar sus tareas domesticas, y atender su negocio con mas tranquilidad. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: golosinas en general, gaseosas de diferentes precios y tamaños, un poco de abarrotes. Angelita saca adelante a su familia a base de mucho esfuerzo, para darles el bienestar que necesitan y tener una vida mas cómoda, sin necesidades.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Eva H.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 50 year-old Eva H. M.. She is widow with five children, aged between 30 and 17. She has three dependents, who live with her because they are orphans. In 1992, Eva established her crops business. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional stock of crops. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of crops.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas, 47 years old, lives in Beirut with his wife and two children. He owns a sewing shop and specializes in the manufacture of lingerie. Abbas continuously develops his business. For this reason, he has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past 2 years. He has successfully repaid his previous loan on time.

Now, Abbas needs a loan of US$1,200 to purchase a wider variety of fabrics so that he can meet the current demands of his clients in terms of choice and fabric quality.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of lingerie fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of ingredients.  Personal use.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina tiene 74 años D. edad, estudió primer año D. primaria, es casada y madre D. seis hijos, vive en la comunidad D. Machacmarca, Distrito D. Pilcuyo Provincia del Collao.

Es socia del Banco Comunal Ciudad Nueva – Machacmarca, su primer crédito fue D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles aumentando a su capital compró 01 ganado vacuno. Ella desD. los 14 años D. edad se dedica a la venta D. gaseosas, vendiendo en la plaza D. Pilcuyo todos los jueves, también hace negocio D. compra y venta D. ganado vacuno con el apoyo D. su esposo, generalmente compra D. la feria D. Pilcuyo y lleva a la ciudad D. Arequipa y Lima.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles el que pagará en 04 cuotas, tiene planificado comprar 01 cabeza D. ganado vacuno, el que enviará a Arequipa ó Lima para su venta.

Su mayor sueño es que sus dos hijos menores sean profesionales ya que los hijos mayores tienen su familia y no pudieron estudiar por falta D. medios económicos.
texts.en:
Agustina is a 74-year-old married mother of 6 children. She was only able to attend first graD. in elementary school. She lives in the Machacmarca community, in the District of Pilcuyo in the Collao Province.

She is a member of the microfinance institute Nueva Machacmarca. Her first loan was for 500.00 Peruvian soles. Upon increasing her capital, she was able to purchase cattle. From the age of 14, she has been selling soft drinks at the Pilcuyo plaza every Thursday. With her husband’s support, she also buys and sells cattle for a living. She generally buys her cattle at the Pilcuyo market and takes it to Arequipa and Lima.

With this loan of 1,500.00 Peruvian PEN, which she will repay in 4 installments, she plans on purchasing 1 head of cattle, which she will send to Arequipa and Lima to sell.

Her biggest wish is to see her two youngest children become professionals since her older children have their own families now and did not have a chance to study to due lack of financial resources.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Pambiq

texts.en: Pambiq M. is 47 years old. She is married and has three children. With persistence, dedication, and help from her husband, she has been able to make a living by cultivating land. Pampiq specializes in the cultivation of vegetables, such as pomegranates, potatoes, cabbage, and carrots, having learned the necessary skills from her parents. However, Pambiq would like to manage her land even more efficiently in order to make it more productive and to be able to grow different varieties of crops. In order to do so, she is requesting a loan of US$1,000 for purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizers. With the additional income that Pambiq plans to generate, she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarun O., a resident of Trapaing Chhouk Village in Takeo Province, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land upO. which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. O. Veak, is a palm juice collector. In order to increase family income and improve their living conditions, Sarun is requesting a loan to buy cement and hire laborers to build a piggery to start a new business. 

Sarum is 34 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school. Her husband is presented O. the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy cement and hire laborers to build a piggery to start a new business.

loans.name: Khaitgul

texts.en: Khaitgul E. is married and the mother of five children. Her husband works primarily as a specialty fisherman. Because of very difficult conditions at home, she has been compelled to work to help cover household expenses. That is why she started selling basic food items. Given the flood of customer demand, she tried turning to loan sharks for help, but they made her situation worse with their exorbitant interest rates. So she is requesting a loan of 1000 Somoni ($300) as capital to stock and transport food items, in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To increase her range of goods

loans.name: Naem

texts.en: Mrs. Naem S. lives in Bro Vash village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a 61-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is a blacksmith. Another one is a farmer and the youngest attends a local school. Her oldest child lacks the equipment he needs to conduct his business efficiently. In order to improve his productivity, Mrs. Naem S. has applied for a loan to buy him the equipment he needs.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her oldest child's business

loans.name: Nalda Estrella

texts.es:
La Señora Nalda es socia del banco comunal “Las Fronterizas” en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 37 años de edad y es de la ciudad de Huacho, madre de dos hijos estudio hasta el 4to nivel universitario.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años, e inicio su préstamo con 300 soles, que le sirvió de capital en su negocio de elaboración de jugos.
Debido a la necesidad de ampliar su negocio por la demanda conseguida, ahora desea prestarse la suma de 2300 soles para adquirir mas insumos variados y contar con un local para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes;    ello le permitirá incrementar sus utilidades y ayudar al bienestar de sus hijos, por lo  mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por la confianza  y su apoyo a las mujeres.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nalda is a partner from the community bank “Las Fronterizas”, located in the district of Desaguadero of the Chucuito province in the Puno Department. Originally from the city of Huacho, she is 37 years old and mother of two sons. She attended college until the 4th level. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past two years and she has launched her juice business with a loan in the amount of 300 soles. Thanks to increasing demands, she now wishes to obtain a loan in the amount of 2300 soles that will be used to purchase additional assorted producer goods and a better suited place of business to improve customer service. This will allow her to optimize her business potential and benefit her children's upbringing. She is very appreciative of the trust and support given to women that belong to the Manuela Ramos Movement.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase additional assorted producer goods and a better suited place of business to improve customer service.

loans.name: Mrs. Sreang Lang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of eleven people, is located in Trapang Buon village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Sreang L. is a village bank borrower that has been selected by the group members and the loan will be used for many different purposes. For instance, Mrs. Sreang L. is requesting the loan to buy more fish for her current business which is going well. Her husband, Mr. Mao Da, is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectar and cultivates rice for a living. Mrs. Sreang L. is 42 years old and the mother of five children. Two of the children help their father with the farming while the remaining three are attending the local school. Mrs. Kmao Ur and Mrs. Voeurn M. who are group guarantors are also presented in the picture with other village bank members.

Eight members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthL. payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mr. Sok S., 39, and his wife, Mrs. Im Proeung, 45, live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1993 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. One of their sons is married and lives outside the family home. Their daughter is a garment-factory worker. One son is a construction worker and the youngest one attends school.

Sok has been a fisherman for 10 years, a skill he learned from his brother. He fishes from the lake nearby his house. Mrs. Im Proeng sells the fish that her husband caught at a market in Phnom Penh.

Sok is asking for his first loan of $800 to buy a motorbike to carry fish for sale and to build a fence around his house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to carry fish for sale and to build a fence around his house

loans.name: Elenoa

texts.en: Elenoa S., 38, is married and has six children.  She has three years of experience in the fishing business. She sells fish to the village people four days a week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145 USD).  SPBD loans are Elenoa’s only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She will use part of the loan to buy fishing equipment and and part of the loan to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: Purchase fishing equipment and pay for children's school fees.

loans.name: Reginaldo

texts.es: Reginaldo tiene 33 años, vive con su pareja, fruto de su amor tienen tres hijos, con los que viven en su casa propia. A los 20 años se dedicaba a abrir trochas, trabajando para sus vecinos, era experto en despojar todas las vegetaciones a su paso. Posteriormente sembró media hectárea de achote, lo que le permitió acumular dinero para arrendar una chacra a la que prestó toda su atención y dedicación. Ahora, con la ayuda de su esposa su trabajo es más placentero, y en todo este tiempo está tratando de incrementar cada uno de sus cultivos. Su única dificultad es no contar con terrenos propios, pero tiene en mente que de salirle bien su primera cosecha de café, su meta inmediata es la compra de una o dos hectáreas, para que con el tiempo pueda incrementar su producción con la seguridad abonar y fertilizar las chacras que cultive, para que sus cosechas le sean muy rentables, y pueda brindarle comodidad y bienestar a su hogar. Reginaldo demuestra ser un integrante muy activo de su banco comunal, siempre está dispuesto de brindar cualquier servicio. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, donde siempre pagó en cada fecha señalada. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de “composta”, que es la mezcla de materia orgánica con minerales, en su afán de fertilizar las chacras que está sembrando.
texts.en:
Reginaldo is 33 years old and lives with his wife, with whom he has three children. The family lives together in their own home. At 20 years old he made a living clearing land, working for his neighbors. He was an expert in stripping vegetation. Later, he planted a half-hectare of achiote (a typical regional berry) which allowed him to earn money so he could lease a farm to which he could devote all his attention and dedication. Now, with the help of his wife, his work is more pleasant, and at this time he is trying to increase every one of his crops. His only difficulty is that the land is not yet his own, but keep in mind his first coffee harvest went well. His immediate goal is to buy one or two hectares so that with time he can increase his production with the security to fertilize his own crops so that his harvests are very profitable and he can provide for his family's comfort and well-being.

Reginaldo shows himself to be a very active member of his community bank and is always available to provide whatever service is needed. This is his second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he has always made payments on time. The money he is requesting will be use to purchase compost, organic material enriched with minerals, in his quest to fertilize the crops he is planting.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Chacco.
