Alejandrina es casada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Alejandrina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en  general, además Alejandrina se dedica a la agricultura de verduras que luego vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Alejandrina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, fideo y azúcar.
Los sueños de Alejandrina son tener más capital para surtir su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the Chacco Communal Bank. Alejandrina is married, 50 years old and has 4 children. Alejandrina has a store in her home where she sells general groceries, in addition Alejandrina is dedicated to growing vegetables that she then sells in the supply market in the city of Ayacucho. Alejandrina needs a loan of 900 soles to invest in the purchase of rice, pasta and sugar. The dreams of Alejandrina are to have more capital to fully stock her business and provide a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, pasta and sugar

loans.name: Mairaj Ishaq Group

texts.en:
Mairaj baji is a citizen of a city named Vehari, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house in this city and has been living in it with her family for 10 years. Mairaj baji is a very caring lady. She cares for her family a lot and gives them true love. Her husband belongs to an animal selling business. He buys buffalos and sells to the customers. She is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo to increase the profit of her husband’s business.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell. Jamila baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy items (scissors, chairs and tables) for her salon. Maqsoodan baji wants a loan to buy mason tools.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for selling

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fayez is a 20-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Fayez owns a restaurant. He does all types of sandwiches. Fayez is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a refrigerator and raw materials. This is the first time that Fayez has requested a loan.  
Fayez is special in his work because he is the only restaurant in his region. His clients are people from his village. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash. Fayez decided on doing his business because he learned it when he studied hotel management. In the future, he plans on expanding his business in order to get more revenue.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and raw materials.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.en: Madeleine Y. is an entrepreneur in Kigali, Rwanda. She offers secretarial services to the public at her shop. She is pictured here with her computer and paper-cutter where she performs services for others in her area. Madeleine is married with one two-year-old child. Her and her husband’s combined monthly income is currently at just 200,000 Rwandan francs (FRW). So, after two years in the business, Madeleine has requested her first loan with Vision Finance Company of 500,000 FRW to help her with the expansion of her business.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Davagsumberel

texts.en:
Davagsumberel T. is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His daughter is 19 years old and studies in a local university, and his 13-year-old son is a high school student.

Davagsumberel T. runs a small car repair shop. He offers various car services including diagnosing, repairing various vehicles and selling second-hand car accessories. He started his car repair shop in 2007 with his small capital of 350,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). Since then, his business has grown exponentially and his business capital currently exceeds 1,800,000 MNT. Since his repair shop is located just next to the main road in the town, he is usually busy with many customers. In addition, when he has too many orders, his wife and son help him in his business. He says that he would like to expand his business and become a full-service car-repair shop in the town.

He requests a loan to purchase more second-hand accessories for his repair shop.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts for his business

loans.name: María Blanca Rosa

texts.es: María Blanca Rosa C. D. G.  vive en Sensuntepeque, municipio en el  departamento D. Cabañas. Debido a dificultades económicas, su esposo se ha visto obligado a llevar dos trabajos, uno D. agricultor y otro D. albañil. Blanca, además D. criar a sus dos hijos D. tan solo 5 y 7 años,  le ayuda manejando una humilD. venta ambulante D. productos por catalogo. El trabajo ambulante es muy pesado para María, que sale a las calles diariamente desD. las 7am a vender sus productos, cuya demanda ha empezado a crecer. María y su familia solicitan un préstamo para ampliar su mercadería y poder así ofrecer mayor cantidad D. productos, que la generen nuevos ingresos y un presente más estable.
texts.en:
María Blanca Rosa C. D. G. lives in Sensuntepeque, a municipality in the Cabanas department. Because of economic difficulties, her husband has found himself having to work two jobs, one as a farmer and one as a bricklayer. Maria, in addition to raising their two children, who are only five and seven years old, helps him by running a small traveling business that sells products out of a catalog. The mobile business is hard for Maria, who gets out onto the streets everyday at 7 am to sell her products, demand for which has started to grow. Maria and her family are asking for a loan to help increase their merchandise so they will be able to offer a larger quantity of products, which will bring in new income and more stability.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business supplies

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosario, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 40 años, 05 hijos, los 05 que aun están bajo su poder y estudian.

Su fuerza  y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 

Las ganancias que genera a diario le ayuda a mejorar el ingreso económico de su familia. Desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su negocio a comprar porque ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad y carisma que le caracteriza. Muy aparte Rosario, también cuenta con un consultorio, ya que ella de profesión es Odontóloga, cuenta con su propio consultorio.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará sacos de arroz y azúcar, fideos, sal y aceite en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Rosario, se siente muy bien, para continuar trabajando y se prepara día a día para asumir los retos  que la vida le presenta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosario belongs to the Communal Bank “Honestidad y Trabajo” (Honesty and Work), which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of 5 dependent children who are students.

Her strength and desire to see her children succeed motivated her to start her own business. She sells groceries out of her home, which is well equipped for accommodating her customers.

Her daily revenues help improve her family’s income. Since starting her business, she has been gaining customers and now has a regular clientele who come by her store every day to shop. Sra. Rosario carries all the products that housewives need and she personally attends to each customer with her kindness and charisma. She also has her own dental practice because she is an orthodontist by profession.

With her loan of 1500 soles, she will buy bags of rice and sugar, noodles, salt and oil in packets, boxes of canned fish of various brands, crates of eggs, and toiletries so that she can continue providing good service to her customers.

Sra. Rosario looks forward to working and preparing every day to meet the challenges life presents. She thanks Manuela Ramos for giving women like her opportunities to develop in the communities where they operate.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to increase her inventory

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie D. is 43 years old and married to Reynaldo D.. Because her husband is a farmer, their main source of income is through farming (they grow rice). Now, at the start of the business, they’re renting the land of a close relative.

Some of their income also comes from selling different kinds of food, and their employed children also give them money from their salaries. Though there are several sources of income, Melanie and Reynaldo focus on farming because it gives them more income. Their earnings need to support their daily needs and also the expenses for the education of their other children.

That’s why Melanie joined and requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc (ASHI), to pay for things that are needed in farming, like fertilizer and pesticide, and also to pay laborers. She is really happy running this business because they love the land that they cultivate. She is hoping that this business will succeed and that they will have a better life.

loans.use: To finance her rice farming business

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Mariana de Jesús García T., es socia del Banco Comunal San Miguel, este banco está  situado  vía al valle a unos 45 minutos a las  afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, vive en la comunidad del mismo nombre,  tiene 24 años de edad, se encuentra casada y tiene dos  hijos de 3 y 2 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como albañil

Mariana  nos cuenta que años atrás su situación económica era muy mala pero que en la actualidad viven un poco más estabilizados, su esposo le ayuda económicamente, no tienen vivienda propia por lo que viven en una casa que su hermano les presta.

Mariana debe distribuir su tiempo en los quehaceres de su hogar,  cuidado de sus hijos, y también se dedica a la cría cuyes, los cuales son vendidos en una necesidad.

Dentro del Banco Comunal San Miguel  las socias se llevan bien entre ellas, han formando un buen grupo de trabajo,  Mariana manifiesta que este es su quinto ciclo  trabajando con la fundación y que les ayuda mucho realizar los pagos por quincena ya que se hace más fácil pagar.

Con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entrega los va a invertir en la  compra de cerdos y alimento para su crianza, luego venderlos y poder ayudar económicamente en su hogar.

Su meta es llegar a tener un local de cabinas telefónicas y computadoras para un Internet.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariana de Jesús García T. is a member of Communal Bank San Miguel. This bank is located on the road to the valley, some 45 minutes from the outskirts of Cuenca. She lives in a neighborhood of the same name and she is 24 years old, married and has two children of 3 and 2 years of age, her husband works as a mason.

Mariana says that years back her financial situation was very bad but now they are a bit more stable, as her husband helps her economically. They do not own a home but they live in a house that her brother lends to them.

Mariana divides her time doing housework, taking care of her children and also breeds cuyes [a hamster-like animal], who are sold as a necessity.

The members of Communal Bank San Miguel, get along very well with one another as they have formed a good working relationship. Mariana says that this will be her fifth time getting a loan with the foundation and that the semimonthly payments have made it easier for her to repay her loan.

With the loan of FUNDACION ESPOIR (Kiva’s field partner) she will buy pigs and feed for their breeding and then sell them to aid her financial situation at home.

Her dream is to someday own telephone cabins and an internet café.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs and food for their breeding.

loans.name: Afisheitu

texts.en: Afisheitu is 40years old she is married and mother of five children. All her five children are in school in the community where they live. She is resourceful mother who works very hard to provide food and support for her business.  She is a petty trader and sells in the local area market. She enjoys selling, a business through which she makes a living. She sells items like cooking oil, pepper, spices, gari cereal etc. on top of a table in the market. She sometimes hawks with the goods when business is slowed in the market. She takes stock of goods from the nearby villages. She is requesting for the loan to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, spices, pepper, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: This is Michael K. from northern Sierra Leone. He is forty-five years old and married with five children. Michael’s children are attending primary and secondary schools. His wife is a businesswoman. Michael wants a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to purchase house-building materials.

loans.use: Buy house building materials like cements, iron corrugated zincs, etc

loans.name: Petrona

texts.en:
Petrona M. is from the village of Misom in Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Petrona is widowed and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Petrona Wilma bakes and sells bread. Petrona has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Petrona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Petrona is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional equipment for baking bread. This will be Petrona's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy equipment for baking bread

loans.name: Affiwa

texts.fr: N. Affiwa est née en 1968 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Affiwa est mariée à AMOUHOUE Paul, un électricien bâtiment, et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Affiwa vit seule et assure seule les charges de la famille. C'est depuis 2 ans que Affiwa réside à Lokokokoumè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Affiwa n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Affiwa mène depuis 05 ans environs comme activité la vente de céréales (riz, haricot, maïs, etc.) à son domicile. Affiwa s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et à Djouda au Bénin. Affiwa est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. C’est pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et renforcer davantage son activité, que Affiwa sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Affiwa N. was born in 1968 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She's married to Paul AMOUHOUE, a building electrician, and she's the mother of three children who all attend school. Affiwa lives alone and provides for the family on her own. For two years, Affiwa has been residing in Lokokokoumè, in the commune of Sèmè-Podji in Benin. She never attended school. For about five years, she's been selling cereals (rice, beans, corn, etc) at her house. Affiwa gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international market in Benin, and in Djouba in Benin. She's a long time client of Kiva's partner, Alidé, who repays her loans without problems. In order to bolster her working capital and strengthen her business, Affiwa is seeking her third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals (sacks of rice, white and red beans, and corn)

loans.name: Estanislada Petrona

texts.es: Esta señora tiene 5 créditos con Fundación, ella está muy contenta por los financiamientos que se le otorgaron pues está muy agradecida con esto. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que sus inicios fueron muy difíciles a pesar de las circunstancias esta Señora ha sabido administrar muy bien su negocio y siempre se propone salir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de ropa, calzado, perfumes, vestidos y trajes por lo que se acerca la temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Estanislada has had 5 loans through the Fundación Leon. She is very happy with the financing that they have provided, and she is very grateful for that. Her business is selling general merchandise, and she has been working at it for more than 6 ears. It was very difficult at the beginning, but in spite of the circumstances, she has known how to manage her business very well, and she is always proposing ways to move it forward. The loan that she is seeking for working capital will be used for purchasing clothing, shoes, perfumes, dresses and suits in anticipation of the upcoming Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr: C. H. Anna est née en 1990 et réside au quartier Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis une dizaine d’année. C’est une célibataire qui n’a pas encore d’enfant. Anna vit seule et assure seule ses besoins. Anna n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la coiffure. Anna vend également des produits de coiffure (mèches, tissages, etc.), par le système de distribution. C’est à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin, et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Anna s’approvisionne. Anna a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Anna sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour agrandir son activité et constituer progressivement une épargne. Cette épargne lui servira plus tard à ouvrir son atelier de coiffure.
texts.en:
Anna C. H. was born in 1990 and has lived in the Fiégnon district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for the past ten years. She does not have any children, and must support herself because she lives alone. Anna did not go to school, but she did learn how to be a hairdresser. Anna also sells hairdressing products (highlights, hair extensions, etc.) via the distribution system. Anna gets her supplies at Lomé in Togo, a country that borders Benin, and also at the Dantokpa international market in Benin. Anna has previously obtained two loans from ALIDé, and both have been fully repaid. Anna is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to expand her business and increase her savings. She plans on using her savings open her own hair salon in the future.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hairdressing products (highlights, hair extensions, etc.)

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. sells fresh fish at Elmina near Cape Coast. Elizabeth has received junior high education.  She is divorced and has three children. Elizabeth has been selling fresh fish since 2001. She is responsible for the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and reinvest and also complete her building.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish for sale

loans.name: Dervina

texts.en:
Dervina P. is from the village of Tablon, Digkilaan Iligan City. She is 36 years old. Dervina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Dervina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Dervina has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Dervina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dervina is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Dervina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tablon, Digkilaan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali has worked as a builder since 2003. He started this occupation when he was only 13 years old to help his father in raising his three brothers and sisters.

Ali’s occupation helps him in providing better life conditions. Concerning his young age, he has good experience in his work and he has a great demand from a good number of customers.

Today, Ali is requesting $1,000 to buy a steel cutter and some tools needed to expand his business productivity.

loans.use: To buy a steel cutter and some needed tools

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr: H. Fatima est née en 1982 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Fatima est mariée à SESSINOU Nassif, un transitaire, et n’a pas encore des enfants.  Fatima vit ensemble avec son mari au quartier Sènadé à Cotonou depuis deux ans.  Fatima n’a jamais fréquenté l’école.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Fatima vend des pagnes par le système de distribution.   Elle a cinq ans d’expérience dans ce domaine et s’approvisionne à Lomé au Togo, pays voisin du Bénin.  C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois crédits qui ont été bien remboursés à ALIDé. Fatima sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, pour renforcer son activité et accroître sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Fatima H. was born in 1982 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She's married to Nassif SESSINOU, a freight agent, and doesn't have children yet. She's been living with her husband in the Sènadé neighborhood in Cotonou for two years. Fatima never attended school. To provide for herself, she sells pagnes (colorful African cloth) through the distribution system. She's got a five years experience in this field, and gets her supplies in Lomé, in Togo, a country that borders Benin. She's a former client of Kiva's partner, ALIDé, who already benefited from three loans that were repaid without problems. Fatima is now seeking a fourth loan from ALIDé, in order to bolster her business and expand her clientele.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza J. is from the village of Binaliwan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 25 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Analiza owns and operates a business selling "RTW" or Ready To Wear items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Analiza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bose

texts.en:
Bose sells groceries and foodstuffs. Her shop is opposite her house and this makes it very easy for her to access at any time of the day. She opens her shop early and closes late in the evening every day. She started this business seven years ago. She is very happy with her business because she is able to support her husband in taking care of the family.

Bose wants to expand her business by buying more groceries and foodstuffs to sell, as this attracts a discount, attracts more customers and improves her profit. She hopes for the loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell.

Bose is married with three children and she is 30 years old. The child with her in the photo is her youngest child who is two years old. Bose appreciates all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Zainab is a 56-year-old woman who lives in the city of Lahore in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 

She is uneducated because her parents were not able to afford to send her to school.  She is a hardworking lady. She manages her household chores and she helps her husband in his dairy business. Her husband's name is M. S.. He has been doing this work for over 25 years.  They both get up early and help each other get milk. Presently, they have a buffalo. They get milk from it and then her husband goes to the milk shops to sell the milk. Their income helps them to meet their financial expenses.

Zainab has given birth to two kids: one son and one daughter. Her son is 28 years old and works in a factory on a monthly wage. Her daughter is 13 years old and stays at home to help with the domestic chores. Her son also helps to pay the financial expenses of their house. Zainab and her husband feel good about his positive behavior towards the family.

Zainab has fully repaid her first loan to Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to purchase another buffalo to expand their dairy business.

loans.use: To purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Née en 1957 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, K. Julienne vit depuis 23 ans environs au quartier Agblangandan dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Julienne est mariée à MIWAKOUNOU Paulin, un revendeur. Le couple a cinq enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Agblangandan. Julienne vient en aide à son mari, et supporte avec lui les différentes charges familiales. Julienne n'a pas été à l'école. Il y a près de treize ans que Julienne vend du pain à son domicile. Julienne gère également un cafétéria. Julienne est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurs qu'elle avait obtenu de ALIDé. Julienne désire rehausser son activité et acheter d'autres produits (œufs, etc.) pour son cafétéria, ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Compte tenu du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose, Julienne sollicite une fois encore l'appui financier de ALIDé, pour agrandir son activité et accroître sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1957 in Porto Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, Ms. Giulia K. has lived for about 23 years in the Agblangandan district in the town of Seme-Podji.  She is married to Mr. MIWAKOUNOU Paulin, a retailer. The couple have five children, who are all in school.  The family lives in Agblangandan.   She helps out her husband, and with him, she covers the various family expenses.  Julienne did not attend school.  For about thirteen years, she has been selling bread out of her home.  She also runs a cafeteria.  She is a former ALIDé client who has repaid her past loans obtained from ALIDé.  She would like to enhance her business and to buy other goods (eggs, etc.) for her cafeteria.  This will enable her to meet the demands of her customers.  Given the few financial means at her disposal, Julienne is again requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to expand her business and to increase her customer base. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bread and trays of eggs for the cafeteria

loans.name: Gachbai

texts.en:
Gachbai M., 51, is married and the father of eight children. He and his family live together in an apartment in Hovd province, Mongolia. Six of his children attend local secondary and primary schools.
Gachbai operates a horseshoe manufacturing business. He went into business as an iron goods maker in 1991, and since that time has been operating his business successfully. Currently, he is able to make 20 horseshoes per day. In addition, he operates a taxi service and a vegetable planting business. Gachbai has his own plot of land in Buyant soum, where his wife plants vegetables. He and his wife sell the vegetables during the autumn. Gachbai has a cow as well, and sells milk to earn extra income. He is able to sell 20 liters of milk per day. He is a very hardworking person who has great communication skills. Gachbai is requesting a loan of 1,600,000 MNT to buy and plant more vegetables.

loans.use: To buy and plant more vegetables

loans.name: Ccori - Chuspa Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CCORI - CHUSPA”; Nuestros socios viven en el distrito de Urubamba, pertenece al departamento y ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. MARINA; ella tiene 34 años, la socia es conviviente, ella estudió solo en el colegio primaria y secundaria, tiene 4 hijos, Nuestra socia tiene un taller de costura  en su casa, ella acondicionó un pequeño espacio para poner su máquina de coser y un exhibidor de prendas que ella misma elaboró, su conyugué compra y vende madera, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar material de trabajo para su costurería, como hilos y telas. Nuestros otros socios comparten sus actividades con el comercio minorista, la artesanía, servicio de moto taxis, docencia, albañilería, abarrotes y compra y venta de animales menores.

Los socios agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These individuals belong to the communal bank "CCORI-CHUSPA." They live in the Urubamba district, in the city and department of Cusco. Marina is a member who is 34 years old. She lives with a partner and has 4 children. She completed her studies only through secondary (high) school. She has a dressmaking workshop in her home. She set up a small space in her home where she has her sewing machine and a display cabinet showing the garments that she has made. Her partner buys and sells wood. She requests a loan to buy material for her dressmaking business such as thread and fabric. The other members are engaged in retail trade, handicrafts, taxi service, teaching, masonry, groceries and the purchase and sale of small animals. The members appreciate and value the support provided through these means, and are committed to making their payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she requests a loan to buy materials for her dressmaking business, such as thread and fabric

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en:
Anatalia A. is from the village of Kitingting in Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Anatalia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Anatalia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Anatalia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Anatalia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anatalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Anatalia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Anatalia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mrs. Suon H. was born in 1976 and is a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Suon H. has been operating a farming business in her village for more tH. fifteen years. She normally raises rice, vegetables and pigs but she is also flexible, doing what is appropriate for the conditions of different seasons. Another part of the family’s income comes from her husband, who sells chickens to earn a living.

Suon H. is married with four single children, all of whom are students and work with her business when they are not studying.

Suon H. will use the Kiva loan to buy piglets for her stall. She also intends to use a part of the loan to order rice to stock for later sale to raise income.

loans.use: To buy piglets for her stall and rice to store and sell

loans.name: Fiderico

texts.en:
Fiderico B. Jr. is from the village of Minongan, Quezon, Bukidnon. He is 30 years old. Fiderico is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Fiderico owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Fiderico has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Fiderico joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Fiderico is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Fiderico from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Emerson

texts.es: Emerson, de 20 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijo alguno. Reside en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tiene su propia casa a base de adobe. Desde muy ayudaba a sus padres en la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo de cacao y café, pero Emerson decidió cambiar por nuevos rumbos, con la finalidad de que pueda retribuir con su familia, por las lecciones de la vida que lo inculcaron. Hoy trabaja en una construcción como albañil y se siente contento con el trabajo que realiza, desde luego que piensa seguir con sus estudios e especializarse en la carrera de ingeniería civil, pero por el  momento continuará con su trabajo. Su plan es terminar sus estudios y estudiar ingeniería civil, con el propósito de que pueda tener mayores oportunidades. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar durante las fechas pactadas, además asegura que existe un buen clima cordial en su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de muebles para acondicionar su casa, y de esa manera mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
20-year-old Emerson is single and has no children. He lives in the locality of Santa Rosa, located in the beautiful Ayacuchana jungle, where he has his own adobe house. Since he was very young he helped his parents with the agricultural activities, specifically the cocoa and coffee crops. However, Emerson decided to take a new path, with the aim of being able to reward his family for the life lessons that they instilled in him. Today he works as a builder in construction, and is happy with the work he does. Of course, he is thinking of continuing his studies and specializing in civil engineering, but at the moment he will continue with his job. His plan is to finish his studies and study civil engineering, with the goal of having better opportunities. This is his second loan with MFP, which he commits to pay back within the agreed dates. Moreover, he ensures that there is a cordial atmosphere in his communal bank. With the loan that he is seeking, he plans to invest in furniture to set up his house, and in this way improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy furniture for his house

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima T., the leader of this group, is 58 and married. She has three sons and a daughter of 18 who is a student.  Fatima and her husband are pensioners. In 1988, Fatima’s farther gave her and her husband one head of cattle, 8 goats, and 5 sheep as a present for their marriage. She decided to start breeding cattle and increase the number of heads of cattle. With the profits from successful cattle breeding, she built a house, married off her two sons, and bought a flat in the capital of Kyrgyzstan (Bishkek). Her profit from cattle breeding is 20,000 per month. She is applying for a loan to build a fence around her house. She will repay the loan with the help of profits received in the future from cattle breeding. This autumn, she is planning to marry off her third son. 

Group members:

Parida I. is treasurer of the group. She is 54 and married. She has 4 children. Her elder son is 21, her first daughter is 18, her second daughter is 15 and her youngest daughter is 12.   Her son is going to graduate this year from Tashkumyr Institute and he combines his studying process with a job as a road worker. Her first daughter is a junior at the Tashkumyr College. In 2002, they made 20,000 som on the resale of coal and used this money for a purchase of one head of cattle and 7 goats. Starting their business with 20,000, they make  8000 som each month. Cattle breeding is mainly the job of Paridas' husband. At present, they have been able to increase their livestock herds to 4 cows, 4 calves, 100 goats and 10 sheep. They applying for a loan in order to buy 7 or 8 sheep to fatten and sell at a higher price.  In the future, with the profits from cattle breeding, they are planning to open a food store and to buy a car for the family.

Azamat R. is 20 and single. He lives with his mother, farther, and two sisters. His little sister is 15 and goes to school. His elder sister is a teacher at the local school. His mother works in Russia. Azamat works in coal during the appropriate season, works as a builder with his farther during the summer period and breeds cattle. During the summer periods when Azamat and his father work as builders, their cattle are under the care of his grandparents on his mother’s side. With the efforts of his grandparents, Azamat has been able to increase the number of livestock in his herd to 4 head of cattle and 16 sheep. Azamat started cattle breeding 4 years ago with an initial investment of 5000 som. Now, this brings in  500 soms monthly. Azamat applied for a loan in order to get funds to rebuild his old cattle shed. With the profits from cattle breeding, Azamat is planning to build his own house and  after that, get married and live a happy married life with his beloved wife.
 
Ernes B. is 26 and married. He has a son  one year old. His wife is a housewife. He is a taxi driver on the road between Jalalabat – Karakul with his own car. Each day he earns 600 som. Besides being a taxi driver, Ernes earns money with cattle breeding. Two years ago, he bought one goat for 750 som. Since that moment, he has increased the number of goats to 4. During summer periods, his wife’s parents take care of their cattle in the mountains where there are better conditions for goats. During winter periods, Ernes breeds goats himself. Now, livestock breeding brings him in 15,000 som monthly. He wants to increase the number of livestock he has. Thus, he is applying for a loan in order to buy more 10 goats. He will fatten them and sell them at a higher price. In the future, with the profits from livestock breeding, he wishes to buy his own house, because now he lives with his parents. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to build a fence around the house

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es agricultora y también se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, su producción de leche es vendida a la planta PIL ANDINA. Tiene un hijo que es veterinario y su codeudor, además es el único que la asiste ya que sus otros hijos viven lejos, además ella enviudó hace tiempo. Solicita su primer crédito en KIVA para la compra de ganado vacuno. Ella vive en el departamento de La Paz.
texts.en:
Carmen is a farmer and also works raising dairy cows and selling the milk to the Pil Andina factory. She has a son who is a veterinarian and her partner in the loan. He is the only person who helps her out since her other children live far away and she was widowed some time ago. She is asking for her first loan through Kiva to buy dairy cows. She lives in the city of La Paz.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy cows

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul O. A. is thirty-one years old and married. His wife is a business lady and they have three children aged between twelve years old and two years old whom they hope to give quality education to the university level. 

His business is located in a residential area with many small businesses called Mishomoroni in Mombasa. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean white beaches. He has a barber shop which he has been operating for the last six years and he has provided employment to one person. 

Besides this business he also has a small mobile phone accessories shop in the same area. He says that this business is good and his major challenge is lack of enough working capital. He works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 40,000 to buy shaving machines and a sterilising machine which will help him serve more clients while giving them good service. He hopes to open many barber shops and be a prominent businessman in future. He describes himself as very honest, faithful and persevering.

loans.use: Shaving and sterilising machines

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fish, meat, chicken, bags of rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Fustina Esi

texts.en:
Fustina Esi A. A. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Fustina is a fish seller at Abura, which she has done for some time now. Her husband is a second-hand clothing trader.  She uses her income to assist her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Fustina will use the loan to purchase more fish for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fustian Esi A. plans to put aside savings. 

The picture shows Fustina with her smoked fish.

loans.use: purchase more fish for sale

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo G. is from the village of Barangay Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 39 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Danilo owns and operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Danilo has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2007, Danilo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danilo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Danilo is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Danilo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Oriflame Group

texts.es:
El grupo Oriflame  lo conforman  tres féminas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras quienes trabajan con Adim por su desempeño y labor y las ha beneficiado tanto de las ofertas de préstamos y el desarrollo de la autoestima a través de los programas de formación. 
La señora  Ghisela M. Hernández de 28 años es una mujer trabajadora que ha sido un asistente dental y de la confección y el vendedor de cosméticos durante 2 años y medio. Hernández es madre de dos niños pequeños de 10 y 4 años de edad para los que trabaja muy duro. Ella va a invertir el préstamo en mercadería de ropas aprovechando la temporada

Los otros miembros del grupo son Rosa María B., el vendedor de los productos Oriflame, y Yessenia Zeledón Guerrero, quien tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Ella quiere seguir trabajando y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group Oriflame is made up of 3 working women, hard-working and entrepreneurial, who work with Adim. Adim has benefitted them enormously with the offer of loans and the development of their self-esteem through the formation programs.

Señora Ghisela M. Hernández is 28 years old. She is a hard-working woman who has been a dental and sewing assistant and cosmetic saleswomen for 2.5 years. Hernández is the mother of 2 small children, 10 and 4, for whom she works very hard. She is going to invest this loan in the purchase of clothing - merchandise - to take advantage of the season.

The other members of the group are Rosa María B., who sells Oriflame products, and Yessenia Zeledón Guerrero, who has a small grocery store. She wants to continue working and improve her circumstances.

loans.use: Threads and cosmetics

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen A. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Allen owns a business selling AMWAY products such as food supplements, skin, car and home care. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Allen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI and is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional AMWAY products. This will be the second loan taken out by Allen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional AMWAY products

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: Herminia, D. 62 años, es una madre D. familia muy  cumplidora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo, su hija y su nieta. El primer negocio que tuvo fue una bodega, pero con el tiempo fracasó; desD. entonces decidió cambiar D. rubro, y ahora expenD. desayuno D. manera ambulante. Es así que todos los días se levanta muy temprano para preparar bebidas nutricionales como: quinua, maca, soya, asimismo prepara sándwich; en el que luego son expendidos en la puerta del colegio D. su distrito. Está contenta con el negocio que tiene, ya que le ha resultado rentable; sin embardo es muy agotador y al final del día su cuerpo siente las dolencias. Par el futuro desea reabrir su antiguo negocio, por instalará la puerta interior D. su bodega. Es su noveno crédito con MFP, y se compromete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, como hasta ahora. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mercadería e insumos para continuar preparando estos alimentos.
texts.en:
62 year-old Herminia is a very reliable mother who lives in her own home together with her husband, her daughter and her granddaughter.  The first business that she had was a small grocery store but, over time, it failed.  She decided to change business and now she sells breakfasts as an itinerant street vendor.  Every day she gets up very early to prepare nutritional drinks such as: 'quinua' (a quinoa drink), 'maca' (a hot drink maD. from maca – a native root vegetable) and soya.  She also prepares sandwiches.  She sells her products at the entrance to the local school.  She is happy with the business that she has since it has proven to be profitable.  However, it is very tiring and, at the end of the day, she feels aches and pains in her body.  In the future, she would like to re-open her old business, installing an interior door to her grocery store.

This is Herminia's ninth loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time as she has up until now.  She will use her loan to buy merchandise and supplies to continue preparing her food and drinks.

loans.use: To buy products and supplies for preparing food and drinks

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 47 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Barouéli, préfecture de Barouéli ; Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce du lait, des habillements et font de la restauration.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur douzième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des têtes d’animaux  abattus dans les abattoirs, du lait et des tissus.                                                                          
ASSAN D. s’approvisionne en têtes d’animaux  quotidiennement avec les bouchers de la place, qu’elle prépare dans la sauce pour ensuite revendre, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Danaya Group ("Confidence") are all married. On average, they are 47 years old and have three children. They live in extended traditional families in the city of Barouéli, prefecture of Barouéli, region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other through ties of kinship.

They sell milk and clothing and work in catering. This is their twelfth solidarity loan which they will use to buy heads of slaughtered animals, milk and clothes.

Assan D. buys every day heads of slaughtered animals from the local butchers. She cooks them in a sauce and sells them, for cash and credit, to a clientele made up of women and men.

She expects to make an average profit of 30,000 CFA francs a month, which she will use to pay the installments of the loan, and provide her family with health care, food and tuition fees. Any remaining amount will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy heads of slaughtered animals

loans.name: Norma Beatriz

texts.es: Norma Beatriz F. de 33 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, ella vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 13 y 4 años de edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. Norma posee una panadería, la cual desde hace nueve años funciona en su casa, su esposo le ayuda a elaborar el pan, que posteriormente sale a repartir a todos sus clientes, quienes tienen negocios como tiendas y pequeños superes, en donde obtiene pedidos muy grandes. El deseo de Norma es crecer aún más en el negocio, de manera que pueda atender mayor cantidad de clientes, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo, a través del cual pueda comprar harina por mayor, levadura y todos los productos que se utilizan para la elaboración del pan, en cantidades grandes para obtenerla a menores precios. Esto sería de mucho beneficio tanto para su negocio como para su familia quien depende absolutamente de la panadería, ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos que poseen, razón por la cual se esfuerza día con día para brindar el mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Norma Beatriz F. is 33 years old and she lives in the city of Arce, located in the department of La Libertad. She lives together with her husband and two children, aged 14 and 4.  They are both in school. Norma has a bakery that she has been running from her home over the past nine years. Her husband helps her make bread, which she later distributes to her clients who own convenience stores and small grocery stores. They place large orders. 

Norma's wish is to expand her business even more, to be able to serve larger numbers of clients.  To this end she requests a loan. She will be able to purchase flour in wholesale, yeast and all the other products that they use to make bread in large quantities and to obtain volume discounts.

This will be of great benefit to their business and to her family who depend completely on this bakery. It is the only source of income and it is the reason why she works hard day after day to provide her clients with the best service.

loans.use: To purchase flour and other ingredients for her bakery.

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 25-year-old married man with one child, living in a rented house in Hioma, Uganda. He has a vision of educating his child to the masters level.

He has a business of selling clothing in markets and has been doing it for four years. He started this business with savings from welding. He faces a challenge of bad debtors and wishes to have his own shop in the future. 

Moses needs the loan to buy more clothes for reselling,

loans.use: Buying more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Puissance De Philibert 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Roberto  est le coordinateur  de son groupe Puissance de Philibert

  Il est marié et il a 2 enfants.

Roberto  habite dans la région philibert d’Haiti il n’a pas de l’éléctricité   et de l’eau est très limitée.

Roberto a dirigé son charbon pendant les dernières 3  années.

   Avant  de commencer ce commerce, Roberto  était un professeur

Roberto voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir à bois; et des sacs transport

Roberto  espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à progresse

Des autres membres de puissance de Philibert  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme  Charbon; poison; vertement et produit divers

Roberto dit que son défi principal  est manquement  de l’argent

Roberto  dit que son but   principal   être devenir un grand commerçant  et est  faire plus de bénéfice son rêve est d’acheté  des bœufs.
texts.en:
Roberto  is the coordinator of his group called "Puissance de Philibert" (Strength of Philibert). He is married and has two children. He lives in the Philibert region of Haiti. He has no electricity and access to water is very limited. 

Roberto has been running his charcoal business for the last three years. Before beginning this business, he was a high school teacher. He would like to use this loan to buy wood and sacks for transport. He hopes that this loan will help him get ahead. 

The other members of "Puissance de Philibert" need a loan for businesses such as selling charcoal, fish, clothing, and various items. 

Roberto says that his main challenge is a lack of capital. He says his principal goal is to become an important businessman and make more income. His dream is to buy some cattle.

loans.use: to invest in wood and sacks for transport

loans.name: Maria Amada

texts.es:
María tiene 43 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su familia en el caserío San Eduardo, una zona rural a 12 km D. la localidad D. TambogranD., un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización  D. aves D. corral (pavos), los cuales cría en algunos ambientes dentro D. su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Esta actividad la realiza hace tres años, actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. Adicionalmente ofrece en su domicilio la venta D. diversas golosinas. 

María desea ampliar su negocio alimento balanceado D. modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y comprar productos como golosinas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old, married, and lives together with her family in the small village of San Eduardo, in a rural area 12km from the town of TambogranD., an agricultural district located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

María's business is raising and selling poultry (turkeys).  She raises the birds on her property.  When they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to the general public and the traders who visit her area.  She has been in this business for three years.  She currently has a regular and loyal customer base.  She also sells candy from her home.

María would like to expand her business and buy balanced animal feed so that she can increase her sales.  She would also like to buy products such as candy.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed and products for her small grocery store

loans.name: Komang Ngurah

texts.en: Komang Ngurah W. K., 34, lives with his wife and one of his children, who is five years old. His main job is as a motorcycle salesman. Currently, he has a new side job as a distributor of soy milk in a box. Soy milk sells very successful in the market. He needs additional funds to enlarge the business capital of his soy milk business. He will use the loan to buy 50 boxes of soy milk.  One box contains 24 pieces of small boxes. The prise of one box is Rp. 36,000, which he sells at Rp. 40,000. For every box, he makes a profit of Rp. 4,000.  When he does direct selling to customers, he sells pieces for Rp. 2.000 so that he gets a profit of Rp. 12,000 per box. He hopes these efforts will grow so that he can serve more customers.

loans.use: to buy 50 boxes of soy milk

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita L., 58, runs her own variety store together with her husband Wyler.  They have been blessed with two children who are settled and have established their own families.  Every day, Nenita sees to it that she earns well for their daily needs.  They presently live in Sta. Maria, Dasmariñas, Cavite.

Nenita runs a variety store. In the Philippines, the sari-sari store (variety store) allows members of the community easy access to basic commodities at low costs. It is a place to buy candies, canned goods, sachets of shampoo;  cooking oil, salt and sugar are often repackaged into Php5-Php10 per pack.  She has been in this kind of business for years now.  Monthly, she earns an estimated net income of around Php 8,000.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 21,000 loan.  She plans to use this amount to pay for the purchase of additional grocery items to restock her inventory.  Nenita believes an increase on her earnings will result from the proper use of this loan.

Nenita desires her family to stay strong, to have harmonious relationship always, and remain healthy physically.  As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Mary Wanjiku

texts.en:
Mary is 57 years old.  She has been practising farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.    She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend.  This will be her first loan.  She plans to use this loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Mary hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Liberere

texts.en: Liberere is 31 years old. She has three children who are between the ages of 3 and 1 year old. She is married to businessman. She owns a shop in which she sells different kinds of items including rice, sugar, flour, biscuits, water, etc. This business has helped Liberere to feed her family, and she has done this business for four years. She is requesting a loan to buy more sugar, flour, rice, etc., in order to make more profits. With the profits, she plans to make some savings.

loans.use: to buy items such as sugar and flour.

loans.name: Hazel Jane

texts.en:
Hazel Jane is from the village of Bugo, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 24 years old and single. To make a living, Hazel Jane owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling firewood in the local community. Hazel Jane has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Hazel Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hazel Jane is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional firewood. This will be the first loan taken out by Hazel Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood

location.town: Bugo, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sardaran's Group

texts.en:
Sardaran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a loader by profession. He does his loading business by using his donkey cart. With the loan, he will purchase a new donkey cart because his current cart has become old and rotten from different areas which doesn't allow him to put goods in it. The new cart will help him to provide better quality services to his clients and improve his income. 

Sardaran is 43 years old and has four children. two of them study while the others stay at home. Sardaran couldn't afford to educate her remaining children due to financial constraints. 

She is hopeful that her husband will be able to bring positive changes to his business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for transporting materials

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is a 54-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She has been selling groceries from her door for 10 years. Her husband is a driver. 

She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing stock and refitting the front of her house. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions. She also hopes to be able to save part of the income she earns in case the family encounters any future difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase more stock and refit the front of her house

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, the mother of four children and has earned a living for the past year by running a retail shop where she sells candies, biscuits, canned goods and snacks. She is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She is a new member of HSPFI, but is committed to improving and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages and canned goods.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 43 years old, married, and has two children aged 21 and 17. She earns a living through farming and assists her husband in managing their rice field. She helps till their land, plant rice seed, and keep the farm free of weeds and pests. With this loan, she plans to purchase seed, fertilizer, and fuel for their tractor.

In the future, Jocelyn hopes their farm and living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, and fuel for a tractor

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a married woman with five children. Four of her children attend school while one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a retail business selling spare parts to bicycle operators. She also operates a clothes selling business, which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her shop to a hardware shop in the future.

With the 70,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of bicycle spare parts and clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of bicycle spare parts and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
Jamshed lives and works in Tajikistan. He is an active and hardworking man. He is married and the father of one child. Jamshed rented a car from the brand "Gazelle" and he drives it in the local route. He wants to buy his own Gazelle in order to make a good profit and improve his living conditions. For this purpose, he has requested a loan of $2000 USD. Jamshed hopes that the lenders will support him with this purchase.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: 

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History: Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy a “Gazelle” car.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 31-year-old single mother of three schooling children. For the last seven years, she has been operating a salon. 

She was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. This will be her second loan. She has been loaned KES 40,000 and she intends to use the loan amount to buy a blow dryer and refurnish her rental business premises.
 
In future, she aspires for her salon business to expand, grow and be successful.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer and refurnish her rental business premises.

loans.name: La Flor Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama La Flor, está conformado por la señora Gudelia va a comprar con su crédito harina, pintura, bolsa, cinta y aceite para elaborar obleas, la señora Gudelia Elizabeth va a comprar ropa, pantalones, blusas, faldas, las señoras María Teresa y Efrén Angélica van a comprar dulces alegría, palanqueta, cocadas, jamoncillo, gálea, obleas, tamarindo, cocos, camotes, garapiñados, la señora Manuela  Elizabeth va a comprar obleas, bolsas, diurex, cajas para recortar obleas. La señora Gudelia Elizabeth tiene 42 años de edad, ella estudio hasta el 3er. año de secundaria, ella es casada tiene tres hijos 2 hombres y una mujer  los dos más pequeños estudian la secundaria, ellos viven en un pueblo muy conocido porque siembran y elaboran el amaranto hacen los dulces palanquetas de alegria, jamoncillo, obleas, granola, palanqueta de cacahuate, dulces de coco, etc. Ella tiene una tienda de ropa y regalos, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar ropa pants, blusas, faldas, pantalón para caballero, camisas playeras ropa interior para niños, peluches y uniformes para los niños de primaria y secundaria, ella inicio su negocio hace 4 años, su hermana le dijo que pusieran una tienda de ropa y regalos y cada una de ellas aporto la cantidad de $7,000.00 y fueron a la ciudad de México a surtirse de mercancía, su negocio es importante porque tiene trabajo e ingresos para la familia y la mercancía no se echa a perder, ella le gusta su negocio porque le ha ayudado económicamente a su familia, a sus hijos no les falta nada como vende uniformes de ahí toma lo que les falte para el uniforme de la escuela, cuando ella sale a cobrar sus hijos le ayudan a atender a los clientes. Su negocio es popular por el buen precio en sus productos y las facilidades de pagos a sus clientes, su negocio enfrenta los desafíos de costos elevados en los uniformes los proveedores les aumentan el precio el iniciar las clases. Ella tiene sus sueños y esperanzas en seguir vendiendo y que sus hijos sigan estudiando. Las integrantes del grupo están muy agradecidas con Kiva y Fundación Realidad por los préstamos que le dan y que nos sigan apoyando con sus préstamos.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called “La Flor” (The Flower) and consists of the following members: • Sra. Gudelia will use her loan to buy flour, paint, bags, ribbons, and oil for making wafers. • Sra. Gudelia Elizabeth will buy clothing, trousers, blouses, and skirts. • Sras. María Teresa and Efrén Angélica will buy amaranth candy, peanut brittle, macaroons, milk candy, wafers, tamarind candy, coconuts, sweet potatoes, and caramelized peanuts. • Sra. Manuela Elizabeth will buy wafers, bags, tape, and boxes for repackaging the wafers.

Sra. Gudelia Elizabeth is 42 years old and studied through the third year of high school. She is married and has three children, two sons and a daughter. The two younger children are high school students. They live in a town that is known for growing amaranth used in making amaranth candy, milk candy, wafers, granola, peanut brittle, coconut candy, and other sweets. Gudelia Elizabeth has a store where she sells clothing and gifts. She is requesting a loan to buy clothes such as trousers, blouses, skirts, men’s slacks, boys' undershirts, plush toys, and uniforms for elementary and high school students. Gudelia Elizabeth started her business four years ago. Along with her sister, she established a clothing and gift shop and each of them contributed $7000 which they used to travel to Mexico City to stock up on merchandise. This business is important to Gudelia Elizabeth because it provides work and income for her family. Also, the goods are not perishable. She enjoys her business because it has helped her family financially. Her children do not lack anything because they take any school uniforms that have not been sold. When Gudelia Elizabeth goes out to collect payments, she takes her children with her so that they can attend to the customers. Her business is popular because of the good prices for her products and the payment options offered to her customers. The challenges her business faces include the rising costs of uniforms from her distributors, who mark up the price before classes start. Gudelia Elizabeth hopes and dreams of continuing her sales so that her children can continue studying.

The members of this group are very grateful to Kiva and Fundación Realidad for the loans that have been provided and the continued support.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, skirts, men’s slacks, boys' undershirts, plush toys, and school uniforms.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 61-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child who is still attending school. He has owned a mini-market in his village since 2007. He sells dairy products, juices, soft drinks, bread etc. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his store’s inventory of food products and groceries. In the future, he plans to enlarge his shop and add new foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more food products and groceries to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 53 years old and has two children. She works hard to proviD. for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Veronica has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal and farming rice.

Veronica aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Ranogul

texts.ru: Раногуль  трудолюбивая женщина, она работает швеёй  в ателье. Она занимается реставрацией верхней одежды: брюк, костюмов, халатов, пальто. Раногуль самостоятельная женщина, этой деятельностью она занимается сама. Раногуль  выполняет  работу хорошо, она старается  привлечь как можно больше клиентов. Раногуль хочет расширить  бизнес, для этого ей нужно купить швейную машину. Она просит займ на сумму 1600$ США. Покупка новой машины поможет ей развить бизнес, расширить возможности. Раногуль надеется на вашу поддержку и заранее благодарит вас.
