texts.en: Ranogul is a hard-working woman, who works as a seamstress at a tailor shop.  She is involved in restoring outerwear, such as pants, suits, robes and coats.  Ranogul is an independent woman and runs this business by herself.  Ranogul does her work well and tries to attract as many customers as possible.  She wants to expand her business and needs a sewing machine to achieve this goal.  She is requesting a loan in the sum of $1600.  Purchase of a new sewing machine will help her develop her business and expand possibilities.  Ranogul hopes to receive your support and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas was able to grow her business with her previous loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings from Faulu Kenya.  Currently, she has employed two people to assist her in the business. She says that Faulu Kenya has been a blessing to her business. 

Dorcas wants to start a business making and selling pop-corn to generate more income for her family.  Hence, she has requested 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a popcorn machine.

loans.use: To buy a popcorn machine

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en:
Clemence is a married woman with three school-going children. Her husband is a teacher who contributes to the provision of basic family needs. Clemence owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees for her children.

Clemence has operated a retail shop for the past 4 years. Her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge with break-ins by thieves. She dreams of expanding her shop into wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 Clemence to wants purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice and matchboxes for her shop. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice and matchboxes for her shop.

loans.name: Simana B Group

texts.en:
Michael is the facilitator of the Simana B group. His group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Michael takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to have quality farm produce and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Michael had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Michael was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Michael and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance. With income from maize sales, Michael will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Simana B group will each plant maize plots between half and 1 acre of land.
In the photograph above, Michael is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mhamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 27-year-old single Lebanese man. He’s the only child of his parents and they’re all living together. He’s a hard worker, ambitious and caring for his parents' situation, or else he would not provide any help for his family. They’re really thankful for having such a man. 

Mohamad has owned his own coffee booth since 2009, and until now he’s taking advantage of every single moment to benefit and develop his business. Today, he’s requesting to borrow $3000 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to open his own cafe. He’s well known for his delicious coffee, and having his own place will increase his revenues. 

In the future, he plans to open his own restaurant just next to the cafe.

loans.use: To open his own cafe.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Perlita works hard to support her family. She has a basket weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. 
Perlita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy materials for her basket weaving business. Perlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her basket weaving.

loans.name: Santa Dorotea

texts.es:
La señora Santa Dorotea  es soltera, tiene 42 años de edad, cursó los estudios de educación primaria, se dedica a la confección de delantales típicos y al comercio, se dedica a la elaboración de delantales, lleva 10 años de experiencia, inició como trabajadora para otro negocio.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas e hilos y de esta forma producir mas delantales y mejorar su negocio, ya que en el futuro espera tener un negocio con trabajadores y con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Santa Dorotea is single, 42 years old, and has a primary education.  She works in trade and also sews traditional aprons for a living.  She has 10 years of experience as she started out working for another business.

She is asking for a loan that she will use to buy thread and cloth to produce more aprons and improve her business. In the future she hopes to have employees and larger earnings.

loans.use: to buy cloth to make traditional aprons.

loans.name: Ameera

texts.en:
Ameera is a 34-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. She is the mother of two children.

Ameera sells clothes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

Ameera is looking to open her own shop to better display her clothes and increase her sales volume.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 42-year-old businessman married to Jane, a businesswoman. They are blessed with three children. John has been selling cereals for the past three years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family.

John is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. John will use the loan to buy dry maize and beans for his business. 

John will use the anticipated profit from the business to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build a store for his grains.

loans.use: To buy dry maize and beans

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther’s group has five group leader farmers and is located in Lugari District. The group leaders in this group represent a total of 78 individual farmers (not pictured) who are each asking for an average loan of 5,349 shillings to purchase a One Acre Fund package for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  As the Kiva group representative, Esther is pictured on the right of the group with her hand raised.

Esther is 52 years old and has been a farmer for 10 years.  Esther works as a farmer to provide for her six children.  The community and other farmers know Esther as friendly.  Other than farming, she is also involved in her community in the prayer group.  Esther described her harvest last year as not with One Acre Fund, but hopes she can have a better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.							

Esther joined One Acre Fund in 2013, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Esther joined One Acre Fund so that she could get the best seed prices.  Because she wants to help more farmers, Esther has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. In the future, Esther hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send children to school and invest in a business.  							

Esther and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To allow farmers the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Kaweluwelu Group

texts.en:
This is the group loan for Kaweluwelu; it has seven women with the age range of 30 to 58 years old. The women are married and some are widows with children and orphans who go to school.  Women of Kaweluwelu have successfully repaid previous loans from MicroLoan Foundation. They started their businesses for different reasons, for example to be able to pay school fees for their families and to support their families financially. 

Generally the women of Kaweluwelu run small-scale businesses such as raising and selling chickens; some own market stalls selling kaunjika (second-hand clothes) and some run grocery shops selling assorted items. Their husbands are also doing businesses and some are employed. The group is requesting this loan from Kiva lenders to purchase chicken feed, bales of Kaunjika (second-hand clothes), renovating the Kraal (corral) and labour charges.

 Mirriam, 56, is married to Cosmas, 63 years old. She is in a purple blouse with a file folder in her hands. Mirriam has four children and four orphans who go to school. She raises and sells broiler chickens and her husband owns a grocery shop. She wants this loan to buy chicken feed from Mzuzu city and to renovate the Kraal. The remaining amount will be used for labour charges for renovation. She works from home and her family members help in the daily activities.

Since she started receiving loans, she is able to increase her flock of chickens raised. She started with 50 chicks and now she has 150 chickens. In the future she has plans to use any profit made to build a house for rent. Mirriam believes that the training she received on ‘Business Management’ will help her to achieve what she wants from her business. As a woman she has managed to purchase household equipment and she is able to feed her family without involving her husband.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed

loans.name: Avo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AVO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même maison. La représentante du groupe, nommée Assana (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 47 ans n’a pas fréquentée. Assana est mariée a un chauffeur du nom de Ousséni. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Assana vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Assana vend des sacs du riz, de l’huile, des savons et des pâtes alimentaires depuis huit ans à son domicile. Assana s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Assana ensemble avec les membres du groupe AVO sollicite pour une première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de riz et de l'huile végétale

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 47 years old and has four children. Nena is married and has two children who are in school.

Nena is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Nena requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Nena has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Salomey

texts.en: Madam Salomey T. lives in Dodowa, a community in the Dangme West district of the Greater Accra region of Ghana. She sells mainly woven baskets on retail basis. Selling baskets alone is not enough for Madam Salomey T., she wants to include more items in her trade. Her challenge is how to access capital to expand her trade. She is therefore seeking a loan of $700.00 from Kiva to help take her business to a higher level and also to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Five years ago Hilda decided to dedicate herself to becoming a beautician. She is married with an 18 year-old son and three daughters. Her husband works as a welder at a quarry, but his salary does not cover the family's expenses. Hilda therefore decided to earn some extra money to pay the bills and so that her children could stay in school. It is also an area that interests her.

Hilda started off just cutting hair, but after requests from her clients she has prepared herself to offer other beauty treatments. To improve the quality of her service she now needs a loan of $475 which she will use to buy hair dye, salon materials and other products used in her line of work. She promises to repay the loan over a period of 6-12 months. With your help you can contribute to the growth of her business and improve her family's life. They all thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace cinco años Hilda se dedica a ofrecer sus servicios de estilista, ella es casada y tiene un hijo de 18 años y tres hijas, su esposo trabaja como soldador en una empresa de pedrera, pero el salario que recibe no cubría todas las necesidades de su familia, por lo que Hilda decidió obtener un ingreso extra para solventar las obligaciones de su hogar y ayudar a sus hijos a que continúen en la escuela, además este es un oficio que le gusta.

Hilda inició ofreciendo sólo cortes de cabello pero, a petición de sus clientes, se ha preparado para ofrecer otros servicios de belleza, para incrementar la calidad de su servicio ahora necesita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de tintes, materiales de salón y diversos productos que emplea en la elaboración de su trabajo, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Con tu ayuda puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio y mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: To buy products/Compra de insumos

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.ru:
Shafoat buys and resells apricot pits. In Isfar, there is a tradition to crush the pits and take out the soft core called magz. A lot of local entrepreneurs involved in magz trade. Shafoat buys magz at the nearby markets and then resells it at the central market. Shafoat, 42 has 2 children. Her husband works as a collective farmer. His salary is very small, so he helps Shafoat to sell. The workday starts early in the morning and ends at the lunch time. When the trading day is over, Shafoat and her husband transfer the remaining magz home and sort it there to increase its price. Recently, Shafoat received a loan from MicroInvest and increased the volume of magz that she sells. Shafoat plans to use this loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шафоат занимается куплей продажей абрикосовых косточек. В Исфаре принято раскалывать косточки, и извлеченное ядро называется «магз». Куплей продажей «магз»-а занимается много предпринимателей. Шафоат закупает «магз» по окрестным базарам и продает на центральном рынке. Шафоат 42 года, у нее 2 детей. Ее муж работает простым колхозником. Заработная плата маленькая и он тоже выходит на базар и помогает своей жене. Рабочий день начинается рано утром и продолжается до обеденного времени. После окончания базара Шафоат и ее муж перевозят оставшийся «магз» домой и далее сортируют. Это дополнительно увеличивает цену. Недавно Шафоат получила займ в Микроинвест и увеличила количество «магз»-а. Очередной займ она собирается потратить на дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ikah

texts.en: Ikah is 35 years old and is married with two children. She buys fruit from the nearby market and then, together with her husband, resells it. She could earn more income in the festive season. They usually earn $20 per day as an income, but the profit is about $5 per day. She very much needs to receive a $50 loan to buy more fruit. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To buy more fruit

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mrs. Mariela belongs to Comunal Bank Sol Naciente (Rising Sun), at Jr. F. Jhon Kenedy 999 del A. H. Nuevo Paraíso del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. She is 37 years old and has 5 children, her husband is employed on a business where he earns only the minimum salary, so Mariela with the first loan received from Manuela Ramos (S/300.00 soles) decided to set a small place to sell cookies and candy.

Currently she has a small grocery store which she attends with her children, she wakes up very early to prepare breakfast and then attend the store.

With the new loan of $/.1,000 ($333 approx.) which will be pay in 6 months, she will increase her business and will buy 1 box of milk, 1 pack of sugar, 5 boxes of soda, 1 gallon of oil and 2 bunches of plantains.

Mariela is very happy to have her kids in school and help her husband financially.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Mariela pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Naciente, del Jr. Constitución 160 A. H. Nuevo Paraíso del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años y es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo es empleado de una empresa donde solo le pagan el sueldo mínimo, es así que Mariela, con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos (S/ 300.00 soles) decide poner un pequeño puesto para la venta de galletas y golosinas. En la actualidad cuenta con una pequeña bodega, la misma que atiende junto a sus hijos, se levantan muy temprano para hacer el desayuno y después poder atender la bodega, Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000 (US$ 333.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, ampliará el local del negocio y comprará 1 caja de leche, 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 5 cajas de gaseosa, 1 bidón de aceite y dos racimos de plátanos. Mariela esta muy contenta de tener a sus hijos en la escuela y apoyar económicamente a su esposo.

loans.use: To buy diverse merchandise. Compra de productos diversos.

loans.name: Marselina

texts.en:
Mama Ahunga established a ‘duka’ (shop) in 2006, which carries a vast array of stock, made up of both food and non-food items. Miscellaneous is probably the best description. She has already successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA and now requires a third to purchase additional stock in bulk. She is married to husband Elisha, with whom she has four children aged between 12 and 20 years.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation for women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk for her general store

loans.name: Zaur

texts.ru:
Zaur S. was born in 1978 in a village called Padarkylshak of Agsu region. He is single. This hardworking young man is actively leading his own business. He would like to expand his business. This is why he came to Normicro microcredit agency for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Салманов Заур родился 1978 году в село Падаркышлак Ахсуниского района. Холост . Этот трудолюбивый молодой человек активно ведет свой бизнес. Заур хочеть расширят свой бизнес. По этому он обратился в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Mrs. Felicia belongs to the 2000 Women's Comunal Bank, located in the km. 3,800, district of Calleria, in the Ucayali department. She is 41 years old and she is divorced. She has three children, one of which still lives with her. With the first loan of S/. 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos she decided to start selling sweets and sodas. Currently she owns her own stand. Felicia wakes up very early in the morning in order to prepare breakfast for her children, and then she goes and works all day (sometimes even past midnight) in her business. With the loan of S/.2.300 soles, which she will repay in 5 months, Felicia will fix her stand and buy merchandise such as sodas, sweets, and other products. Felicia is a very hardworking woman. She puts all her efforts in order to provide the best for her children and improve her finances. She is very happy and very thankful to Manuela Ramos for all the help that they have provided her.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Felicia pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del 2000, ubicado en el Km. 3,800, distrito de Callerìa, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años, es madre de 3 hijos, el cual uno aún depende de ella y es separada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles, decide invertir en la venta de golosinas y gaseosas. En la actualidad tiene un kiosco. Felicia se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y luego sale para ir atender en su negocio todo el día, inclusive en algunas oportunidades hasta la madrugada. Con el préstamo de S/ 2,300 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en el arreglo de su kiosco y además comprará golosinas, gaseosas, y otros productos. Felicia es una mujer muy trabajadora, todo el esfuerzo es para brindar lo mejor a sus hijos y mejorar su economía. Ella se siente muy feliz y está muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo que le brinda.

loans.use: To fix her stand and buy merchandise.

loans.name: Wanyama West C (Iii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Betty I.. She is currently in the business of running a drug shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more drugs to sell. Betty is 49 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from ages 23 to 29. Each week, Betty makes approximately UGX 12000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for the household necessities. Betty has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Betty is joined in her small group by Hadijah T. and Resty Nabiry. Hadijah T. has a business selling charcoal and wants to add more stock. Resty N. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to purchase a fridge and more items.

loans.use: To add to drug shop business

loans.name: Kimadi

texts.en:
Kimadi is 38 years old and is married with 4 children, ages 16, 9, 7, and 2 years old. Kimadi is an egg seller. She started her business in 2005. Every day, she works from 7:30am to 4pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more eggs for her business.

loans.use: To buy more eggs for her business.

loans.name: Ashurmat

texts.en: U. Ashurmat lives in the high-mountain region of Tajikistan, where agriculture and livestock are common pursuits. Mr. U. Ashurmat, along with many of his fellow villagers, raises and sells livestock. It is the family business that he shares with his wife. He dreams of having a large flock, so Mr. U. Ashurmat has applied to KIVA for a business development loan of 2100 STJ  ($625 USD) to buy a pedigreed bull.

loans.use: To buy a pedigreed bull

loans.name: On

texts.en: Mrs. On P., 28, sells groceries from her house and she earns around $1.5 per day. Her husband, 51, Mr. Im Ourn, earns around $2 per day farming and selling pieces of wood. They have two children and live in Pongror Village, Kampong Cham Province. To expand their business, P. seeks a loan of $300 to purchase farmland for her husband's farming business. The loan will allow them to expand their farming business and improve the family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase farmland for her husband's farming business

loans.name: Vin

texts.en: Mrs. Vin S. and her husband, Mr. Morn Kong, are subsistence farmers in Chhouk Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. They make only a small revenue, because their rice field is small. Mrs. Vin S. wants to expand her rice business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan so that she can buy more land to grow rice. Mrs. Vin S. is 48 and the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others two are enrolled in school.

loans.use: To buy a a rice field in order to expand her rice revenue.
